Con muchos deseos de crecer y desarrollarse en el negocio, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las frutas y verduras y de esta manera mejorar su negocio logrando siempre la satisfacción de todos y cada uno de sus clientes en el negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Isaura Margarita T. is dedicated to her business of selling fruits and vegetable in the city of León, and it is important to point out that she is visited very often by the clients, who she served with great friendliness to the point that they feel very satisfied with her business.

With many desires for growth and development in her business, she has come to Ceprodel to request a loan for purchasing fruits and vegetables and in this way improve her business, in order to always achieve the satisfaction of each and every one of her clients in the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.es:
El señor Baltazar vive con su esposa la señora Cristina y un pequeñín. 
El labora para el tribunal de justicia como jefe de oficiaría de partes desde hace 9 años. 
Y su esposa la señora Cristina es coordinadora de guarderías en el Instituto Medico, mas reconocido del país, donde tiene una antigüedad y experiencia de 28 años. 
Son una familia muy estable económicamente, pero sobretodo se apoyan mutuamente y están muy consolidados. 
Por el momento están tramitando este crédito ya que como están construyendo el segundo piso en su casa, todos los gastos de construcción los han realizando en efectivo, 
Pero les esta haciendo falta la colocación del techo de madera, motivo para esta solicitud.
texts.en:
Señor Baltazar lives with his wife, Señora Cristina, and their little one.

He works for the judicial court as head officiate and has been for nine years. His wife, Señora Cristina, is the daycare coordinator at the most well-recognized Medical Institute in the country, where she has seniority and 28 years of experience.

They are a very economically stable family, but above all they support each other mutually and are very strong.

For the moment, they are arranging this loan because they are constructing the second floor of their home. All the construction costs they have paid with cash, but they still need to lay the wooden roof, which is their reason for this request.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a wooden roof on the second floor of their home

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch S. has been selling fish by mobile transportation around her community for years. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing and buys from her wholesale supplier as well. Her husband is a local fisherman. This couple now lives with four children who are of school-age.

Because this family is lacking tools for fishing, Touch S. requests a loan of $150 as capital to buy additional fishing equipment in order to fish in the ponds. She, her husband, and their child are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing equipment in order for her husband to fish in the ponds

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Soun T. is age 50 and the mother of four children. Two are married and live separately, while the others are single and are still living at home.

Soun T. is a mobile fish-seller, and is earning around of $3 income a day to meet her family’s expenses. In addition, her husband works building wooden houses.

Soun T. owns a pond that she has been digging for a year. Right now, she hopes to raise fish in her pond during this time when fish are commanding the highest price. Due to the lack of capital to do so, she has decided to seek a loan from Kiva to purchase small fish to breed.

loans.use: To purchase small fish to breed in her pond

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia P. is from the village of Danao. She is 60 years old and is widowed. Alicia owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Alicia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
The smiling face shown in the picture is Mrs. S., 36, a mother who is blessed with a daughter who is enrolled in public school. She was married, but has been divorced from her husband for a year.

S. currently owns a sewing machine which she uses to sew the neighbors’ clothing for income. She will be using the loan to purchase more tailoring tools to better support her business. As well, she will buy a bicycle for transportation.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring tools for her business and a bicycle for transportation

loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en:
Batsuuri G. is 37, and a single mother who has four daughters whose ages range from 1 to 18. Her family lives in a "ger" (nomadic housing tent) district on the plot of land she owns in Arhangay, one of Mongolian central provinces. Her eldest daughter works as a waitress at the local restaurant and her next two daughters are attending a high school.

In 2006 Batsuuri started running a handicraft-making business. She buys sheep’s wool, processes it and then makes Mongolian traditional handicrafts. She or her children sells them mostly to tourists. When summer comes she makes more handicrafts to sell tourists as many tourists come to visit Mongolia.

When Batsuuri began running her business, her working capital was 50,000 tugrugs ($1 USD= 1450 MNT). As a result of her hard work, her business capital has increased 200,000 tugrugs. Besides running a handicraft business, to increase her family income, she plants vegetables on the land she owns. She requests a loan to buy raw material such as wool, wire and paint to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase wool, wire and paint for her handicrafts

loans.name: Emmie

texts.en: Emmie B. is from the village of Danao. She is 35 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Emmie owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Emmie has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Emmie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Emmie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en: Noemi D. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 55 years old, married, and has five adult children. Noemi owns and operates a tailoring business, providing specialty tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Noemi joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to finance their farming and to save a portion for future use. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en:
Nergui O. lives with her three teenage daughters (ages ranging between 10 and 17) in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. All her daughters are local high school students. Her husband works on construction in South Korea with a three-year contract. He went to South Korea to seek a better salary and better future for his family.

Nergui has a small retail business in home furniture. She has a small furniture shop in the town and she mostly brings her products from the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been in the furniture retail business since 2005 and has gained some regularly-visiting customers in the town.

In the future, Nergui hopes to open a new furniture store in the town. She says that her ultimate goal is to see all three daughters graduate from university without financial strains. She requests a loan to purchase more furniture from Ulaanbaatar for her business.

loans.use: To buy home furniture from the capital city to sell

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra M. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 49 years old, married, and has two adult children. Alejandra owns and operates a business selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2000, Alejandra joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Alejandra is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 11th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tumenjargal

texts.en:
Tumenjargal O. lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His two oldest sons go to the local community colleges and the youngest daughter is a high school student.

Tumenjargal has a small carpentry shop in the town where he mostly makes a variety of home and office furniture. Most notably, he made all the wooden furniture for the local government house. He made all the office furniture with traditional style.

Tumenjargal started his carpentry business in 2005 with capital of 150,000 MNT. With his profits, he was able to expand his business by adding new machineries. Today, his business capital exceeds 500,000 MNT and locals come to him and order home and office furniture.

In the future, Tumenjargal hopes to expand his small shop to a carpentry factory to produce all sorts of furniture for locals. He requests a loan to purchase wood for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To buy wood for his carpentry business

loans.name: Lenny Love

texts.en: Lenny Love N. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 22 years old, married, and has two infant children. Lenny Love owns and operates a business running a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2008, Lenny Love joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Lenny Love is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn T. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 35 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Merlyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling gasoline in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering and to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to supplement the income of the family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en: Elenita P. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 34 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Elenita owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Elenita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Elenita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Ellaine

texts.en: Ellaine R. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 28 years old, married, and has an infant child. Ellaine owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Ellaine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Kit

texts.en:
Kit S., 39, is married and has five children. She produces and sells Cambodian noodles at her house and makes a daily income of $4 US. Her husband raises pigs for piglets to be sold and makes an income of $2 US per day. S. has three school-aged children. The other two children dropped out of school and are still unemployed, but they are helping with the family businesses.

S. is asking for a loan of $800 US to buy rice for reselling and feed for the pigs they are raising. She hopes that she will be able to increase her income because of the expected boost in production she will get from her investment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy rice and hog feed

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa B. makes a living from providing transportation services to local community members. She is 47 years old, married and has six school-age children. They are from the town of Lopez Jaena. Rosa has been in this business for over four years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn G. tills a 1.5 hectare farm. She works hard to grow rice to be able to feed and clothe her children well. With the income that she has earned from her harvests, she has been able to send all four of her children to school, pay for their tuition and books, and provide for their other needs. Her husband, Domingo, is also a farmer. As parents, they have been dreaming of the best things for their family.

Knowing about CEVI's many services, Emelyn would like to request a loan of 15,000 PHP. She is thinking of using the loan to purchase two sacks of urea, 30 liters of crude oil and other farm supplies. She believes that these materials will go far to improve the yield of her farm.

Emelyn is a client of Community Economic Ventures, Inc.--the first Filipino MFI to go active in partnership with Kiva. She was interested in joining CEVI because they offer insurance coverage services in addition to the loans that they give to their clients.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of urea, 30 liters of crude oil and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Liên Thị Trần (no: 010103060011) was born in 1983. She lives with her husband in Ly Nhan village, Dong Anh community, Ha Noi. Her husband is a driver. She sells rice to people in other villages and has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She is reliable and responsible and has been elected as group leader. She wants to borrow 2,900,000 VND to buy paddy rice to resell.

There are 5 other participants in her group:

Thủy Thị Phạm (no: 010103060014) was born in 1980. She is a seamstress. She needs 2,900,000 VND to buy cloth.

Hằng Thị Ngô (no: 010103060015) was born in 1984. She has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND. She wants to borrow 2,900,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.

Dương Thị Thùy Đỗ (no: 010103060018) was born in 1982. She wants to borrow 348,000 VND to buy food in bulk. 
Thời Thị Trần (no: 010103060012) was born in 1963. She has a monthly income of about 2,500,000 VND. She wants to borrow 2,900,000 VND to buy feed for her pig.

Ngân Thị Phạm (no: 010103060016) was born in 1984. She sells noodle soup every morning. She wants to borrow 2,900,000 VND to invest in her shop.

loans.use: To buy paddy rice and resell

loans.name: Chheoung

texts.en:
Chheoung S., 34, has been involved in a business selling meat, bread and grill eggs since 2007. He sells by motorbike in nearby villages and makes a daily income of $8 US. Together, he and his wife, Leb Pheap, have three school-age children. S.’s wife always travels with him to help with the business.

S. plans to use a loan of $600 US to expand his business. He thinks that when his children are old enough to get more education, he will be able to support them easily with the increased savings and income from investment of his loan.

loans.use: To expand a food business

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma T. is from Brgy, Pandan Gingoog City. She is 34 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Erma makes and sells food. Her main source of income comes from selling specialty foods like "binangkal" (a homemade Filipino bread) in the local community. Erma has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Erma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children. ------------------------------------- About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Buy raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Kheoun

texts.en:
Kheoun C. Serey, 40, has produced rice wine and raised pigs at her house since 1990. She makes about $9 per day. Kheoun and her husband have three school-aged children. He is employed as an officer of a government department involving water supplies in Battambong Province. He has an income of $4 per day.

To improve their standard of living, Kheoun needs a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike and pigs. The motorbike will help her transport her rice-wine directly to customers on time and fast.

loans.use: Buying motorbike and pigs.

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora R. is from the village of Sibugon. She is 31 years old. Adora is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Adora sells home products. Her main source of income comes from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Adora has been in business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Adora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Adora is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her 11th loan from Adora from PMPC. She plans to improve her general living conditions. ------------------------------------- About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Buy raw materials to make products for sale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca T.' ultimate dream is to see all of her children graduate and succeed at whatever profession they take on. She is doing her best to make her farm productive, to finance the growing needs of her family. Rebecca is 37 years old and will do everything to look after her six children.

With her strong entrepreneurial spirit, she is asking for a loan from CEVI to finance her farm. She will use the loan to purchase two sacks of Urea, 30 liters of Crude oil and other farm needs. She thinks the loan will improve the yield of her crops. She expects to double her harvest this year. She was encouraged to join CEVI because it is not limited to loans. CEVI provides training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: Buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Chou

texts.en:
Chou S., 32, selling vegetable in the city of Battambong Province and earns an income $6 per day. S. and her husband are blessed with a lovely child. Her husband works as a teacher at a public school and makes $2 per day.

S. wants a loan of $1000 to buy animal food and ducks to raise. She hopes to better their standard of living and help her child get a better education.

loans.use: Buying animal food and ducks.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao C., a 34-year-old married mother caring for three school-aged children, is an internal staff member of an organization. Another source of family income is her husband, who works in construction. Sao C. and her husband are facing difficulties with transportation, so she is requesting an $800 loan in order to buy a motorbike which she will use for riding to work and the family’s touring needs. Note: Sao C.'s husband is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida M. is from San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Zenaida is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Zenaida runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes from selling a variety of products in her local community. Zenaida is just starting this business.

In 2009, Zenaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and engage in business activities. Zenaida is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family income. --------------------------- About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda D. is from the village of Lantungan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 48 years old. Yolanda is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda sells animals. Her main source of income comes from buy and selling piglets in the local community. Yolanda has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Yolanda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase piglets to sell. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase more piglets. This loan will be the fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. ---------------------------------------------- GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: Purchase piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
"We own the land that we till. We also raise farm animals to have immediate income for the family," says Margarita I., a 32 year old mother of four children.

Margarita learned about CEVI's helpful services. She would like to avail a loan of Php 15,000 as additional capital for her businesses. Specifically, she intends to purchase two sacks of fertilizers, 30 liters of crude oil and other farm needs. She believes the loan will really help her achieve the maximum yield for her farm.

She is happy to receive a loan from CEVI. She also receives training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: Purchase fam supplies.

loans.name: Jespher

texts.en:
Jespher N. is from the town of San Isidro, Medina Misamis Oriental. He is 22 years old. Jespher is single. To make a living, he owns and operates a transport business, utilizing a "habal-habal" motor vehicle. Jespher has been in business for over six years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jespher joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services, improve his living situation and engage in business activities. Jespher is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jespher from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to supplement his family income. ----------------------------------------- About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to provide services.

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Tuy S., 35, is married and lives with her two young children in the Kampong Cham province.  She is a local teacher, making $1.50 each day.  Her husband (pictured) is a construction worker who also raises pigs.  He typically makes $4 each day. Tuy is asking for a loan to raise pigs and to buy their feed.

loans.use: Raise pigs and purchase feed.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia T. is tilling a 2.5 hectare farm. She is 49 years old this year and has three children. She and her husband continue working the field to support their family. The income from the farm is used to provide for their basic needs. Like other parents and farmers, they want to see their children be able to pursue degrees.They also want to make their farm productive and to have a sustainable livelihood for their family.

Through CEVI's microfinancing efforts, Virginia has been encouraged to apply for a loan. She would like to borrow 15,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase two sacks of urea, 30 liters of crude oil and other farm supplies. She thinks that by doing so she will be able to improve their harvest.

CEVI offers a wide range of services to people. They provide training and insurance coverage as well as loans.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of urea, 30 liters of crude oil and other farm supplies

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 30-year-old married woman with three children aged seven, four, and two years old.

Manal and her husband own a shop where they sell perfumes that they create from perfume essence. Her husband is currently managing the business since she is busy taking care of their children, but she spends some time in the shop selling to customers.

Manal and her husband recently opened this store, and it is their second branch in Ramallah city. They have a 50% share in the first branch while this second one is fully owned by the family. 

They approached FATEN for a loan of $3,000 to buy more perfume oil essence to expand their business since there is high demand during the summer.  This is their first loan. 

Manal appears in the picture with many perfume bottles behind her.

loans.use: To buy more perfume oil essence to expand their business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma M. is from the town of La Union, San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old. Wilma is married and has three small children. To make a living, Wilma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells a variety of different products to the local community. Wilma is just starting this business.

In 2009, Wilma joined HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Wilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: La Union, San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Abdusodyk

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Марасулов Абдусодык – мужчина 1958-го года рождения, женат, имеет 5-х детей. Вместе со своей женой Собировой Мавлюдой  он занимается выпечкой и продажей лепёшек.Раньше  Абдусодык работал на хлебозаводе пекарем. Как и многие его земляки после развала Союза он остался без работы. Чтобы прокормить свою большую семью он должен много работать.Его навыки пекаря очень пригодились ему, когда они с женой решили печь дома лепёшки и продавать их у входа в продуктовый рынок.В начале им пришлось очень трудно, так как у них не было постоянного места.Крупные торговцы вытесняли их с рынка.Сейчас благодаря кредиту КИВА они расширили свой бизнес и приобрели торговую точку.
texts.en:
Born 1958, Abdusodyk M. is married and has 5 children. Together with his wife, Mavluda Sobirova, he is involved in baking and selling flatbread. Previously, Abdusodyk worked as a baker at a bread factory. Much like many of his countrymen, he lost his job after the fall of the Soviet Union. He has to work a lot in order to support his big family. His knowledge as a baker came in handy, when his wife and he decided to bake flatbread at home and sell it at the entrance of the food market. It was hard for them at the beginning because they did not have a permanent retail location. Big retailers used to force them out of the market. Now, thanks to a loan from Kiva, they expanded their business and bought a store.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of 45 bags of flour

loans.name: Lach

texts.en:
Lach R., 48, pictured with her daughter, is married and works with three of her five children and her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She sells roasted beef and duck and is typically able to make $6 each day, while her husband is a driver making about $1.50 per day. Three of the children are employed and each makes $3 per day. 

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, as food prices have also been high. She is asking for $1,200 to increase the quantity of roasted beef and duck to sell eveR. day to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: To increase the amount of roasted beef and duck to sell

loans.name: Saifullo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Муллажонов Сайфулло -молодой человек 31-го года ,женат, имеет одного ребёнка. Сайфулло- старший сын в семье и поэтому, чтобы помочь своим родителям решил заняться откормом и купля-продажей скота.Он имеет опыт в сфере животновдства, так  как помогал своему отцу откармливать крупно-рогатый скот. На полученный кредит он расчитывает купить дойную корову, чтобы иметь дополнительный доход для своей семьи. В этом ему будет помогать его жена Салимова Мухайё.Кроме того он работает  маляром в автотехстанции
texts.en:
Saifullo M. is a young, 31-year-old man. He is married and has a child. Saifullo is the oldest son in his family and decided to become involved in livestock feeding and sales in order to help his parents. He has experience in the animal husbandry field because he used to help his father feed cattle. He wants to use this loan to buy a dairy cow and have an additional source of income for his family. His wife, Muhaiyo Salimova, will be helping him with the business. Saifullo also works as a painter at an auto shop.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
When Analyn B. bought a rice farm, she was confronted with big challenges in running the business: insufficient funds to run the business, more expenses at home and more priorities in their home. She always dreamed of having a sustainable business for her family, a business where she could realize the plans she has for her children.

She is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to purchase a quart of Nominee herbicide and three sacks of Ammosul for fertilizing. The loan will truly help her increase their yield.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans, but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicide and three sacks of Ammosul

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en: Ouk T. is a widow who lives with three of her children in the Kampong Cham province. Since 2005, she has been selling desserts and fruit to earn a living and is able to make about $7.50 US profit every day. She is also supported by her children who are moto-taxi drivers. Ouk T. would like to take out a loan to replace an old and unreliable motorbike for her son. The old one uses a lot of gas and needs many repairs.

loans.use: To replace an old and unreliable motorbike

loans.name: Hiqoyat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Пулатова Хикоят- женщина  1961-го года рождения, замужем , имеет 4-х детей. Год  назад  её муж Шокиров Абдусалим  вернулся  из  Российской  Федерации,  куда  он  ездил  на  заработки.  На  вырученные  деньги  они  с  женой  решили  заняться  куплей  и  продажей  скота. В  начале  бизнеса  у  них  было  небольшое  количество  скота.  Узнав  про  нашу  организацию  Пулатова Хикоят   обратилась  к  нам  за  кредитом  для  расширения  своего  товарооборота.  Сейчас  она  может  купить   двух  бычков  по  хорошей  цене.  Она благодарна КИВА за подержкую.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Hiqoyat P. is a woman born in 1961, married and has four children. One year ago her husband Abdusalim Shokirov returned from the Russian Federation where he went as a laborer. Together with his wife they decided to use the earnings to start buying and selling cattle. In the beginning of their business they had a very small amount of cattle. Once they found out about our organization Hiqoyat P. has come to us for a loan to increase the circulation of cattle. Right now she can buy two calves for a good price. She is thankful to Kiva for the support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en:
Chhuon T., 51, is married and lives with two of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She sells cakes and grocery items in front of a garment factory, making $2 US each day. Her husband does some farming and works as a security guard, making about $2 US each day as well. This couple is also supported by two of their children who are security guards.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians. In light of these difficult times, Chhuon T. is asking for a loan of $1000 US to expand her grocery store. She sees this as a good economic investment and will use it to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Kao

texts.en: Kao T., 64, is a widow who lives in the Kampong Cham province with one of her daughters. She makes about $5 a day selling rice, but this is not enough money to support her family. She gets help from her daughter, who operates a hairdressing shop from home and typically makes $2 a day. To earn more money, Kao T. is asking for a loan to buy rice in bulk to take advantage of a special discount and meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk for resale

loans.name: Duoc's Group

texts.en:
Được Thị Nguyễn was born in 1987. ( no: 010114140027).She lives with her hus band and her children. Her career as a transmission. Her husband made for insurance companies. She has a monthly income of about 1.500.000 VND. She needs 1.972.000 VND( or 115 USD) to purchase transmission equipment. There are 2 other Fund participants in her group:
 Dung Thị Đông was born in 1990. ( no: 010114140028). Her family has a photo shop. She and her husband are photo mechanics. She needs 1.972.000 VND( or 115 USD) to buy chicken to raise.
 Dựng Thị Nguyễn was born in 1973. ( no: 010114140026).She lives with her husband and 2 children. She raises chicken and grows vegetables. She wants to borrow 2.436.000 VND( or 145 USD ) to buy food for chicken.

loans.use: to purchase transmission equipment

loans.name: Phoung

texts.en: Phoung L., 39, is married and lives in Kampong Cham province with four of her children. She makes a living raising pigs and growing rice, and earns about $2.50 each day, while her husband makes $5 a day selling cashew nuts. Inflation has made prices soar lately in Cambodia, and Phoung L. realizes that she needs to expand the family businesses in order to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy cashew nuts for her husband to sell at the market. She sees this loan as a great economic opportunity, and believes that she can raise her standard of living through her careful use of the proceeds.

loans.use: To buy cashew nuts.

loans.name: Abdukodir

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Тошматов Абдукодир  - мужчина 1958-го года рождения , женат,  имеет 4-х  детей.  У Абдукодира высшее образование , он работает директором ТВ «Гулякандоз».Но этого не хватает чтобы   прокормить  его большую семью.Поэтому он  решил  заняться  откормом  скота.  Абдукодир   имеет  большой  опыт  в  сфере  животноводства,  так  как    с  юных  лет  помогал  отцу  пасти  скот.  Абдукодиру помогают  его  сыновья.  Он  закупает  бычков  на Джаббор-Расуловском   скотном  рынке  и,  откормив  в  течении  5-6  месяцев,  перепродаёт  их  за  хорошую  цену.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. Abdukodir T. is a man born in 1958, married and has four children. Abdukodir has higher education and works as a director on TV Gulyakandoz. But it is not enough to feed his big family. This is why he decided to start raising cattle. Abdukodir has a great experience in the field of animal husbandry because since his young years he was helping his father to shepherd the cattle. Abdukodir's sons also help him. He buys calves on the Jabbor-Rasulov cattle market and after feeding them for five to six months he resells them for a better price.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Nhu's Group

texts.en:
Như T. Đào (no: 010114140015) was born in 1973. She lives with her husband and two children. She is a member of the group and has been elected as group leader. She has a grocery store at home generating a monthly income of about 2,000,000 VND. She wants to sell more goods and so she needs a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy more goods for her grocery store.

There are two other participants in her group:

Cúc Thị Hoàng (no: 010114140014) was born in 1965. She grows vegetables and raises pigs. Also, she goes to buy scrap iron to resell. She wants to borrow 3,706,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.

Vệ Thị Hoàng (no: 010114140017) was born in 1967. She raises pigs and fish and grows vegetables. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND to buy feed for her pigs and fish.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Zulaiho

texts.ru: Зулайхо Хакимова 1970 года рождения ,замужем имеет 2 детей. Имеет среднее образование, На рынке торгует детской одеждой более 10 лет. Раньше сидела дома, после того как закончила школу помогала матери торговать  семечками и жвачкой. После того как вышла замуж также сидела дома. Со временем когда дети подросли , потребность также увеличивалась. Для этого вышла на рынок продавать вещи. Со временем  получила  кредит на расширение товара.  Благодаря КИВА улучшила свой ассортимент товара и благодарна за поддержку.
texts.en:
Zulaiho Khakomova was born in 1970, is married and has two children. She has secondary education. She sells children's clothing on the market for more than ten years. She used to stay at home, after she finished school she was helping her mother sell seeds and gum. After she got married she was also staying at home. With time as the children grew up their demands also increased. So she has started selling clothes on the market. With time she received a loan to increase merchandise. Thanks to Kiva she improved the assortment of her merchandise and is grateful for the support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for the summer season

loans.name: Sergelen

texts.en: Sergelen S., 54, is a married and has two children. His family lives in the Ger district on the plot of land he owns in the small town of Arhangay, one Mongolia's central provinces. His oldest daughter, Dorjdulam, is 19 and a university student in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. His youngest son, Luvsandorj, is 15 and attends a local high school. Sergelen has a second-hand vehicle which he has used to run a taxi service for last 11 years. Since he has a lots of experience in this field, his daily income has more than doubled. He is a friendly, open and well-respected person. Since he lives is a very small town, most of his clients are local residents who know him very well. He is applying for this loan to buy tires and spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy tires and spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида Мусоева  1969 года рождения ,замужем имеет 3 детей. Закончив университет не нашла достойную работу, сидела долгое время дома. После замужества  также сидела дома, но дети росли и их потребности тоже.  Решила заняться продажей яиц. С  имевшихся кур наседок начала продавала яйца. Позже получив кредит решила продавать уже на рынке покупая большую партию яиц с поставщиков. Занимается купля продажей яиц  11 лет.
texts.en:
Farida M. was born in 1969. She is married and has three children. After graduating the university, she couldn't find a decent job, and for a long time, stayed at home. Once she was married, she also stayed home, but as her children grew, their needs grew as well. So she decided to sell eggs. Since she had chickens, she began selling eggs. She later received a loan and decided to sell at the market, buying a large batch of eggs from suppliers. She has been buying and selling eggs now for 11 years.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of eggs

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en: Natsagdorj D. is 45 years old and married. His family lives in a "ger" (a nomadic housing tent) district on a plot of land he owns in Arhangay, one of Mongolian central provinces. He runs a retail business, selling small household items such as sponges and loofahs at the local market. In 2008, he started renting a small stall because his business was doing well. Over the last two years, his working capital has increased by a factor of eight. Natsagdorj's main goal now is to own his own stall in near future. He plans to use this loan to buy more household items to sell and increase his inventory.

loans.use: To buy small household items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Togoontumur

texts.en: Togoontumur C. is a 38-year-old widow who has one daughter, Enhzul, who is six years old and goes to a local elementary school. Togoontumur lives with her mother and daughter in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her mother is retired and stays home, taking care of Togoontumur’s daughter.  In 2005, Togoontumur started a business selling souvenirs. She buys unprocessed sheep's wool from local herders, then makes it into a variety of items that remind visitors of Mongolian culture and tradition. She makes most of her income in the summer, when many tourists head to Mongolia. Her dream is to open her own shop in the future.  She has applied for this loan to buy raw materials such as wool, paint and wire.

loans.use: To buy wool, wires and paint for her business

loans.name: Guzal

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Шамсиева Гузаль-молодая женщина 1988 года рождения, замужем, детей пока не имеет.Вместе со свом мужем она решила зеняться откормом крупно-рогатого скота, чтобы как-то помочь родителям содержать их большую семью.Муж Гузаль покупает молодых телят по низкой цене, откормив их несколько недель он продаёт их с небольшой выгодой. Гузаль помогает ему с откормом . Кроме того она шьёт дома на заказ национальные платья и тем самым помогает пополнить семейный бюджет.
texts.en:
Guzal S. is a young woman born in 1988. She is married, but does not have children yet. Together with her husband, she decided to feed cattle to help her parents support their large family. Guzal's husband buys young calves at low prices, feeds them for several weeks, and then sells that at a small profit. Guzal helps him with the feeding. In addition, at home, she sews custom tailored national dresses, and this is how she helps to supplement the family budget.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Omina

texts.ru: Омина Джураева 1964 года рождения , замужем имеет 4 детей. Высшего образования не имеет.  На рынке торгует 5 лет яйцами.  Долгое время не могла найти работу. Подруга посоветовала получить кредит  и заняться бизнесом.  Убедившись о развитии бизнеса,  получила кредит на развитие своего бизнеса. Первый кредит получила в 2004 году. Сейчас ее оборот увеличился, и развивает за счет кредита от КИВА .
texts.en:
Omina J. was born in 1964. She is married and has four children. She does not have a higher education. For five years, she traded in eggs at the market. For a long time, she was unable to find work. Her girlfriend advised her to take a loan and start up a business. Convinced of the need to develop her business, she took out a loan to expand her business. She took out her first loan in 2004. Now, her turnover has increased and is developing through a Kiva loan.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 500 eggs

loans.name: Obida

texts.ru: Обида Рахмонова  1965 года рождения, замужем имеет 3 детей.  Муж Обиды не работает. Поэтому Обида устроилась продавщицей в магазине торговать одеждой. Со временем накопив не большой капитал ,заняла недорогое место для продажи начала с торговли мелочей носков , платков и различных вещей.  Вот уже пятый год торгует на рынке женской одеждой. Ей необходимо для развития торговли кредит, поэтому она решила получит кредит на  покупку летней одежды.
texts.en:
Born in 1965, Obida R. is married and has 3 children. Obida’s husband does not work. This is why Obida got a salesperson job at a clothing store. With time, having saved a small capital, she got an inexpensive retail location and started with the sales of small items, such as socks, scarves and various things. It is now the fifth year since Obida started selling women’s clothing at the market. She needs a loan in order to grow her sales, thus, she decided to obtain this loan to buy summer clothing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer merchandise

loans.name: Gulsinoy

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Ашурова Гулсиной – женщина 1963 года рождения, замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Продаёт  детскую одежду на вещевом рынке Джаббор-Расуловского района. Два раза в неделю Гулсиной вместе с соседями по бизнесу ездят в город Истаравшан за товаром.  На полученный кредит она хочет расширить свой ассортимент за счет летней одежды, и тем самым поднять свой товарооборот. Её товары пользуются большим спросом среди покупателей,  так как она привозит качественную и красочную детскую одежду  по доступным  для населения  ценам. Гулсиной  рада сотрудничеству с нашей организацией.
texts.en:
Born in 1963, Gulsinoy A. is married and has 3 children. She sells children’s clothing at the clothing market in the Jabbor-Rasulov district. Twice per week, Gulsinoy and her business neighbors travel to the city of Istaravshan for their merchandise. She wants to use this loan to expand her assortment by buying summer clothing and, thus, increase her goods turnover. Her merchandise is in high demand among her customers because she sells beautiful, quality children’s clothing at affordable prices. Gulsinoy is happy to be working with our organization.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer children's clothing

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa R. works in a family member's business making and selling specialty food products in her community. She is 37 years old, separated from her spouse and has adult children. She is from the village of Canitoan, Cagayan de Oro City. Jesusa is just starting this business.

In 2008, Jesusa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jesusa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jesusa is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients for the food products she makes. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mahmudjon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 



Донияров Махмуджон- мужчина 1975-го года рождения, женат, детей пока не имеет.Он работает сварщиком в техстанции.Но этих денег недостаточно,  чтобы накопить на покупку дома.Поэтому вот уже больше шести лет он вместе со своим отцом занимается откормком скота.На полученный кредит Махмуджон решил купить молодых  бычков и перепродать их по хорошей цене осенью. Махмуджон благодарен КИВА за поддержку его бизнеса
texts.en:
Born in 1975, Mahmudjon D. is married and does not yet have children. He works as a welder at a service station. But this money is not enough to save for a house. This is why, Mahmudjon, together with his father, has been involved in livestock feeding for over six years. He decided to use this loan to buy young bulls and resell them at a good price in the autumn. Mahmudjon is grateful to Kiva for supporting his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Madiore

texts.en:
Madiore T. owns a small rice farm. She is 45 years old and the mother of three children. The proceeds of her farm go to purchasing the basic needs for their family. Aside from rice, she plants vegetables in their backyard, a short distance away from their house. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to pay for the manpower during land preparation. Preparing the land is the most crucial thing to achieve a better yield. She hopes that with her loan she can have better returns from her farm.

Through CEVI, Mrs. T. is able to sustain her livelihood all the more. CEVI helps her get a loan, as well as training and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To pay for the manpower during land preparation.

loans.name: Junrey

texts.en:
Junrey E. is from the village of Sugbongcogon, Tagoloan Misamis Oriental. He is 30 years old and is married. To make a living, Junrey owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a "sari-sari" variety store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income from the business comes primarily from selling a variety of products in the local community. He also provides transportation services using his motorcycle. Junrey has been engaged in his business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Junrey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and the ability to engage in business activities. Junrey is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, and a portion of it will be used for maintenance for his motorcycle. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Junrey from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family's needs.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, and motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Mr. Benson M. is a 33 year old businessman who owns a milling and grinding machine for manufacturing maize flour, millet flour, wheat flour and cassava flour. His business is situated in Kabingo and he has lived and worked in the area for over 10 years. He is using the loan to purchase more machinery so as to expand his business to be able to deal with more producers. He is a married man and blessed with one child to whom he expects to provide the best he can. He and his wife are teachers by profession, and he carries on his duties while partly supervising his business as well. His future plan is to increase his business to ensure the on going success of his business.

loans.use: To purchase more machinery.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn L. manages a 2-hectare farm. Knowing the topography and the soil profile of their location, she is doing her best to improve the soil conditions of her farm to obtain a high yield. The harvest is mainly intended for their family's use. She uses the excess to earn additional income for the family. 

She needs a loan of PHP15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy 4 sacks of complete fertilizer and insecticide. She is looking forward to having the best return possible from her loan. She hopes to achieve a better yield of her crops to better support her family.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. They provide credit, training, and insurance coverage services to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase 4 sacks of complete fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en: Mr. Benon M. is a hardworking 35 year old businessman who is married with two children. He has operated a boutique business in Kabwohe trading centre for 10 years. He is using the loan to purchase more clothing, shoes, ties, etc. for his business. His wife helps him when he is not around. He hopes his business will be self-sufficient and he would also like to create more employment in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing, shoes, ties etc. to meet his customers' needs.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina C. is from the village of Sugbongcogon, Tagoloan Cagayan De Oro City. She is 33 years old and single. To make a living, Celerina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling (wholesale or retail) "ballot" a famous egg delicacy among Filipinos. Celerina has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Celerina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celerina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to finance her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Celerina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the family's daily needs.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Pionita

texts.en:
Pionita G. is a rice grower. She is a 49 year old mother of only one child. Her husband, Arsenio G., is also a farmer. They work so hard to be able to grow their crops well for an abundant harvest. They have been tilling their farm since the start of their marriage. Their income supports the expenses of their home, as well as their daily needs.

She is requesting a loan of PHP15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to pay for seedlings for the 4.5 hectare rice field. Part of the loan will be used to buy carabao (buffalo) to make their life easier when it comes to farming.

To date, Pionita receives not just loans from CEVI, she also receives training and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To pay for seedlings for the rice field.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Mrs. Zainab N. is a hardworking business lady aged 34 years old and blessed with three children, two of whom are in school. She has operated a boutique business for over 15 years. She is using the loan to purchase more clothing for her business and to expand her business in order to generate more income. Her future plan is to provide the best for her children and family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for her business.

loans.name: Tu

texts.en: Tu Y., 50, is a villager living in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, where she earns a living selling fritters from her home for income. She is married to Mr. Deum (shown in the picture), 47, who works as a local building worker. This family has given birth to two children who are still living in the family home. Because Tu Y. is lacking the capital to buy a vehicle in order to make transportation easier, she is looking for a loan to purchase a used motorbike for her family’s traveling needs.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike for her family’s traveling needs.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia T. is starting to worry about how she can stretch their limited income. She has been worrying so much, especially because her three children are studying, and always need support for their allowance, their books, and other school fees. She is 43 years old this year. Her husband, Felixberto T., is a farmer. They both work so hard to make their rice farm a productive business to support their daily needs. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy 2 sacks of fertilizer and other farming needs. The loan is truly a help, especially for additional capital in her business. She aims to have a rice mill some day for her family.

Now that she receives loans form CEVI, she is able to manage her farm well. Aside from the credit CEVI provides, she enjoys having training and insurance coverage that helps her small business grow.

loans.use: To purchase 2 sacks of fertilizer and other farming needs.

loans.name: Ameudullah

texts.en: Ameudullah is the son of B. K.. Married with two children, he lives in Kabul Afghanistan where he is a farmer very interested in agriculture.  Everyday he wakes up early and starts his work on his land. He is requesting a loan of 30000 Afghani to buy more and different kinds of seeds for growing. He would like to be a really successful farmer in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds.

loans.name: Labibeh

texts.en: Labibeh is a 43-year old single woman living with her parents. She has been working as an accountant for the past 19 years. Today, Labibeh is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy a laptop to be able to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy a laptop.

loans.name: Gilmor

texts.en:
Gilmor P. runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling a variety of products like canned goods, bread, coffee, milk and firewood. He is 42 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the town of Barra, Opol , Misamis Oriental. Gilmor has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Gilmor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Gilmor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gilmor is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his sixth loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of his family and to support the education of his children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a sari sari store

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 50-year-old married man living with his three children. He has been a construction worker since 1989 with a long experience in this sector. Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase merchandise in order to develop his work and to be able to satisfy the demand of the market.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to develop his work

loans.name: Saydeh

texts.en: Saideh is a 33-year-old single woman living with her parents and her brothers. She is cooperating with her brothers to provide the household expenses. She has owned an accessories shop since 2006. Today, Saideh is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy merchandise, hoping that her business will develop during the summer.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Jawed Group

texts.en:
Jawed is the group leader of Jawed group. There are four members in this group and each of them wants to take a loan for her or his business.

Jawed wants to take a loan for his taxi.

Zalmia wants to take a loan for his bakery business.

Shelluah wants to take a loan for her husband who has a fruit and vegetables shop.

Seveta wants to take a loan for her tailoring business.

So they are requesting a group of loan 56,000 Afghani and they are very thankful to AFS and to Kiva lenders who supply support all over the world.

loans.use: To use for his taxi

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en: Lenie I. owns a 2.5-hectare (6-acre) farm. She is 39 years old and the mother of four children. While she is waiting for the next harvest to come, she also sells food items in the streets to supplement their income. The money that she gets from her farm and from selling food is used to buy the basic needs in their home. She wants the best for her family. She wants her children to graduate in college so that, when they are older, they are able to easily provide themselves with a good life. Lenie is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. From the start, she knows that her loan will be a big help in running her business, especially in buying the needed fertilizers for her farm. She thinks and believes that her loan will go far to improve her harvest. CEVI is continuously helping her sustain their livelihood. She receives not just CEVI loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of fertilizer and other farming needs

loans.name: Mahamed

texts.en:
Mahamed B. is currently in the business of selling water tanks and pipes and is requesting a loan to increase her stock. Mahamed is 20 years old and is married with a husband that is a Southern Sudan television news reader. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan.
