The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To increase stock of water tanks and pipes

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla V.’s dream is to see her children graduate from college, have stable careers and happy lives. But that is still a dream and that is why she is doing her best to always be productive in her business, in order to support her children’s education and realize her plans for later on.

Perla is 52 years old this year. She owns a 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) farm. Their harvest is what they use to provide food for the family and to buy the things they need in their home.

Perla is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase three sacks of urea fertilizer, three sacks of certified seeds and other farm needs. She is also looking for some other possible income areas so as to be able to help her family more.

Now, Perla is happy obtaining the wide services of CEVI. She receives not only loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, certified seeds and other farm needs

loans.name: Yangi

texts.en: Yangi R. is 45 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacher. She has four children and her children go to school. Yangi is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to build a charcoal store. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop and a bar. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a charcoal store

loans.name: Fahima Group

texts.en: Fahima is the group leader of Fahima group. They are two members in this group and they want to request a loan of 28,000 Afghani.  Each of them want to take a loan for a tailoring business because they want to support their family and children. They admire this process so much.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie P. is a rice grower. She lives in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur, an agricultural community in Mindanao. She is 37 years old and has two children who are still schooling. She and her husband are striving so hard to provide the needs of their family. She has a farm with an area of 3 hectares (7.5 acres) on which she grows rice as their only source of income. After Elsie heard about CEVI and Kiva loans, she requested a loan of Php 15,000. The purpose why she is applying for loan is to purchase six quarts of foliar (liquid) fertilizers, six sacks of urea (a granular fertilizer) and other farm needs. The loan will truly help her and her family obtain the maximum yield from their rice farm. CEVI helps small farmers sustain their livelihood. It provides not just credit assistance but also offers training and insurance coverage to empower their clients to become leaders in their own communities.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm needs

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday S. is currently in the business of selling sweets (candies), biscuits (cookies), etc., and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Sunday is 30 years old and is widowed. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop

loans.name: Saim

texts.en: O. Saim is dedicated to agriculture and the sale of cultivated vegetables, since it means that he can be around his family. He is helping to raise their quality of life and educating his two children. Saim has been characterized as a person who is hardworking, since he has been working in agriculture since he was very young. This kind of work requires effort, dedication, and above all, strength, as it can include heavy work, meaning that people get tired quickly. In spite of this, Saim is determined to raise the standard of living of his family, and to improve the quality of the seeds he cultivates. For this reason, he is asking for help in order to be able to receive more credit from IMON International. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for his farm

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
51-year-old Linda L. is an active member of Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). Her family is blessed to have a large parcel of land yet they lack enough capital to utilize it for their rice farming business. That is why she is now applying for a loan from CEVI amounting to Php 15,000.00. 

Her long-term plan is typical of that of every economically poor Filipino: to lift her family from the mud of poverty. With CEVI, Linda finds every obstacle an opportunity to strive harder. This is what she has learned from the biblical reflections during CEVI cluster meetings.

loans.use: labor, fertilizers and other farming necessities

loans.name: Gulshod

texts.en:
On her own initiative, when Gulshod was 23 she learned how to make national dresses using a sewing machine. This activity has made it possible for her to contribute to her family's income and satisfactorily meet the most urgent needs of her two small children. Every item of dresses Gulshod produces is superior, and due to this, her orders have markedly increased. She has some very large orders so that many times it would be impossible to fulfill them if she didn't have an assistant. Her incredible energy, fortitude, and commitment to her clients drive her to offer them new and improved service. To this end, Gulshod wants to speed up her dress production by purchasing fabrics. To accomplish her objective, she is asking for a 4000 Somoni loan to buy new modern fabrics. With your help, you can make her dream come true. Gulshod thanks you for your generous contribution.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics for sewing national dresses.

loans.name: Mapartu

texts.en:
Mapartu E. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs at the restaurant. Mapartu is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is an army officer. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and rent it out.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.en: G. Tojiniso comes from a humble family, but her desire to succeed in life superseded her economic condition. At an early age she learned to make new and different articles of women’s national dress. Thanks to her excellent work she won the admiration and loyalty of her clients. With the benefits she obtained she was able to pay for her advanced obstetrician studies, and to support her parents with family expenses. In order to realize her plans, for which she works hard, Tojiniso appeals to your caring heart and requests a loan to buy a new sewing machine to continue making her fine dresses. Let’s support this excellent seamstress so she can continue sewing her elegant and distinguished articles of national dress. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
38-year-old Emma P. is an active member of the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She is married to Rovencio P. and is the mother of five.

Emma engaged herself to her rice farming business and toiled their one-hectare (2.5-acre) rice land with her husband. But, like any other struggling businessperson, Emma had her fair share of difficulties before reaching her present business stability. She had faced insufficiency of funds when she was starting but the strength of her determination led her to victory over the odds.

And now, as she continues to support her husband in providing their family’s basic needs and their children’s education, Emma is asking CEVI for a loan amounting to Php 15,000 to sustain the business, specifically in purchasing farming necessities.

Emma expressed her reasons for joining CEVI: according to her, aside from the institution’s capability to lend her the needed additional capital, she is pleased to enjoy the insurance and the chance to mingle with other people during cluster meetings.

loans.use: To buy seed and insecticides

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: M. Zubaida is married and has two children. Her husband works as a baker. Zubaida began working seventeen years ago making dresses for women. Her mother sent her to an arts college and when she finished college she was given a sewing machine. From a very young age, she loved to sew. Therefore, Zubaida decided that she would continue with this line of work when she got older. Zubaida’s customers come to her because she provides both quality and low prices. She and her husband take turns going to wholesalers to purchase things like fabric, thread, and utensils. Zubaida is on her second loan with IMON International. Her first loan went well as she was able to invest in buttons and fabrics. She and her family appreciate your support in helping her to improve her business. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for sewing national dresses

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Because of the Community Economic Ventures Inc.’s (CEVI) wide array of good services, 41-year-old Evelyn D. became very interested in joining as one of its growing members. As a matter of fact, she is currently applying for a loan amounting to Php 15,000.00 that will be used to purchase insecticide and other necessities for their family's rice farming business. Together with her husband, Evelyn manages their small business where they get their income for food, school fees for their two children and savings. The couple also aims to buy an additional parcel of land in the future and improve their present income. This way, the couple believes that they will be able to realize their main goal in life, which is to provide a brighter future for their children.

loans.use: Insecticide and other farming necessities

loans.name: Tuvshunzaya

texts.en: Tuvshunzaya J. is 35 years old, married and the mother of two. Her family lives in Arhangay, one of the Mongolian central provinces. Her eldest daughter Ariunzaya is a university student, and the youngest one is attending a local elementary school. In 2003, together with her husband Batchuluun 38, she started running a retail business selling men's and women's apparel and religious stuff through her stall and booth. She goes to Ereen city (Ereen is a small Chinese border town where many Mongolians go to purchase cheap goods at wholesale prices to resell them) once or twice every month to buy cheap apparel. Her working capital has increased from 500,000 tugrugs to 3,000,000 tugrugs. Since she started running a retail business, she bought a small house for her household needs, clothing stall and covered stall at the local market. Her hope is to have her own fashion shop in the future. With this loan, she will purchase more apparel from Ereen city to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mamarahim

texts.en:
M. Mamarahim is 51 years old. He is married with six children. Mamarahim has a small restaurant where he sells breakfast, lunch and dinner. When he first started his business he was only open for breakfast because he worked at night. Once his place became more popular he was able to dedicate his whole time to the business. Mamarahim wants the loan to invest in tables, chairs and utensils. He is asking for 5000 Somoni. With this money, Mamarahim will be able to expand his business, to earn more profit and in turn help his children move forward to complete their school studies and further continue studying at the University. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Contribute to the growth of his business and they will be grateful. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase tables, chairs and utensils.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
A good future for their two children is Estelita L. and her husband’s main goal in life. They are very used to laboring hard to reach their dream. That is why the couple is trying to elevate their living through a venture in rice farming. They are able to manage their small business very well and they credit this to God and their years of experience as full-time farmers. 

Estelita is an active member of the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She is asking for a Php 15,000 loan that will greatly help in the expansion of their business.

Since the day she joined CEVI, Estelita has benefited a lot from the institution. One of the best things she learned from their group devotional is the power of faith. There is no such thing as “impossible” to a person who believes. Thus, paired with hard work and faith, Estelita is very hopeful that her family’s goal is at hand.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farming necessities

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.en: M. Kurbongul is an enterprising woman with a big desire to improve the quality of life of her family. She is married and the mother of four children. Kurbongul has been a seamstress since she was very young, learning in her mother's office. She has been engaged in this business for twenty-five years and has gained much experience. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Today, Kurbongul is applying for a loan from IMON International for the eleventh time. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni to purchase summer fabrics for sewing national dresses. You can help improve the quality of life of Kurbongul’s family. loans.use: To purchase summer fabrics for sewing national dresses

loans.name: Charlito

texts.en:
To own a turtle machine (an item of farm equipment), is 49-year-old Charlito D.’s long-term goal for his rice farming business. Because of this, he is determined to improve the business’s present status. He owns five hectares of land yet he sometimes experiences disappointments during harvest due to materials deficiency. This made him decide to apply for a loan from the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) in the amount of Php 15,000.00. 

Aside from being a businessperson, Charlito is a supportive breadwinner for his wife and two children. He looks forward to providing them not just with their material needs but also nourishing their spiritual appetite. It’s a good thing that Charlito always gets fresh biblical reflections from their group meetings in CEVI that he also relays to his household.

loans.use: To pay for labor and other farming necessities

loans.name: Ulziybayar

texts.en:
Ulziybayar T. is a 45-year-old married man with three children aged 12-18. All his children go to a local school. His family lives in a "ger" (traditional nomadic housing, like a yurt) district on a plot of land he owns in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. 

Ulziybayar is a plumber. He gets orders from local residents to fix their water pipes and toilets. Besides working as a plumber he has been running a plumber's workshop during the past 18 years. Ulziybayar purchases plumbing supplies at a wholesale prices from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city, and resells them to local residents or institutions at retail prices. With the profit he improved his living conditions dramatically. Now his working capital has reached 5 million tugrugs (equal to $3,500). He requests a loan to purchase plumbing supplies for his business.

loans.use: To purchase plumbing supplies

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene B., a 30-year-old native of Sayon, Sta. Josefa, has always dreamed of owning another parcel of land to expand her present rice farming business. This is where the family gets additional income for their food supply, school obligations for their three children, and some money to set aside as savings.

Arlene joined the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) because, aside from the services this institution is offering, she also learns many things about business through CEVI’s free training and seminars.

Presently, Arlene is asking for a loan from CEVI amounting to Php 15,000.00. This sum will be used as additional capital for her business, particularly in purchasing seed and other farming necessities.

loans.use: To buy seed and other farming necessities

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith, 37 years old and married with 5 children, sells ogogoro (local dry gin) in her shop in Lagos state, Nigeria. Faith is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more local dry gin to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more local dry gin to sell.

loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en:
Davaadorj T., a 37-year-old married woman with three children, all attending a local elementary school, lives in Arhangay, one of the Mongolian central provinces. Since 2002 Davaadorj has been running a souvenir and toy stall at the local market. She started her business by travelling to Ereen, a Chinese border city, to purchase a variety of toys for 300,000 tugrugs, and as a result of her hard work, her retail sales business has expanded. Now her working capital has reached 4,000,000 tugrugs (equal to $2,800 USD).

Her husband, Lhagva-Otgon, an electrician, helps her business when he has time, and Davaadorj's hope is to eventually open her own toy and souvenir store. She is requesting a loan to purchase more toys and souvenir items from Ereen, China.

loans.use: To purchase toys and souvenirs.

loans.name: Gerrelyn

texts.en:
Farming is the primary source of income of Gerrelyn O.’s family. She is 35 years old and the mother of two children. Her parents own the land she and her husband are trying to farm.

Like most couples, they desire to see their children finish their schooling and this is their inspiration to do better in their small business. Thus, Gerrelyn is asking the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) for a loan of Php 15,000.00 that will be used as additional capital. 

Joining CEVI has been a blessing for Gerrelyn. She takes home the morals that she acquires from their group meetings. She applies her learning in their family to strengthen their ties and create a harmonious atmosphere in their home.

loans.use: To buy farming necessities

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en: M. Matluba is 24 years old, unmarried and living with her parents. She is a well-known seamstress in her community, seeing that she has been working there for more than four years. Four years ago, Matluba decided to take advantage of her reputation and bought a used tailoring machine and since then she has provided tailoring services. Matluba says that she now has a well-established clientele, the majority of whom are young girls who often order the national dresses. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Now she is requesting a loan of 4,000 Somoni to purchase a new sewing machine in order to provide her high quality service. You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Matluba and her family are grateful for your generosity and support. loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina L. is a typical woman whose only ambition is to see her family happy. And in order to do that, she helps her husband in supporting their three children’s schooling and meeting their daily needs. Despite her age (she’s 41 now), Josefina remains vigorous in the midst of the adversities. 

She shared their life as tenants before and the hardships of being one. She confessed borrowing money from their buyer and used it as starting capital. She endured the high interest rate attached with that loan because she had no other option.  But when she heard about the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) and the variety of their services, she felt as though she was relieved from carrying a heavy load. 

She now applies for Php 15,000.00 loan from CEVI as additional capital as she aims to expand the business so that later she will be able to buy a carabao, a farm animals use by farmers to plow the field. Aside from meeting her financial needs, Josefina has no regret of joining CEVI because aside from easy access to loans, she enjoys their group meetings and reflections.

loans.use: farming necessities

loans.name: Shamsiya

texts.en: N. Shamsiya is 43 years old and married with two children of school age. She runs a café where she provides meals of national and European cuisines. The café is located in the central local market which allows her to have many clients, the majority of whom are those making purchases in the market. The business has been generating stable incomes during the last twelve years. Now, Shamsiya is planning to make wholesale purchases of foodstuffs like wheat, oil, potatoes, carrots, onions and oil. For this purpose she requests 4,000 Somoni. She had been provided with six loans by IMON International and has proved herself to be a reliable client. Today she thanks all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly. loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs like wheat, oil, potatoes, carrots, onions and oil for her café

loans.name: Wani

texts.en: Wani J. is currently in the business of distillation and the selling of local alcohol and is requesting a loan to open up a bar. Wani is 20 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a bar

loans.name: Mavdjigul

texts.en: N. Mavdjigul is 40 years old and is married with four children. She has a tailoring business sewing national women’s dresses. Her workmanship is very good and, being young, she has a good eye for design. She is very organized and has a good head for business. Mavdjigul has had this business for twenty-one years and has gained a lot of experience. With her loan, she will buy more material for sewing dresses. She smiles when asked what her dreams are for the future. She quickly replies that she plans to open a workshop, hire seamstresses, and expand her business. With her spirit, she will surely succeed. loans.use: To purchase fabrics for sewing national dresses

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en: R. Firuza has a small clothing-sales business located at Vahdat market in Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. She is married and has two children. In business for 5 years, she has worked hard over the years to develop a successful business and help meet the needs of her family. Firuza currently sells a selection of children’s clothing. She has requested a loan of 3,000 Somoni to help purchase inventory to sell. She enjoys being self-employed and would like to continue growing and developing her business. loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose sells cooked foods and drinks. Rose is very eager to increase the standard of living of her family. Rose is 36 years old and married with five children. Rose hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks. 
She says thank you!

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Khuriniso

texts.en: S. Khuriniso is a widow and has a teenage daughter. She is a private entrepreneur who works in the central city market selling women’s shoes, offering a large variety of women’s shoes at reasonable prices. She has been in business for thirteen years and has benefited a lot from two years of partnering with IMON International Ukraine. Lending services have helped her buy a new vending facility in a different part of the city, reach sustainability in her business, and given her confidence for the future. Khuriniso needs a loan of 4,000 Somoni to re-stock her inventory and purchase shoes wholesale for the summer season. She believes that the sphere of market trade where she works is a promising niche and will continue to grow and develop in the future. loans.use: To purchase shoes wholesale for the summer season

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a married woman and has one child. Her husband is an ordinary driver and his salary isn’t enough to feed their young family. So, understanding that, Fatima went to learn to sew dresses. After learning, she bought herself a simple old sewing machine. She started buying fabrics from the market and sewing men’s and women’s national dress on demand. But now she understands that her simple sewing machine is not good enough to sew better-designed dresses. So she decided to purchase a new sewing machine with better technology in order to sew better dresses for her clients. loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Zilol

texts.en: Y. Zilol is 53 years old. She and her husband have been married for almost thirty years and have raised two wonderful children. One of them is already married and has children of his own who adore their grandparents. Zilol has been running her own small business for three years already. She has a place for selling items such as soft drinks, sweets (candies), potted goods, detergents, soap, tooth-paste and others. She works from 7:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. She is very friendly and polite which allows her to have good clientele. Now Zilol is requesting 4,000 Somoni that she will spend on purchasing more goods to sell, thus increasing the range of her products. She thanks everyone who has decided to support her. loans.use: To purchase goods to sell to increase her stock

loans.name: Monica's Group

texts.en: A. Monica is the leader of Bufunda United group in Ibanda. She is a married lady with 5 children aged 4–14, all of whom are in school. She is a hard-working and friendly lady, who has had a drug shop as her business for 8 years. Her experience and the location of her business on the Ibanda main street make it successful. She has been able to pay school fees for her children and also provide essential necessities to them. Her previous loans have always helped her in avoiding shortages, allowing her to stock the drugs that she and her patients would need. At the moment, she needs a new loan to help her buy more drugs for her drug shop.

loans.use: Buying more products for her drug shop

loans.name: Zukhra

texts.en:
Y. Zukhra is 31 years old. She is a widow with 4 children. Zukhra has a tailoring business at her home. Her business involves sewing clothing for women and children. Her workmanship is very good, and she has a good eye for design. She is very organized, with a good head for business. She has had this business for 15 years, and this is her second loan from IMON International. With her loan, Zukhra is planning to purchase a new sewing machine. Help this family improve the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Zukhra’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.

Tajikistan:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International:

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope lives in Badagry, Lagos state. She sells medicines at retail and wholesale. Hope is married with 4 children, and she is 42 years old. Hope is requesting a loan for the amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Abdurazok

texts.en: Of his 27 years, Z. Abdurazok has dedicated five of them to his hardware store, an important economic support for his family. Because of the strong competition from the large stores in the country, he had to move three years ago to his neighborhood. It was an important decision and it has turned out very well, giving his family a good education and a good home. Abdurazok is sure that there is no better tool than education and a good income, which his hardware store provides. He requests a loan of 3000 Somoni to purchase more hardware for selling. Your support will really help him. loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Azam

texts.en: Z. Azam is 30 years old and is married with three children. For the past nine years he has been running a small road-side shop selling hardware. His shop is located by an auto-repair yard as well as a large carpentry business, so his sales are increasing. Azam has been engaged in this business for the past nine years. Currently he is in need of a loan of 3,000 Somoni to expand his hardware product line to supply the increased requests he is receiving. Be an important part of the growth of Azam‘s business. loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Ganiyu

texts.en: Ganiyu is 45 years old, and is married with three children. She obtains bread in large quantities directly from bakeries  and then supplies it to traders who, in turn, sell it to consumers. Ganiyu has been in this business for over eight years. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to increase her inventory in order to meet customer demand. Ganiyu has been borrowing from Kiva partner, LAPO, for over two years and has a good repayment record.

loans.use: To purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Innocent's Group

texts.en: M. Innocent is the leader of his lending group. He is 39 years old and married with six children as he cares for two relatives. Innocent is happy that all his children are in school and that he is able to care for them and pay their school fees. Innocent is a businessman in farming – he grows food crops, both to sell and for his family to consume, as well as buying from other farmers for resale. He also keeps animals at home, and he can sell these in times when he does not have enough income to cover his household's needs. Innocent needs a loan so that he can buy more produce to sell.

loans.use: To buy more farm produce for resale

loans.name: Hau's Group

texts.en:
Hậu Thị Nguyễn was born in 1965. She lives with her husband and son’s family. Her husband is a builder. She makes brooms to sell. She buys brooms from other people in her village to resell, too. 

She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND( or 240 USD) to buy materials to make brooms. She is a group leader. There are two other fund participants in her group:

 T.ệp Thị Vương sells vegetables in the market. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND ( or 345 USD) to expand her business.

 Xuyến Thị Hoàng has a small shop. She sells fresh coffee. She has a monthly income of about 2,000,000 VND. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND ( or 240 USD) to expand the goods she sells.

 Thuy T. N. wants to borrow 3,270,000 VND ( or 190 USD) to invest in her shop, which sells beer, fresh food and ice-cream.

loans.use: To buy materials to make brooms

loans.name: Dezilanta's Group

texts.en:
N. Dezilanta is the leader of Kiwamirembe Group in Kigombya. She is married with three children, and has a business selling maize and chicken mash to the poultry farmers in her locality. She is also a poultry farmer herself, with 300 egg-laying chicks and a few broilers at home for meat. Dezilanta is one of the founding members of her group, which she started up after becoming a farmer.

Dezilanta is grateful for the loans from Kiva partner, Pearl Microfinance, because without them, her life and that of her family would not be as it is today. She is asking for a loan through Pearl Microfinance to buy and stock more maize brand, shells and mash for sale.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed for her poultry farm and for sale

loans.name: Trong's Group

texts.en:
Trong T. N. was born in 1968. She breeds pigs and poultry. She has a monthly income of about 2,500,000 VND. She wants to borrow 2,204,000 VND (or 125 USD) for 25 weeks to buy food for her domestic animals.

 Mai T. N. was born in 1964. She sells pork in the market. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She wants to borrow 2,204,000 VND (or 125 USD) to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.use: To buy food for domestic animals

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 37 years old and lives in Badagry, Lagos state. She is married, and has four children.

Patience sells various colors of sarongs and lace. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs and lace to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and lace to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita T. is from the village of Sto. Ñino, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 29 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Juanita owns and operates a sari-sari or general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Juanita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. ñino, Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung Thị Phạm was born in 1970. She lives with her husband and two children. Her husband is a construction worker. 

Her family has economic difficulties because she needs to raise two children and one goes to school. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND (or 345 USD) to start a small business.

loans.use: To start a small business.

loans.name: Prossy's Group

texts.en:
N. Prossy is the leader of Kikoma group in Mubende. She is a hardworking and honest lady and married with six children in secondary and pre-primary schools. She also helps to care for three dependents, all in school.

Prossy is a businesslady with a salon that she has been running for ten years in Kikoma. She is able to make weekly profits of UGX 50,000 and this is attributed to her good customer care and good business skills.

Prossy has a dream of building commercial houses and making sure that all her children attain the best education possible. She needs a loan to help invest in her business so as to expand it further by buying wigs, weaves (hair extensions), hair oils and chemicals for her customers.

loans.use: To buy wigs, weaves, hair oils and chemicals for her customers

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Kemi is the mother of three and she is 40 years old. She sells fried yam, potatoes, and bean cake, popularly known in Nigeria as akara. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more yams and beans to enable her to sell more fried yam and akara. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more yams and beans

loans.name: Oladapo

texts.en: M. is 45 years old and married with four children. She has been selling wood for many years. She needs a loan of N140,000 to purchase more wood to sell. M. is a dedicated LAPO client and promise to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to sell

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Vân Thị Trương was born in 1962. She currently lives with her husband and son. Her son is not working. She makes gloves from scrap-cloth. She also cooks rice for a factory near her house. She is an upright and prestegious person; everyone in her group elected her as the group leader. 

She has a monthly income of about 2,500,000 VND. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND (or 345 USD) to buy scrap-cloth to make gloves. There are four other fund participants in her group:

 Hiệp Hồng Phạm was born in 1974. She needs to borrow 4,142,000 VND (or 240 USD) to buy fish and sell fish in the market.

 Minh Thị Nguyễn was born in 1952. She needs to borrow 5,886,000 VND (or 345 USD) to invest in her shop, which sells fresh food, soft drinks, tea, water and more.

 Ngọc Thị Lê was born in 1960. She needs to borrow 5,886,000 VND (or 345 USD) to buy goods, including fresh food, tea and cake, and resell them.

 Hộ Thị Nguyễn was born in 1967. She has a breakfast restaurant. She wants to borrow 3,270,000 VND (or 190 USD) to invest in her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy scrap-cloth to make gloves

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
En 2000, cette femme a débuté le commerce de céréales, elle s’est vite adaptée à ce commerce et vend bien, ce qu’elle gagne comme revenu lui permet de subvenir à certaines charges. Son stock a baissé, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner, c’est pour cette raison qu’elle s’adresse à WAGES pour obtenir son premier cycle de prêt qui lui permettrait d'acheter 5 sacs de maïs,04 sacs d'haricots et 2 sacs de sorgho.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who started selling cereals in 2000. She adapted well to this business, and her sales are good, and her income enables her to provide for some expenses. Her stock has experienced a drop, and she would like to resupply. This is why she's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 5 sacks of corn, 4 sacks of bean, and 2 sacks of sorghum. She's married and the mother of 3 children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 sacks of corn, 4 sacks of bean, and 2 sacks of sorghum

loans.name: Ajayi

texts.en: T. is a 40-year-old married mother of three children. She is a trained nurse and runs her own medicine store, which she set up eight years ago. She is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN in order to buy medicine in large quantities for resale. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders and promises to pay back the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Sharefa Group

texts.en: Sharefa is the group leader of Sharefa group. There are four members in this group. They want to expand their business and make it larger. Sharefa and Sadaf want to take a loan for her husband who has a fruits and vegetables shop. Sha Jan wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Mhnasa wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store. They requested a group loan of 40,000 Afghani and they want to buy the necessary materials. They are happy with this  loan process that can support their entrepreneurship.

loans.use: For expanding their businesses

loans.name: Ajoke

texts.en:
Ajoke is 32 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria.

Ajoke sells sarongs and she is also a fashion designer. She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase sarongs and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: S. is a 40-year-old mother of four children and is married to Hassan. She sells frozen food items and has been in business since 2000. Once a week, she goes to Cotonu (a border town near Lagos) to buy goods, which she then supplies to her customers. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase frozen food items in order to meet customer demand. S. says thank you and promises to pay back the loan in eight equal installments.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Komlanvi Gawonou

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur exerce dans la restauration, il a commencé cette activité depuis 2006 dans son propre cafétéria qu’il a appelé « BON GOUT », les jeunes célibataires viennent déjeuner chez lui et il réalise plus de recettes les week-ends. Il veut installer un autre cafétéria dans un autre quartier pour pouvoir gagner plus d’argent, il demande à WAGES un crédit qui lui permettra de réaliser ce projet.
Il est marié, c’est avec le revenu de cette activité qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who has been working in the restaurant business since 2006 in his own cafeteria, which he calls “BON GOUT”. Young unmarried people come to his place for lunch, and he realizes more income on the weekends. He wants to establish another cafeteria in another district in order to earn more money. He is asking WAGES for a loan enabling him to realize this project. He is married. With the revenues from this business, he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Setting up a new cafeteria

loans.name: Sarah Kabagaya‘S Group

texts.en:
Sarah is the leader of a four-member group. She is 42 years old and divorced, with one child aged nine years who goes to school. Sarah resides in and rents a one-roomed house where she lives with two people. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is no electricity and no piped water at her home but the family gets three meals a day.

Sarah resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She has a stall in Kamwokya Market and so she doesn’t incur any extra transportation costs as she buys from her place of work. She sells to an average of twenty people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week and her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for both accommodation and business, and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last nine years.

Sarah has been with MCDT for over three years and is servicing her seventh loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more bananas. Sarah is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premises and home.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Akomédi

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a appris l’électronique, il a ouvert son propre atelier dans lequel il fait la  réparation et la vente des appareils électroniques, ce commerce lui réussit bien il veut l’agrandir, pour le faire il s’adresse à WAGES pour obtenir son premier crédit  et acheter 8 lecteurs, 15 antennes, 01 carton de VCD, 04 poste téléviseurs.
Il est divorcé de son mari et a ses 02 enfants a sa charge.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who has learned electronics. He opened his own workshop in which he repairs and sells electronic equipment. This is a successful business for him. He wants to expand. To do so, he is inquiring with WAGES to obtain his first loan to buy 8 players, 15 antennas, a box of VCD, and 4 television sets. He is divorced and has two children in his care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electronic equipment

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: astou D. est parent beneficiaire demeurant acamberene.elle s'exerce dans le domaine de la vente de produits cosmetiques.a cause de developpement progressif de son activite elle sollicite un credit de cinquante mille frs pour elargir ses operations.
texts.en:
Astou D. is a client parent staying in Camberene. She works in the field of selling cosmetics. Due to the progressive development of her business, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 francs to expand her operations.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a appris le métier de la soudure,  il est marié et père de 03 enfants, il a ouvert son atelier dans lequel il exerce son activité en 1999. Il ne dispose plus suffisamment de matériaux pour exercer son activité, ce qui a réduit ses recettes journalières, il veut acheter de nouveaux matériaux c’est pour cette raison qu’il s’adresse à WAGES pour obtenir un crédit afin d’acheter 8 feuilles de tôles, 15 tubes carrés, 12 baguettes  et 07 boîtes anti-rouille.
C’est avec le revenu de son activité qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who learned the trade of welding. He is married and the father of three. In 1999, he opened his own workshop in which he operates his business. He no longer has sufficient supplies and equipment to operate, and this has reduced his daily income. He wants to buy new supplies and equipment. For this reason, he is inquiring with WAGES to obtain a loan, so as to buy 8 sheets of metal, 15 square tubes, 12 welding rods, and 7 cans of anti-rust. With the revenues from his business, he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for welding

loans.name: Ayinla

texts.en: Ayinla is 32 years old and owns a boutique where she sells clothes for both men and women. She has been in business for the past five years, and travels once every two weeks to purchase clothes from Togo or Cotonu. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more clothes at a discount. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Agnes Nakazi's Group

texts.en:
Teopista is the leader of a five-member group. She is a 43-year-old divorcee with five children aged between 16 and 29 years old, three of whom are still in school. Teopista resides and works in a semi-urban area, which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a three-roomed house, with electricity but no piped water, where she lives with four other people. Her family get three meals a day, and she doesn’t take care of any additional family members. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for business premises, and food for her family.

For seven years Teopista has run a restaurant in Kamwokya market in one of Kampala's suburbs. She serves an average of 30 customers a day, six days a week. Her business doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys at her place of work from suppliers who obtain food from villages. Teopista has been with Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, for over ten years and is servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more food, charcoal and cutlery. Teopista aspires to see her business grow bigger and hopes to own permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more food, charcoal and cutlery

loans.name: Annonciata

texts.en:
Greetings from M. Annonciata, a 41-year-old widow who lives in Muhima sector, Nyarugenge district in Kigali city, capital of Rwanda. She has one child, 14 years old.

M. is an entrepreneur running her business in Nyarugenge district where she owns a small shop selling different kinds of vegetables such as onions, cabbages, etc. She starts her daily operations at 7:00 a.m. and finishes at 7:00 p.m. and has one worker who helps her to run her business. She has been running the same business since 2003 and earns a monthly profit of approximately $165.

M.’s first loan was while she belonged to the group called Abahuje (Together as One). She is seeking her second loan, worth 500,000 Rwf, from Vision Finance Company and it is her first loan with Kiva. With this loan, M. intends to buy more merchandise for her store and will reinvest the increased profit in the same business and will create more savings.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is a struggling single parent. She is 32 years old and has one child. She sells weavons, hair extensions, and cosmetics in her shop. Hilda is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more weavons, hair extensions, and cosmetics to sell. She says "Thank you."

loans.use: To purchase weavons, hair extensions, and cosmetics

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda B. sells cement to buyers and builders in large quantity. She serves as a distributor to the manufacturing company. She needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase more cement. 

Dauda B. is 44 years old, married, and has four children. She is in a business partnership with her husband. She says "Thank you" and she promises to pay the loan back.

loans.use: To purchase more cement

loans.name: Donatile

texts.en: Donathile M. is a 33-year-old married mother of three children (ages 8, 7, and 1). She runs a small food business where she earns about 260,000 Rwandan francs (FRW) per month. Although this is her first loan with Vision Finance Company, she has managed to employ three people in her business. Donathile has run her business for two years now and is requesting a 500,000 FRW loan to buy juice, milk, and mayonnaise to help with her product offering.

loans.use: Buy juice, milk, and mayonnaise

loans.name: Celine

texts.en: Celine, 45, is happily married and has six children. Celine sells sarongs and bags in her shop. She hopes for the loan of N150,000 to purchase more bags and sarongs to sell. She says "Thank you."

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anufa Group

texts.en: Anufa is the group leader of Anufa group. There are four members in this group. They would like to expand their businesses. They want to take a loan of 56000 Afghani. Anufa wants to take a loan for the business of quilt making. Shawer wants to take a loan for a general store. Nafesa wants to take a loan for her husband who has a fruits and vegetables shop. Bebe Hawa wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. So they are very thankful for AFS and Kiva lenders who can support entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Capital to expand her business

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married and lives with her husband in a small apartment. She enjoys helping her children even though they now live separately.

Galina sells women's clothing at the central market in Kherson city. Her gross income is 7,000 UAH per month. She has been in this business for thirteen years and enjoys this particular type of goods. She is a very disciplined and orderly person. She can listen to people well as well as persuade them well. These qualities help Galina in her sales business as well as in life.

Galina would like to borrow 12,700 UAH to increase her assortment. She hopes to receive additional income and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase her assortment

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget sells "akamu" ("akamu" also called "pap" is produced from corn).The demand for her "akamu" is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is 45 years old and married with 4 children. Bridget is requesting the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more bags of corn to produce more "akamu" to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of corn to produce more akamu to sell

loans.name: Ida Marie

texts.fr: A. est une femme mariée qui vit avec son mari et ses 02 enfants dans le quartier d’agoè. En 2000 elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Avec ce qu’elle gagne comme revenu de son commerce elle contribue énormément aux charges de la famille. Son stock a diminué, elle veut se réapprovisionner pour  rehausser son chiffre d’affaire. Elle sollicite  alors de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de riz, 14 bidons d’huile de 25 litres et 4 sacs de sucre.
texts.en:
A. is a married woman who lives with her husband and children in the Agoè district. In 2000 she started off in the grocery business. With what she earns in terms of revenues from her commerce, she help enormously with meeting family expenses. Her inventory of goods is diminished. She wants to stock up again to regain a higher turnover. She is therefore requesting a loan from WAGES to buy ten sacks of rice, fourteen 25-liter drums of oil, and four sacks of sugar.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: R Ose Naluyima ‘S Group

texts.en:
Rose is the leader of a 5-member group. She is 28 years old, married, with three children aged between 10 and 15. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a five-roomed house where she lives with five people. Rose doesn’t take care of additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala.

Rose sells second-hand clothes in Karerwe Market, in one of Kampala's suburbs. She sells to an average of 10 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works four days a week.

Rose buys these used clothes from Owino, one of the busiest markets in Kampala and uses public transport to and from shopping. Her major monthly expenses includes medication, school fees, and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the past year.

Her main challenge is the rainy season which disrupts her business, as she works from an open place. Rose has been with MCDT for over eight months and is servicing her second loan, working with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more clothes. Rose aspires to see her business grow bigger and own permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for resale

loans.name: Fadicou

texts.fr: fadicou W. est une vendeuse de poissons,elle est parent beneficiaire depuis 1999.elle habite dans la localite de cambereneet capitalise une experience d'une dizaine d'annees dans son activite.pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientele elle se trouve dans l'obligation d'augmenter son fond de roulement.par consequent elle demande un pret de cent mille frs.
texts.en:
Fadicou W. is a fishmonger. She has been a client parent since 1999. She lives in the town of Camberene and capitalizes on about ten years of experience in her business. To satisfy customer demand, she finds herself obliged to boost her working capital. Consequently, she is asking for a loan of 100,000 francs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet sells kerosene, retail and wholesale, to her customers in Lagos state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for the past 7 years. Juliet is 34 years old and married with 3 children. Juliet hopes for the loan amount of N 150,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Eva Nalukwago ‘S Group

texts.en:
Eva is the leader of a 5-member group. She is 35 years old, married, with four children aged between 3 and 10. Her children go to school. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she is living with three adults. Eva takes care of two additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala.

Eva runs a restaurant and so she incurs transport costs to and from shopping. She sells to an average of 40 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for her business, and feeding the family.

Besides this restaurant, Eva sells charcoal. She has been in this business for the last nine years. Eva has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her eighteenth loan, working with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more commodities for her business. Eva is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more things for her restaurant

loans.name: Kafayat

texts.en: Kafayat sells drinks and sachet water, and she also produces cellophane. Kafayat is 27 years old and married with one child. Kafayat lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell. She is grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders for their financial support in these turbulent times.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Lagos state and sells medicines retail to her customers. Sarah is 36 years old and married with 2 children. Sarah is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Khadidiatou

texts.fr: khadidiatou F. est une commercante qui evolue dans la vente de tissus.elle est parent beneficiaire habitant camberene et a une experience de neuf ans.son objectif vise est la diversification de ses produits offerts et l'elargissement de son marche.elle sollicite un credit de 150 000frs.
texts.en:
Khadidiatou F. is a merchant who is developing in the sale of cloth. She is a client parent living in Camberene. She has nine years of experience. Her goal is to diversify the products she offers and to enlarge her market. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is 25 years old. She is married with no children yet. Oksana sells women's and men's clothing at an open-air market in Drogobych city. This market is located close to a bus station. This helps Oksana to serve many people who are traveling or making a connection.

Oksana has been in this business for 3 years. She is constantly increasing her gross income. Oksana is a very happy and full of energy. She would like to borrow 13,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She is committed to work hard to develop this business further.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her clothing shop

loans.name: Haidar

texts.ru: Хайдар Темуров  1975 года рождения, женат имеет 4 детей.  Имеет среднее образования.  Бизнес начал 5 лет назад . Для этого ему помогала мать. Она ездила в Китай за товаром и привозила различную посуду. Со временем она стала брать с собой Хайдара , что он мог научиться и в дальнейшем мог сам справляться с перевозкой и различать какие товары необходимы для потребителей. В настоящий момент торгует с женой в магазине. Продают вазы, тарелки, пиалы, касу (национальная посуда для шурпы) и многое другое.
texts.en:
Haidar T. was born in 1975, is married and has four children. He has secondary education. He started his business five years ago. His mother helped him in this. She traveled to China for the merchandise and brought different kinds of china. With time she started taking Haidar with her so that he could learn and could manage the transportation of goods himself and differentiate which goods are necessary for the consumers. At this time he sells in the store with his wife. They sell plates, bowls, pialas, kasu (national china for shurpa) and many other items.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Мархабо - женщина 38 лет, замужем имеет двоих детей.Закончила ВУЗ и по специальности работает таршим кулинаром в кондитерском и самбусочном цехе города Худжанда. Она вместе  дочерью Мухаё также поле работы работает на дому,она шьёт национальные платья.Хочет получив кредит купить вышивальную швейную машинку.На снимке сама Мархабо поле работы шьёт платье на заказ.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Marhabo is 38 year old woman, she is married and has two children. She graduated from university and is working by profession as a senior chief in a confectionery and sambusa department in the town of Khujand. She and her daughter Muhayo together after work sew national Tajik dresses at home. She wants to take out a loan and buy an embroidery machine. On the photo Marhabo is after work making a custom dress.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Mary  Babirye Group

texts.en:
Mary is the leader of a 4-member group. She is 40 years old and married, with three children aged between 11 and 20. Her children go to school. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she is staying with four people. Mary takes care of one additional family member. There is no electricity and no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala.

Mary sells bananas in Kalerwe market and gets the bananas from farmers out in the villages and so she incurs transport costs. She sells to an average of 30 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for business, feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last nine years. Mary has been with MCDT for over seven years and is servicing her twenty-fourth loan, working with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy a full lorry of bananas. Mary is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning permanent business premises. .

loans.use: to buy a full lorry of bananas

loans.name: Felly

texts.en:
Felly M. is from the village of Sta. Felomina, Iligan City. She is 29 years old. Felly is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Felly owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Felly has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Felly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felly is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Felly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Zulmuhor

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Зулхумор- женщина 43 лет , замужем , имеет троих детей. Сама полностью занимается продажей материалов для костюмов и платьев.За товаром она ездит сама в Бишкек раз в месяц.У неё очень разнообразный ассортимент материалов.Её муж помогает ей по продаже товара, во время её отсутствия  замещает её муж. Для увеличения летнего ассортимента она хочет привезти материи из хлопка.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Zulmuhor is a 43 year old woman, married and has three children. She entirely by herself sells materials for costumes and dresses. She travels for the merchandise herself to Bishkek once a month. She has a wide variety of assorted materials. Her husband helps her with the sales when she is away and he substitutes her. To increase the summer assortment she wants to bring cotton fabrics.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy summer fabrics

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромат Тухтаева  1972 года рождения, замужем  имеет 2 детей.  Имеет среднее образование. Бизнес начала с продажи жвачек и сигарет возле дома, на маленьком столе. Сейчас она торгует фруктами и овощами на рынке более 5 лет.  Настоящее время сезон продажи фруктов и овощей. Зимой продавала бананы и мандарины. Сейчас торгует огурцами и помидорами. А из фруктов: вишня , малина ,  слива , яблоки и самый продаваемый абрикос.  Также осенью планирует продавать гранты, инжир, хурма и айва.
texts.en:
Karomat T. was born in 1972, is married and has two children. She has secondary education. She started her business by selling gum and cigarettes near her house on a small table. Right now she is selling fruits and vegetables on the market for more than five years. This time is a season for selling of fruits and vegetables. In the winter she was selling bananas and mandarins. Right now she is selling cucumbers and tomatoes. And from fruits: cherries, raspberries, plums, apples and most popular apricots. In the fall she plans to sell pomegranates, figs, persimmons, and quinces.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Gulizor

texts.ru: Гулизор Факерова  1971 года рождения, замужем имеет 4 детей. Имеет среднее образование. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2005 года.  Ее бизнес расцветал с года от год. Раньше торговала  только один вида продуктов. Теперь в  ее продаже имеется различные макароны, масло и многое другое. Благодаря поддержки КИВА увеличив свой капитал она расширила оборотные средства. От полученного дохода провела свадьбу выдала дочь замуж. Провела небольшой ремонт дома. Благодарна за поддержку Микроинвест и КИВА.
texts.en:
Gulizor F. was born in 1971, is married and has four children. She has secondary education. She has been working with MicroInvest since 2005. Her business has been flourishing with each year. She used to sell only one kind of product before. Now in her inventory there are different kinds of pasta, butter and many other items. Thanks to the support of Kiva she has increased her working capital and available cash. She used the received income to have a wedding for her daughter's marriage. Also she made a small repair at home. Gulizor is thankful for MicroInvest's and Kiva's support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Teopista Kyazze Group

texts.en:
Teopista is the leader of a 5-member group. She is a 43-year-old, divorced woman with five children aged between 16 and 29. Three of the children go to school. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house where she is living with four people.

Teopista doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala.

Teopista operates a restaurant in Kamwokya market, in one of the Kampala suburbs. She sells to an average of 30 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys at her place of work from suppliers who get food from the villages.

Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for the business, feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last seven years Teopista has been with MCDT for over ten years and is servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more food and charcoal and cutlery. Teopista aspires to see her business grow bigger and own permanent business premises. .

loans.use: buy more food to prepare restaurant dishes

loans.name: Ambaroy

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Амбарой - кредитор в организации уже более трёх лет, она получает каждый вой займ для расширения бизнеса и завоза товара.У неё увеличились активы и товарооборот.Следующий кредит она хочет использовать для завоза из Бишкека летних сарафанов и платьев.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Ambaroy has been taking out loans at our organization for more than three years. She receives each loan for expansion of her business and buying merchandise. She has increased capital and commodity circulation. Her next loan she wants to use to bring in summer garments and dresses from Bishkek.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's clothing
