loans.name: Tutafika Group

texts.en:
Charles P., age 42, is married with three children, ages 15, 13 and 9. He has a tailoring business which he started in 1995. He also sells clothes in his tailoring shop. He works daily from 9.30 a.m. until 8 p.m. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $138.

This will be Charles’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He wants to use this loan to increase capital and to buy a sewing machine.

Charles will share this loan with his loan group, Tutafika, which has 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Charles is first from the left in the second row.

loans.use: Increase capital and buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Namutebi Hadjah's Group

texts.en:
Hadjah is the leader of a five-member group. She is 43 years old and married with five children aged between 6 and 26 years old. Three of her children are in school. Hadjah lives and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a three-roomed house, with electricity but no piped water, where she lives with four other people. Her family get three meals a day, and she doesn’t take care of any additional family members. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for business, and food for her family.

For the last seven years Hadjah has sold milk and bread in Kawempe. She sells to an average of 30 customers a day, seven days a week. She doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys the produce at her place of work. Hadjah has been with Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, for over ten years and is servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more milk and bread. Hadjah aspires to see her business grow bigger and hopes to own permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more milk and bread

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Хамробоева  1960 года рождения, замужем  имеет 4 детей.  Имеет среднее образование.  С мужем имеют магазин  и торгуют бытовой техникой.  Муж ездит за товаром и подготавливает различные документации необходимых для бизнеса. А она сама сидит за прилавком и торгует техникой- телевизор, DVD,  соковыжималки , микроволновой и еще много разной техникой.  Кредит потребовался для оплаты аренды помещения и привоза небольшого товара.
texts.en:
Mahbuba H. was born in 1960. She is married and has four children. She has achieved a secondary education. She and her husband have a store which sells household appliances. Her husband travels to get goods and to obtain various documents necessary for the business. But she alone sits in the stall and sells household goods: televisions, DVD, juicemakers, microwaves as well as a large variety of appliances. The loan is needed to pay rent for the facility and transportation of small goods.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase electronic appliances

loans.name: Afeni

texts.en:
M. is 43 years old, married, and has four children. She sells pepper soup and drinks. She started this business ten years ago and has a sales attendant who assists in the evening during the rush hour.

M. has been borrowing from LAPO without any default in payment. She now needs a loan of N80,000 to purchase more drinks at a discount direct from the company.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Sobirchon

texts.ru: Арипов Собирчон проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 29 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Собирчон более 10 лет занимается торговлей. Он имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует продуктами питания. Клиент просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Sobirchon A. lives in the Qurgan-Tube district. He is 29 years old, married and has 3 children. Sobirchon has been involved in sales for over 10 years. He has a retail store, where he sells food products. Our client is requesting this loan to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru:
Фарход 1980 года рождения женат имеет 2 детей.  Закончив школу  не хватило денег для поступления в университет. Помогал матери торговать на рынке фруктами. Каждый день после школы ходил на рынок и заменял мать. Со временем он настоял на том что сам будет сидеть и торговать. 
На рынке торгует 10 лет . Кредит потребовался для изменения ассортимента товара.
texts.en:
Born in 1980, Farhod is married and has 2 children. After he finished school, he did not have enough money to go to a university. He helped his mother sell fruits at the market. Every day, Farhod went to the market after school to relieve his mother. With time, he insisted that he could sit and sell there by himself. He has been selling at the market for 10 years. Farhod requested this loan to change his product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To change product assortment

loans.name: Sharifbeg

texts.ru: Худоив Шарифбег проживает в городе вахдат. Возраст 40 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Шарифбег более 16 лет занимается торговлей, он имеет арендованный магазин, где торгует продуктами питания. Клиент просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота. На полученную прибыль, он хочет купить себе этот магазин.
texts.en:
Sharifbeg H. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. Sharifbeg has been involved in sales for over 16 years. He leases a store, where he sells food products. Our client is requesting this loan in order to increase his goods turnover. He wants to use the resulting profit to purchase his leased store.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.ru:
Абдуджалил 1976 года рождения , женат имеет 2 детей.  Имеет среднее образование.  Когда женился отец подарил машину, и ему пришла идея использовать машину как такси. Но и этого мало для того что бы прокормить большую семью.  Абдуджалил  также занялся торговлей посуды. Также машину использовали для перевозки своего товара. Когда Абдуджалил уезжает за товаром отец  продолжает использовать машину как такси. А жена в его отсутствии торгует в магазине. 
Кредит  получил для покупки нового товара с Китая.
texts.en:
Born in 1976, Abdujalil 1976 is married and has two children. He achieved secondary education. When he got married, his father gave him a car and the idea came to him to use the car as a taxi. But this is not enough to support a large family. Abdujalil is also engaged in the trade of cookware. The car is also used as transportation for his goods. When Abdujalil goes out to sell his goods, his father continues to use the car as a taxi. In his absence, his wife sells in the store. The loan received will be used to purchase new goods from China.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cookware

loans.name: Vahob

texts.ru: Вахоб Майсабиров  1957 года рождения , женат имеет 5 детей.  Имеет среднее образование. 5 лет назад он вышел на пенсию , тогда его друг пригласил  помогать ему столовой.  Со временем  он отделился и решил печь пирожки на улице.  У него есть собственная  маленькая уличная столовая. Также он является лесничим. Помогают ему дочь и невестка. В обеденный перерыв  у него много посетителей, и он доволен своей работой и благодарит за это Аллаха и КИВА.
texts.en:
Vahob M. was born in 1957. He is married and has five children. He has secondary education. Five years ago, he went into retirement, then his friend asked him to help with a market stall. In time, he went off on his own and decided to bake pirozhkis along the street. He has his own small street stall. He also reports for work as a forestry officer. His daugher and daughter-in-law help him. During the lunch break, he has many visitors. He is pleased with his work and thanks Allaha and Kiva for this.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy flour and different ingredients

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr:
Cette femme est une fille de couturière, ayant remarqué l’intérêt du commerce des vêtements, elle a décidé de commencer ce commerce qu’elle exerce depuis 9 ans déjà. Son stock a connu une baisse ce qui a entraîné la réduction de son chiffre d’affaire. Voulant se réapprovisionner et rehausser on chiffre d’affaire, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des vêtements
Elle est divorcée de son mari et a ses 03 enfants à sa charge, le revenu de son commerce lui permet de subvenir à ses charges et à celles de ses enfants
texts.en:
This woman is a child of dressmaking. Having noticed the interest in the clothing business, she decided to start this business, in which she has been operating for nine years already. Her inventory of merchandise has experienced a drop, which caused a reduction in her sales figures. Wanting to stock up again and to raise her sales, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy clothing. She is divorced and has three children in her care. The revenues from her business enable her to support herself and her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Madina Nalwoga‘S Group

texts.en:
Madina is the leader of a four-member group. She is a 43 years old and married with two children aged 16 and 22, both in school. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house where she lives with four people. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Madina resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She sells cereals in Owino Market and doesn’t incur any transportation costs as she buys from her place of work. She has been in this business for the last seven years and works six days a week. She sells to an average of thirty people a day and sells to all categories of people. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for her business and feeding the family.

Madina has been with MCDT for over ten years and is servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more beans, maize and groundnuts (peanuts). Madina is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and to own permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more beans, maize and groundnuts

loans.name: Gulsunoi

texts.ru: Гулсуной Абдувалиева 1963 года рождения , замужем имеет 3 детей.   Несколько лет вышла на пенсию, н сидеть дома не смогла решила заняться бизнесом. Ее сын мясник , его работа сдавать скот на бойню. Она также  продавала сало коровье и  баранье. Таким образом она начала свой бизнес. Позже накопив  небольшой капитал приобрела мясорубку электрическую. Со временем стала  вывозить на рынок и фарш. Сейчас также хочет расширить свой бизнес и ей необходим кредит для покупки большого товара мяса. Для этого она не хочет просить своего сына , а иметь свой капитал.
texts.en:
Born in 1963, Gulsunoi A. is married and has 3 children. She retired several years ago, but because she could not just stay at home, Gulsunoi decided to get involved in business. Her son is a butcher, whose job is to send livestock to a slaughterhouse. Gulsunoi sold beef and lamb tallow and, thus, started her business. Later, she saved enough money to buy an electric meat grinder. With time, Gulsunoi started to bring ground meat to the market. She currently wants to expand her business and needs a loan in order to buy a large quantity of meat. She does not want to ask her son for the product and, instead, wants to have her own capital.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat

loans.name: Tsokmawu

texts.fr: Ce monsieur habite dans le quartier de Tsotsi qui est un quartier de la ville de Lomé, il est marié à une femme qui est coiffeuse, il a 03 enfants. L’activité génératrice de revenu qu’il exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille est la vente d’appareils électroniques, il l’exerce dans sa boutique qu’il a appelée « ETS JAP ». Il veut acheter de nouveaux appareils electroniques, c’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des appareils électroniques, ainsi il pourra augmenter ses recettes et subvenir aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who lives in Tsotsi, a district in the city of Lomé. He is married to a woman who is a hairdresser. He has three children. His income-generating business, which enables him to provide for his family, involves selling electronics. He operates in his shop he calls “ETS JAP”. He wants to buy new eletronics, which is why he is requesting a loan from WAGES. He will then be able to increase his income and to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electronics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To fix up his premises

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
A. est une femme très dynamique qui exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes. Elle maîtrise parfaitement la gestion de son activité ce qui est dû à son ancienneté dans ce commerce. Son stock a diminué, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes de haute qualité.
Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants.
texts.en:
A. is a very energetic woman who earns an income from commerce in pagnes (colorful West African cloth). She has mastered the managing of her business because of her seniority in this commerce. Her stock of merchandise is diminished. She would like to stock up again and is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 20 bolts of pagnes of high quality. She is married and the mother of four.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy West African batik cloth

loans.name: Kudzo

texts.fr: Kudzo A. est âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est distillateur de « sodabi » à Womé, un village situé au sud-ouest du Togo. « Sodabi » est une liqueur locale qui est obtenu à partir du vin de palme. Avec ce crédit, Kudzo souhaite acheter des palmiers et des outils de travail pour élargir sa capacité de production. La vue a été prise à coté de son atelier. Il a acquis cette moto pour mieux faire ses courses
texts.en:
Kudzo A., age 32, is married and the father of two. He is a distiller of sodabi in Womé, a village located in southwest Togo. Sodabi is a local spirit which is obtained from palm wine. With this loan, Kudzo wishes to buy palm trees and some work tools to expand his production capacity. The photo was taken next to his workshop. He acquired this motorbike for making his runs easier.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm trees and work tools

loans.name: Séna

texts.fr: Cette dame habite avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier de nykonapoè qui est un quartier périphériques de la ville de Lomé, après une étude approfondie des besoins des résidents de ce quartier elle a débuté le commerce en détail d’eau en sachets appelés « PURE WATER ». Elle réalise de bons chiffres d’affaire tous les jours. Faisant face en ce moment à une rupture de stock elle sollicite pour se réapprovisionner de WAGES un crédit pour acheter  400 sachets d’eau « Pure Water ».
texts.en:
This is a woman who lives with her husband and children in Nykonapoè, an outlying district of the city of Lomé. Following an in-depth study of resident needs in this district, she started a retail business selling water in baggies called "PURE WATER". She realizes good sales figures everyday. Facing at this time an inventory shortage, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to stock up again with 400 baggies of "Pure Water" brand water.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy water in "PURE WATER" sachets

loans.name: Kiwa Jesca‘S Group

texts.en:
Jesca is the  leader of a four-member group. She is a 37 years old and married with four children aged between 12 and 18 years, none of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she lives with three people. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Jesca resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She has a stall selling charcoal and a retail shop in Wandegeya (Katanga) and so she doesn't incur any extra transportation costs as she buys from her place of work. She sells to an average of twenty people a day and sells to all categories of people. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for both accommodation and business, and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last nine years and works seven days a week.

Jesca has been with MCDT for over three years and is servicing her seventh loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more commodities for her shop and charcoal for her stall. She is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent business premises and home.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and commodities for her shop

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi A. est âgé de 31 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est conducteur de taxi à Womé. A. exerce cette activité depuis 4 ans. Il désire avec ce crédit réparer le moteur de sa voiture étant donné que celui-ci est vétuste et est la cause de plusieurs dépenses. Kossi compte sur cette opportunité pour épargner plus afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossi A. is 31 years old, is married, and is the father of 2 children. He is a taxi driver in Womé. A. has been doing this job for 4 years. With this loan he wants to repair his car's motor as it is run down and is the cause of many expenditures. Kossi counts on this opportunity to save more in order to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his car's motor

loans.name: Koamivi

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et a 02 enfants, l’activité génératrice de revenu qu’ elle exerce est le commerce de produits congelés, elle a commencé ce commerce en 2006. La majorité de ses clients exercent dans la restauration. Ce commerce lui est très rentable. Le stock de marchandise  dont elle dispose actuellement ne  lui permet pas de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle. Pour rehausser son stock elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 cartons de divers produits congelés.
texts.en:
This woman is married and has 2 children. To generate revenue she sells frozen foods. She began this business in 2006. The majority of her customers are in food service. This business is very profitable for her. The stock of merchandise that she has currently does not allow her to satisfy the needs of her clientele. In order to build up her stock, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 20 boxes of assorted frozen foods.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase frozen foods

loans.name: Setsoafia

texts.fr: Setsoafia K. est un homme de 45 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il est revendeur de carburant à womé. Setsoafia est un cultivateur et il exerce ce commerce pour augmenter ses revenus. Il souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son commerce afin de mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Setsoafia K. is a 45 year old man who is married and has 4 children. He is a fuel retailer in Womé. Setsoafia is a farmer and he is in this business to increase his revenues. With this loan he wishes to increase the size of his business in order to better meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the size of his business

loans.name: Aidahnassuna  ‘S Group

texts.en:
Aidah is the leader of a 4-member group. She is 37 years old and married with four children aged between 12 and 18. All her children go to school. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she is staying with her family. Aidah takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala.

Aidah sells bananas in Bwaise Market and so she doesn't incur any extra transport costs as she buys from her place of work. She sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for both house and business, and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last nine years.

Aidah has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bananas for resale. Aidah is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning permanent business premises and a home.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is married. She sells various cosmetic items at a market in Kherson city. Olena started this business about 10 years ago. At that time she lost her job and needed a source of income. She knew some friends who already were involved in a sales business. She decided to try and the attempt was successful!

Today Olena has many customers and always offers them good quality products at affordable prices. Olena would like to borrow 15,240 UAH to increase her assortment. She has tried small business loans several times and has found them to be a good aid for her business.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing goods for grocery marketing

loans.name: Chidima

texts.en: Chidima sells drinks and cooked foods. Chidima is 27 years old and married with 3 children. She is very vibrant and energetic in business. Chidima is determined to pull her children up out of poverty. Chidima is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to buy more foodstuffs and drinks. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Mahmadchon

texts.ru: Махмадчон Миров проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 50 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Махмадчон более 20 лет занимается земледелием, он выращивает огурцы, картофель, лук и т.д. До этого он работал колхозником. Собирая свой урожай он продает его на рынке. Клиент просит кредит, для покупки минеральных удобрений и семян.
texts.en:
Mahmadchon M. lives in the Yavan district. He is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. Mahmadchon has been involved in agriculture for over 20 years. He grows cucumbers, potatoes, onions, etc. Previously, he worked as a farmer. He gathers his harvest and sells it at the market. Our client is requesting this loan to purchase mineral fertilizer and seeds.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Nakimera Maxy  ‘S Group

texts.en:
Maxy is the leader of a 5-member group. She is 52 years old, divorced, with five children aged between 25 and 38 years. None of her children goes to school. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she is staying with three people. Maxy doesn't take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala.

Maxy has a stall in Naalukolongo market selling charcoal and so she doesn't incur any extra transport costs as she buys from her place of work. She sells to an average of 25 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for both accommodation and business, and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last nine years.

Maxy has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bananas. Maxy is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Bobosadik

texts.ru: Бобосадик Назаров проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 50 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Бобосадик более 22 лет занимается земледелием, он в основном выращивает огурцы. До этого он работал колхозником. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить зерна и минеральные удобрения.
texts.en:
Bobosadik N. lives in the Yavan district. He is 50 years old, married and has 4 children. Bobosadik has been involved in agriculture for over 22 years. He mainly grows cucumbers. Previously, he worked as a farmer. Our client is requesting this loan in order to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria has a grinding machine that she uses to grind pepper, tomatoes and beans. She also sells provisions. Maria’s diversification of business comes as a result of her determination to lift her family up out of poverty and to increase her profitability. Maria is 50 years old and married with 5 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Mayi Kasozi  ‘S Group

texts.en:
Mayi is the leader of a 5-member group. She is 45 years old, married, with six children aged between 17 and 31 years. None of her children goes to school. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she is staying with four people. Mayi takes care of three additional family members. There is no electricity or piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala.

Mayi operates a retail shop in Makerere market and so she incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. She sells to an average of 30 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for business, and feeding the family. Besides this retail shop, she sells charcoal. She has been in this business for the last nine years.

Mayi has been with MCDT for over eight months and is servicing her second loan, working with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more commodities for her shop. Mayi is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more products for resale

loans.name: Sadiya

texts.ru: Садия Мачидова проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 36 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Садия более 3 лет занимается животноводством, она покупает крупно рогатый скот откармливает и продает. Ее муж работает ветеринаром, он тоже помогает супруге по бизнесу. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы купить крупно рогатый скот.
texts.en:
Sadiya Machidova lives in the Yavan region. She is 36 years old. She is married and has four children. Sadiya has been doing animal husbandry for more than three years. She buys large cattle, feeds it and sells it. Her husband works as a veterinarian, he also helps his spouse in the business. The client is asking for a loan to buy large cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Sendia

texts.en:
Sendia is married with two children. She sells women's clothing at the central market in Vinogradovo city. She has been in this business for 7 years. When she graduated from high school there were no jobs available, and Sendia decided to start her own business. She saw that there was a high and constant demand for women's clothing, so she decided to go into clothing sales.

The business began to grow little by little. Today her net income is 5,000 UAH per month and is a stable source of income for her family. Sendia would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to increase the assortment of her goods. She hopes to receive additional income and further improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of her goods

loans.name: Rose Nasubuga‘S Group

texts.en:
Rose is the leader of a 4-member group. She is 42 years old, married, with four children aged between 3 and 10 years. Her children go to school. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she is staying with four people. Rose takes care of additional family members. There is no electricity or piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala.

Rose sells fruits and vegetables in Ndeeba market and so she incurs no extra transport costs as she buys from her place of work. She sells to an average of 30 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for business, and feeding the family. Besides fruits and vegetables, she sells charcoal. She has been in this business for the last nine years.

Rose has been with MCDT for over seven years and is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more commodities for her shop. Rose is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning permanent business premises. .

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Zikrullo

texts.ru: Зикрулло Махматрачабов проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 36 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Зикрулло более 5 лет занимается земледелием. До этого он работал учителем. Зикрулло собрав урожай продает его на рынке. В данный момент Зикрулло собрав урожай пшеницы, хочет посеить кукурузу.
texts.en:
Zikrullo M. lives in the Yavan region. He is 36 years old. He is married and has four children. Zikrullo has been in agriculture for more than five years. He worked as a teacher before that. Zikrullo sells his harvest on the market. At this time Zikrullo has collected his wheat harvest and wants to sow corn.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
Mrs. Silveria is 47 years old and works making children’s clothes.  She has her own store and tailor's shop in the back of her house.  When she was younger she worked in Argentina, where she learned the profession.  She then came to open her own business in her country.  

She thanks the Fundación Paraguaya for the capital they have helped her obtain.  One of her dreams is to have her own brand of children's clothing.

loans.use: The purchase of corduroy fabric

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia sells foodstuffs and rechargeable phone cards, and she also offers phone calls. Felicia is 32 years old and married with 3 children. Felicia hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and rechargeable phone cards

loans.name: Nuluat Namuwonge ‘S Group

texts.en:
Nuluat is the leader of a four-member group.  She is 33 and married with four children between 9 and 15 years old. All of her children go to school. She rents a four-room house where she stays with six people. Nuluat takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water in her home. The family gets three meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. Nuluat has a stall for selling bananas in the Bwaise Market. She doesn't incur any extra transport costs as she buys from her place of work. She sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for both accommodation and business, and feeding the family.  She has been in this business for the last nine years.

Nuluat has been with MCDT, a Kiva partner, for more than three years and is servicing her seventh loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bananas. Nuluat aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premise and home. 

.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha A. is a divorced mother of two daughters, who are currently in primary school. She is twenty-eight years old and lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, in the Western Region of Ghana. Martha is a baker.  She supplies retailers and beverage sellers in her community and also hawks to sell. She buys bags of flour and other ingredients in Kumasi. She has been in business for fourteen years and is requesting a loan to buy ingredients in bulk. Martha wants to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia A. is a married mother of six children, three sons and three daughters, who are all currently in junior high and primary school. She is forty years old and lives with her husband and children in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, in the Western Region of Ghana. Cecilia is a baker. She bakes bread in her community, supplying retailers and beverage sellers, and she also hawks to sell. She buys bags of flour and other ingredients in Kumasi. Cecilia has been in business for three years and requests a loan to buy ingredients in bulk. She wants to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.en:
Mrs. Bernarda M. is 46 years old and is married to Miguel Matto, who is 41 and is a carpenter. The couple has two daughters, Vivian who is 17, and Fátima who is 8. 

Bernarda owns a bakery that has been in business for over twelve years. They currently have a well-established clientele thanks to the quality of their products and the attention they give to their clients. The money from the loan will go towards the purchase of flour in large quantities in order to get a better price.

In the future, Bernarda would like to buy an electric oven in order to expand her bakery so that she can meet the demands of her clients. Additionally she would like to live in a country with better security, where it is more peaceful and where she can work better.

loans.use: To purchase flour in large quantities

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace M. is thirty-nine years old and divorced with four children, one son and three daughters. Some are in senior high, while others are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town in the Western region called Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. She is a hard-working woman. Grace runs a grocery store, selling groceries such as powdered cocoa mix, sugar, rice, candies and bread in a store on the street. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy more provisions to build up her business. She hopes to improve her standard of living and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy provisions to sell

loans.name: Alice Nanfuka ‘S Group

texts.en:
Alice is the leader of a five-member group.  She is thirty-nine years old and a widow with five children, ranging in age from seven to twenty. All her children go to school. Alice owns a six-room house where she lives with seven people, taking care of an additional family member.  There is electricity and piped water at her home and the family gets two meals a day. Her home and business are located on the outskirts of Kampala. Her stall is at Kalerwe Market, one of the busiest markets in suburban Kampala. She sells to an average of twenty customers a day, who are from all categories of people.  Alice works seven days a week, and uses public transport to work. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees and food for the family, She has been in this business for fifteen years. Her main challenge is the rainy season because her stall is in an open area. Alice has been with MCDT for over eight months and is on her second loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more bananas and fish to sell from her stall.  Alice is hopeful of seeing her business grow bigger, and she looks forward to owning a permanent business location.
.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and fish for her stall

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is forty-five years old and married with six children, three sons and three daughters. All are currently in school - senior high, junior high and primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a farmer and Elizabeth trades in food stuffs – cassava, plantain and yams. She sells from a table top at the market square and also supplies other retailers and food vendors. She needs a loan to buy yams in bulk. Elizabeth has been in business for ten years. She wants to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca C. is 26 years old and has been married to Esequiel Duarte, 32 years old, for more than five years. Esequiel has been an employee of a local business since 1999, and he helps support the living costs of his family with his income. Together the couple has a two-year-old daughter. 

Mrs. Blanca started her business six years ago. It is located in the bus terminal in the city of Caaguazú. There she sells food, candy, sodas, and various other items. The current project for the couple is to be able to finish building their house, which lacks some details. They would also like to continue growing economically in order to give their children a better future. 

They are applying for the loan in order to buy more merchandise to sell that will increase the inventory they offer to clients.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina S.-Boakye is forty-six years old and married with four children, two sons and two daughters. All are currently in school - senior high, junior high and primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband works at the local government hospital. Augustina manufactures and sells local soap called ‘Alata soap’. She sells from a table top at the market square and also supplies other retailers. She wants a loan to buy ingredients such as soda and palm oil.  Augustina has been in business for ten years and hopes to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy soda and palm oil

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia is happily married with five children and she is 39 years old. Cecelia sells drinks and foodstuffs. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret B. trades in printed textiles – fancy, java, wax, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi and sells at the market square in her community. Margaret treks to other markets to sell as well. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy textiles in bulk. 
Margaret is 45 years old, widowed and has given birth to two children, both sons, who are currently in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Margaret wants to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Yomny

texts.en:
Mr. Yomny G. is 26 years old and is married to Amelia Franco, who is 31.  Together they have a daughter, Nadia, who is 16 months old.  

Inspired by the advice of a friend, Yomny decided to start his own small business selling used car batteries, scrap metal and boxes. 

The money from the loan will go toward the purchase of new batteries that are brought from Brazil at a very good price, which assures a larger profit margin.  Additionally he would like to purchase bottles, cans and other products for those who are interested in these products.  His dream is to have a country with greater opportunities for people who want to work.

loans.use: for the purchase of batteries

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Kemi is 23 years old and married with a child. She sells baby things like pampers, cream, etc. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more baby things to sell.She says thanks to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more baby things to sell

loans.name: Groupement Des Agents De Santé Communautaire De Palmarin 2

texts.fr: Nous « Groupement des Agents de Santé Communautaire de Palmarin »  venons auprès de Kiva solliciter un renouvellement de notre prêt.  Le bilan que nous avons fait de notre premier prêt réf : 29543  a été positif. C’est pourquoi nous voudrions disposer d’un autre prêt pour continuer nos activités génératrices de revenu comme la création d’une banque céréalière pour satisfaire la demande de la population locale.
texts.en:
We, in an association of community health workers of Palmarin (Groupement des Agents de Santé Communautaire de Palmarin), are here to request from Kiva a renewal of our loan. The ultimate results we achieved with our first loan, ref. 29543, were positive. This is why we would like to have at our disposal another loan to continue our income-generating businesses, such as the creation of a grain bank for meeting the demands of the local population.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell grains

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Guerreros Para Cristo 4 Group

texts.en:
The members of this group of five micro-entrepreneurs live in a small sugarcane settlement called Batey Guerrero. It is a small "neighborhood" only three streets long. During the cutting season, some people, specially male workers, work the fields and generate some kind of income. However, during the off-season employment in the batey is almost nonexistent and people don't have money to purchase the merchandise offered by those self-employed.

Luis B. is this group's representative. He sells clothing for a living. In most cases it's better for him to go to La Romana or other large towns to sell on market days. He will use this second loan he's receiving from Esperanza to buy fresher clothes to sell during the summer months. His dream is to have his own large boutique and own a house where he can live with his family.

loans.use: To purchase summer clothing to sell

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is 32 years old and is married to Sonia who is 36 years old.  Together the couple has two sons, 5 and 2 years old. 

Cesar has worked delivering bread for more than ten years.  Every day he gets up at 4 am in order to go about his daily activities, as he has to go to neighboring cities to carry out his work.  During the day he travels a total of 300 km to deliver his products.  He goes from city to city, offering breads and pastries, and thanks to his well-established clientele he always sells all of his products, and sometimes he runs out of merchandise. 

Cesar is very happy with his job, and he has been able to purchase a vehicle and the basic necessities for his home.  He has some economic support, as his wife is a teacher. 

The loan will be used to purchase breads, in order to be able to meet the demand of his clients.

loans.use: The purchase of breads

loans.name: Guerreros Para Cristo Group 2

texts.en:
These five entrepreneurs are members of the Guerreros para Cristo Bank of Hope. They are all located in Batey Guerrero outside La Romana. This is a small settlement very much dependent on sugar-cane cutting, the work of most of its population. Even their houses are owned by the sugar-cane company. Because the community is so small, they can't all work inside it, so some people do business elsewhere. 

Margarita B. is an elderly woman who had eight children, the youngest of whom is 12 years old. She supplies a large amount of the demand for cooking fuel in the community by selling charcoal. With this loan, she will also buy matches and cooking gas to sell to the few people in the batey who own gas stoves. She hopes her profits increase and allow her to buy a house outside the batey, where she has more business opportunities. 

Thank you for supporting this Kiva loan!

loans.use: Purchasing charcoal for resale

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Mr. Juan Gilberto is 41 years old, a bricklayer, and is married to Mrs. Benicia who is 34 and works as a housekeeper in their city, Itá.  The couple has a daughter named Monserrat who is six years old and is in elementary school. 

Juan Gilberto travelled to Buenos Aires and started his career as a bricklayer there 18 years ago.  He chose this path because his father got sick at a young age, and he could not go to college.  He has known this profession almost all of his adult life.  After 15 years he returned to Paraguay.  He currently has many clients and he works constructing, painting and repairing houses. 

Juan is applying for this loan to buy the tools he needs to carry out his work.  With the purchase of these tools he will be able to increase his income and the well being of his family.

loans.use: The purchase of tools for his business

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa G. is 23 years old. She is married and has given birth to one child, a son who is currently in primary school. She lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. 

Her husband is a police officer while she is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves). Yaa hawks to sell. She wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. Yaa buys bags of maize and other ingredients from nearby communities. She has been in business for two years. Yaa aspires to expand her business and give her son a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Sakrat

texts.en: Sakrat sells underwear and slippers.  She is 32 years old and married with a child.  Sakrat lives in Badagry, in the Lagos state.  Sakrat hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more underwear and slippers to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: Purchase underwear and slippers to sell.

loans.name: Manantial De Vida : Grupo 4 Group

texts.en:
Luz U. (far left) lives in a neighborhood just outside the city of Las Terrenas, in the Dominican Republic.  She has been selling clothing and shoes for the last two years.  She seeks a loan to increase her inventory.  She is one member of a five women group, who all seek to start or grow their current businesses.

Luz sells door to door, pulling a cart with various shirts, shoes and blouses.  She once sold her goods from a van, that she drove to farther away places, but it broke down, limiting her mobility. 

This loan will be her first.  Luz is hoping to use the additional income to supplement her current inventory and to begin saving up for a new vehicle to expand her business.   A better stocked inventory and transportation to help her sell to those who live farther away will aid Luz and help improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Increase in the inventory of clothing and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice M. is a 36 year old Rwandan entrepreneur who is married. She and her husband have five children ages: 15, 13, 8, 7 and 3. She lives in the Muhima sector of Nyarugege in Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda.

Beatrice does business in her neighborhood where she sells charcoal. She is requesting her first loan of 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company to buy more charcoal. Beatrice started her business in 2004 and turns a monthly profit. She has two workers who help run the business. Beatrice starts her day at 6:00 a.m. and finishes at 8:00 p.m. She will reinvest her profits in her business.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Repair greenhouses and purchase seeds.

loans.name: Juliet |Kirwana  ‘S Group

texts.en:
Juliet is the leader of a five member group.  She is 52 years old, married with three children, ages 16 to 24.  Her children go to school. 

She owns a six room house where she stays with six people.  Juliet takes care of three additional family members.  There is electricity and piped water at her home.  Her family gets two meals a day. 

She works in a semi urban area near Kampala.  Juliet owns a poultry firm in Kyebando, a Kampala suburb.  She sells to about 20 people a day.   She works seven days a week.  Her major expenses include medication, school fees and feeding her family,  She has been in business for fifteen years.

Juliet has been with MCDT for over eight months and is servicing her second loan.  She is working with the same group mates.  She wants this loan to buy more chicken feed.  One day Juliet hopes to own 1000 chickens.
.

loans.use: Buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor A. deals in livestock. He buys cattle all the way from northern Ghana. Victor sells to the butchers and restaurant operators in his community. He has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy livestock in bulk. 
Victor is 41 years old, married and has four children – two sons and two daughters. They are in senior high, junior high and primary schools. Victor’s wife is a trader. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in the town of Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Dwenase is a commercial and farming town. Victor is hoping to give his children the best education.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Nakanjako Margaret‘S Group

texts.en:
Margaret sells food in Kasubi Market--one of Kampala's suburbs. She sells to an average of 50 people a day and sells to all kinds of people. Margaret buys raw ingredients from Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Kampala, and uses public transport to get to and from shopping. Besides frying food, she operates a ladies salon also in Kasubi. She has been in business for the last nine years. She works seven days a week. Her main challenge is the rainy season which disrupts her as she works in an open place.

Margaret is the leader of the five members of this group. Margaret lives and works in a semi urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She is 37 years old and married with four children, ages 2 to 12 years. Three of her children go to school. She lives in a rented two-room house with six people (Margaret takes care of additional family members). There is electricity but no piped water in her home. The family gets two meals a day. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees and food for the family.

Margaret has been with MCDT for over eight months and is on her second loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more cooking oil and wheat flour. Margaret wants to see her business grow bigger and would like to own permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa D. is a fish monger. She sells smoked fish. She sells the fish on a tabletop at the market square. Adwoa also supplies retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in Kumasi and smokes them herself. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk.

Adwoa is 38 years old, married and has five children – two sons and three daughters. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Adwoa wants to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa B. sells footwear for both men and women. Adwoa hawks to sell her goods and also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

Adwoa is 31 years old, married and has two children, a boy and a girl, who are currently in junior high and primary schools. Her husband is a trader. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Adwoa wants to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo is the mother of three children and she is 25 years of old. Taiwo sells foodstuffs and drinks in her shop. Taiwo hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thank you!

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Saak Guiss 2 Group

texts.fr: Nous sommes un groupement de femmes qui habite l'écovillage de Palmarin. Ayant déjà bénéficié d’un prêt qui a été bien remboursé sans difficulté majeure, nous voulons continuer à mener nos activités sur la production et la vente de denrées alimentaire transformées (pâte d'arachide, couscous, haricot, et sel). Nous  souhaitons  pourvoir  fournir tout le village en denrées alimentaires et même ravitailler en nourriture les pêcheurs qui vont en haute mer. Avec le premier prêt, nous avons pu construire un  magasin de stockage. Cependant, avec ce nouveau prêt, nous souhaitons renforcer notre capacité de stockage en denrées et changer notre matériel d'extraction de sel qui est vétuste.
texts.en:
We are a group of women who live in the eco-village of Palmarin. Having already benefited from a loan, which has been repaid without much difficulty, we want to continue to manage our businesses producing and selling processed foods (peanut butter, couscous, beans, and salt). We wish to be able to furnish the entire village with foodstuff and even to resupply the fishermen with food for their trips on the high seas. With the initial loan, we were able to build a store house. However, with this new loan, we wish to bolster our capacity to store foods and to change out our salt extraction equipment, which dilapidated.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell foodstuff

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana N. is forty-eight years old, married, and has given birth to seven children: four sons and three daughters. All are currently in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a farmer.

Susana is a trader and trades in cereals – maize. She has been in business for ten years and supplies to other retailers and food vendors. She buys her goods from nearby communities and wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy assorted vegetables

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola sells weavons, hair extensions and hair cream in her shop. She is also a hairdresser. Bola is 34 years old and married with two children. Bola is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more weavons and hair extensions to sell. She says thank you!

loans.use: To purchase more weavons and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr: anna N. est parent beneficiaire habitant la zone de camberene.elle evolue dans le domaine de l'aviculture avec une experience de sept ans.elle demande un pret decent mille frs afin d'augmenter son fond de roulement.
texts.en:
Anna N. is a UIMCEC client who lives in Camberene. She has 7 years experience working in poultry farming. She is requesting a 100,000 franc loan to increase her working capital.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina A. is the proprietress of a day care school. She has employees that help her to take care of the children. Georgina wants to develop the school. She is requesting a loan to buy logistics such as desks, etc. to build the school. She has been in business for three years.

Georgina is 44 years old, married and has four children: three sons and one daughter. All are currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Georgina wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy school desks

loans.name: Asma

texts.en: Asma A. is 31 years old. He is married and the father of one child who is currently breastfeeding. He lives with his wife at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana. He operates a licensed chemical shop with his wife in the village where they hail from. It is his desire to provide a better education for his child through his business proceeds. He owns and operates a pharmacy shop called ‘George Boamah Chemical Store’. He is the person who supplies the surrounding villages with pharmaceutical drugs. He's gotten training on how to administer drugs for patients. A. has passion and commitment for what he is doing and because of that, lots of people buy drugs from his shop. He requests a loan to buy assorted pharmaceutical drugs, which are frequently demanded by his customers. He takes delivery of drugs from Kumasi in the Ashanti. He also has a direct supply from the wholesalers. He would be grateful for support. He belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Nsawom” which literally means God has a hand in it.

loans.use: For the purchase of pharmaceutical drugs.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia A. is a 36-year-old woman. She is married with five children who are currently in school. She lives in the family house at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana. She is a food vendor and serves food like rice and stew. She says demand for food is on the higher side but she does not have adequate funds for expansion. Leticia has been in food production for six years now in taking care of the family. She wants to use the loan to buy meat and rice to increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support her husband to provide for her family and their education. Leticia belongs to the village bank called ‘Prayer is the key’. She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more rice and meat

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola sells foodstuffs at retail to her customers. Bola is 40 years old and married with three children. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Diaa Dial 2 Group

texts.fr: Ayant réussi une première fois l’expérience avec Kiva, nous revenons solliciter Kiva avec un nouveau prêt pour travailler et gagner notre vie dignement. Nous sommes un groupe de femmes qui s'exercent dans la commercialisation de produits de pêche transformés (poisson sec, huître, crevettes et autres fruits de mers séchés). Nous achetons les produits frais que nous transformons séchage, fumage) et que nous allons vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires qui se tiennent dans les différends points de vente de la région. Notre groupe veut travailler avec les femmes du village en renouvelant notre matériel d'extraction de sel pour rendre notre capacité de production plus rentable. Parmi nous, il y a celles qui veulent faire du commerce de produits céréaliers. Ce qui fait plusieurs activités différentes, mais qui font que notre groupe puisse être solidaire pour le remboursement du prêt. Le groupe qui fera l'extraction du sel aura une plus grande production lui permettant d'exporter son produit hors de la région. Nous avons choisi ces trois activités pour ne pas connaitre une période de pause. Avec cela, nous sommes sûres de ne pas interrompre notre travail
texts.en:
Successful with an earlier experience with Kiva, we are returning to request a new loan from Kiva to work and to earn our living in dignity. We are a group of women who work in the marketing of processed seafood (dried fish, oysters, shrimp, and other dried seafood). We buy the fresh product that we process (drying and smoking) and that we go to sell it at the weekly markets, which take place at different outlets in the region. Our group wants to work with the women of the village by refurbishing our salt extraction equipment in order to make our production capacity more beneficial. Among us, there are women who want to do commerce in grain products, which means several different businesses, but which means that our group may then work in solidarity to repay the loan. The salt extraction group will have greater production, enabling it to export its product outside the region. We have chosen these businesses in order not to experience downtime. We would then be sure to avoid interruptions in our work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell seafood products, to do commerce, and to extract salt

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Cristo 1 Group

texts.en:
Carolina B. (far left), is a member of the Mujeres con Cristo group in the city of Samaná, Dominican Republic.  She has two children, ages 16 and 8 months, and currently lives with her mom.  Carolina is seeking her first loan with Esperanza, and is excited to start her own business selling household cleaning products to others in her neighborhood.  Recognizing that she herself frequently buys cleaning products, and observing that her neighbors do the same, Carolina is seeking to cater her business to this demand.  Her inventory will include, among other products, detergent, soap and cleaning tools.

Carolina wishes to better her life, and the life of her children, through the profits her new business will bring.  She not only wants to watch her business grow, but seeks to apply the profits to purchase a new house.  While she currently lives with her mom, she brightens at the thought of having a house in which her 8-month-old child can grow up.  Carolina is very appreciative of any support you are able to provide!

loans.use: To purchase detergent, soap, and other household cleaning products

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort C. is 45 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, one boy and two girls. All are currently in the senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a trader. Comfort is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew. She sells on a tabletop by the roadside from morning to evening. She wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. Comfort buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah runs two businesses at the same time. She prepares and sells rice porridge with bread that she hawks in the community where she lives. She says it is tiresome to hawk in the sun carrying hot porridge on your head. She balances that with a mini boutique selling items like shirts, skirts, underwear, etc. in a rented store at the market. Sarah has an employee who assists her with the running of the store. She pays her at the end of every month. She needs a loan to upgrade her inventory in the boutique. With this loan she wants to increase her stock of jeans, shirts, and underwear, etc.

Sarah is 42 years old, divorced and the mother of two children. All her children are currently in school in the community where they live. She wants to provide for the educational needs of her children through the profit from her business. She belongs to a village bank called Nyame Tease which means "God Lives."

loans.use: To buy clothing materials and bags of rice etc.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa S. sells meat. She sells on a tabletop at the market square. She also supplies other retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys her goods from Kumasi. Adwoa has been in business for over eighteen years and wants a loan to buy meat in bulk.

Adwoa is 56 years old, married and has five children: two sons and three daughters who are currently out of school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She wants to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana A. is thirty eight years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has all of the children in school.

She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil for ten years now. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits and the palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil which is produced first. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil. She produces and supplies to food vendors who use it to prepare their meals and she even treks to the villages to purchase the finished goods elsewhere when demand becomes very high.

She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts and gallons (containers) to store the oil to increase her efficiency by producing in larger quantities. She believes this will help to expand her business, to raise more income to support her husband, to provide food for her family and to finance her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called “Nyame Mere” meaning “God’s Time”.

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine to increase her efficiency

loans.name: Libasse

texts.fr: libasse L. est un parent beneficaire qui evolue dans le domaine du transport dans la localite de camberene depuis plus de cinq ans.il solicite un pret de 150 000frs pour l'entretien de son vehicule.
texts.en:
Libasse L. is a UIMCEC client who has worked in transportation in the town of Camberene for more than 5 years. He is requesting a 150,000 franc loan for the maintenance of his vehicle.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Mrs. Florencia D. is 50 years old and is married to Mr. José Flor, who works for a public transportation company.  Together they have four children, two girls and two boys.  The oldest two children are about to finish college in the public accounting field, and the other two are in high school. 

Mrs. Florencia works making and selling fast foods, such as empanadas, tenderloins and other snacks.  To be able to start this business 19 years ago, she needed the help of her husband, who helped her save a small amount of money in order to start her own business, taking advantage of a convenient bus location. 

Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and the delicious food she makes, Florencia and her business have established a large clientele.  The loan is for the purchase of refrigerator, which is essential for storing the ingredients for her food.  One dream for Florencia is that all of her children finish college.

loans.use: The purchase of a refrigerator

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is 33 years old, married and the mother of two beautiful girls. Her husband is a farmer. Her children are in school because of government free compulsory education. She is a very hardworking young mother who works all day. She operates a hairdressing salon in front of her house. She has been in business for five years now. She always tries new styles for her clients and, because of that, many people come to her to have their hair done. She requests a loan to buy a hair dryer, weavings etc. to service her clients. She belongs to a village bank called Nyame Mere meaning "God’s Time."

loans.use: To buy mesh, weavings, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia A. sells provisions at Kpeme in Hohoe. Cecelia has received junior high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver who earns little for a living.

Cecelia has been selling provisions since 2004. She is responsible for the paying of utility bills and school fees for the children. Her loan will be used to buy more provision to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Edem

texts.en: Edem D. sells assorted provisions at Kpeme in Hohoe. She is a single parent with one child. Edem has received senior high school education. She has been selling provisions since 2006. She is solely responsible for her own financial needs and those of her child. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She hopes to save the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia A. is a food vendor. Emilia prepares and sells kenkey. She sells on a tabletop at the market square. She wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. Emilia buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for four years.

Emilia is 29 years old, married and has one child, a son, who is currently in primary school. Her husband works with an environmental protection agency. She lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. She wants to expand her business and give her son a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Owusu

texts.en:
Owusu started selling fish 15 years ago at the Sefwi Dwinase community market. Owusu prepares and serves very tasty, good quality fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand. At the community market where she sells, she is the queen mother of all the smoked fish sellers. She has a cunning spirit and is able to convince her suppliers to provide more fish to her when there is a high demand for fish and supply is low. She buys stocks of fish from fishmongers. She has a large customer base that travels from other parts of the surrounding communities to buy her fish. 

Owusu is 57 years old, married and the mother of seven children. Currently, four are in senior high school, one is in the university and the rest are working. She requests a loan to upgrade her stock of fish. Owusu belongs to a village bank called Aver Maria.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 57 years old, married and the mother of seven children. Currently, two are in school, one is in the university and the rest are working. She sells smoked fish. Agnes started her fish sales 28 years ago in the Sefwi Dwinase community market. 

Agnes prepares very tasty, good quality fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She buys stocks of fish from the fishmongers. She has a large customer base that will travel from the other part of the surrounding communities to buy her fish. She requests a loan to upgrade her stock of fish. Agnes belongs to a village bank called Nyame Mere, which means God’s Time.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Maria Rogelia

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria V. tiene 50 años de edad, tiene varios hijos los cuales todos estan de edad mayor y han hecho su vida, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y tiene mas de 20 años de realizar este tipo de actividad, gracias a este negocio logro sacar adelante a su familia, algunos de sus hijos le ayudan con los gastos de su hogar.
Maria nos comento que ella se entretiene con su negocio para no sentirse sola, la tiene entretenida y asi genera ganancias ya que a la edad que ella tiene no es posible conseguir trabajos estables en compañias o empresas. ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mayores ganancias las cuales las piensa invertir en su casa de habitacion.
texts.en:
Señora Maria V. is fifty years of age and has several children, all of whom are older now and have started their own lives. She is dedicated to clothing sales and has more than twenty years experience in this type of activity. Thanks to this business, she has succeeded in improving the lifestyle of her family. Some of her children help her with the costs of her home. Maria told us that she enjoys her business because she does not feel lonely and she is able to make some earnings, because at her age, she is not able to obtain a stable job for a company or business. She needs the loan to buy more merchandise and in this way have greater earnings, which she plans to invest in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jeans and blouses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
la sra. Maria O. tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera y tuvo tres hijos los cuales ya estan graduados de la educacion secundaria, 2 de ellos trabajan y le ayudan con algunos gastos del hogar, la hija de ella estudia psicologia en la universidad nacional autonoma de Honduras.
Maria se separo de su esposo hace 20 años atras dejandola sola con sus hijos, pero ella nos comento que gracias a Dios logro salir adelante sola y poder darles estudio, alimentacion y hogar.
luego a ella la despidieron de su trabajo y decicio poner su propio negocio para poder pagar los estudios de su hija menor.
ella en este momento necesita comprar mas mercaderia para abastecer su negocio, por tal razon esta solicitando el credito para poder salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria O. is 40 years old, a single mother, and has three children who have already graduated from high school. Two of the children work and help out with household expenses. The other daughter is studying psychology at the national university of Honduras. Maria separated from her husband 20 years ago leaving her alone with the children, but thanks to God she succeeded to continue moving forward in life independently and provide for school, food, and the household. Later, she left her job and decided to start her own business to be able to pay for the studies of her youngest daughter. Now she needs to purchase more merchandise to supply her business, and for this reason she is requesting a loan to be able to move forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase eggs, coffee, bread, cookies, drinks, chicken, beans, rice, sugar, and butter

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 33 years old. She is single with one child. She owns and operates a grocery shop, where she sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body creams, detergent, hair creams, etc., to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for her child's education. She would be grateful for the assistance. Rita belongs to the village bank named Maranatha.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Jeanne D'arc

texts.en:
M. Jeanne has a shop in Kigali city where she sells many types of merchandise. She starts the business at 8:00 AM and closes at 10:00 PM. She has been doing this business since 2000 and now she employs two workers. Her monthly profit is $340 US.

Jeanne d’Arc is a 34-year-old married woman with four children, ages 14, 7, 6 and 2 years old. This entrepreneur is seeking her first loan of 500,000 RWF from Kiva. It’s her second loan overall as she belonged to a group called Abahuje (Solidarity). With this loan she hopes to buy more merchandise and thereafter she will have much benefit.

loans.use: To expand a retail store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 39 years old, married and the mother of three children. Two are in school while the last one is still being breastfed. She is a very hardworking young mother who works all day. She operates a hairdressing salon in front of her house. She has been in business for 18 years now. She always tries new styles for her clients and, because of that, many people comes to her to have their hair done. She requests a loan to buy a hair dryer, weavings, etc. to service her clients. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Blessing’.

loans.use: To buy a hairdryer, mesh, weavings, etc.

loans.name: Armstrong

texts.en: Armstrong is 58 years old. He is married with four children who are currently in school. Armstrong is a repairer and dealer of electronic parts like speakers, transistors, transformers, screwdrivers, wires, television cords, antennas etc. He provides repairs and servicing work for his customers. He has acquired land in the village where he is into cocoa farming.  He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and gives to his customers at retail prices. He requests a loan to enable him to procure an increased stock of electronic parts to service his client’s electronic gadgets. He hopes to increase savings to expand his shop to include other electronic parts. He belongs to the village bank called ‘Gye Nyame’, which means Except God. In this group, members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To increase his stock of parts

loans.name: Zenabu

texts.en: She lives with a child who is currently in school at the community of Sefwi Dwenase in the western region of Ghana. She is a food vendor and sells “waakye”. Waakye is cooked rice and beans enjoyed with stew, macaroni and fish. It is sold in the mornings as breakfast. It is very tasty and satisfying and almost all tribes in Ghana enjoy waakye. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, vegetables, oil, beans, macaroni, meat, etc. to increase her stock of goods. She belongs to the village bank ‘Nkunimdie’, which literally means Victory.

loans.use: To increase her stock of goods

loans.name: Afua

texts.en: Afua is 49 years old. She is divorced and a mother with six children. Three are currently in school and the other three children are working. She lives in the family house at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana. She is a food vendor and serves food like beverages, rice and stew. She says demand for food is on the higher side but she does not have adequate funds for expansion. She has been in food production for six years now in taking care of the family. She wants to use the loan to buy meat and rice to increase her efficiency and to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support her children's educational needs.
