She belongs to the village bank called ‘God’s Time is the Best’ and she would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more rice and meat

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 36 years old, married and the mother of five children. All her children are in school in the community where they live. She is a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil and coconut oil. Palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernel. The palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil. The palm kernel is also processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes. Her operation is on a limited scale due to capital inadequacy to buy machines for the processing. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials (palm kernel) and processing equipment to increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to make a bigger income and provide for her family and finance her children’s education. She belongs to the village bank called ’Nkunimdie’.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials and processing equipment

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 36 years old. She is divorced and the mother of seven children. She says that with the help of God all her children attend school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, biscuits and babies products like napkins, feeding bottles etc. in her neighborhood. With her six years of business experience, she has been very supportive to the family. She is widowed so all the family responsibility rests on her shoulders.

Fortunately, her business has been positioned at a strategic location within the town where she lives. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school. Ali belongs to a village bank called ‘Aqua Allah’, which means God is Able.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther F. is 30 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. Both of her children are in school. She has been trading from a tabletop for five years. She prepares and sells corn dough, cassava dough, spices, vegetables and other food ingredients in the community market where she lives. She also sells dried fish and smoked fish. 

Esther purchases most of her goods from the main market of Kumasi and resells them at the community market. She has been struggling to buy more from the market. She requests a loan to buy foodstuffs like maize, cassava for the preparation of the dough, tomatoes, spices, etc. She hopes to turn her current business situation around. Esther belongs to a village bank called Prayer is the Key.

loans.use: To buy cassava, maize, spices, smoked fish, etc.

loans.name: Ciudad Real Group

texts.es:
ALCOM CIUDAD REAL


Ciudad Real es una Alcom muy unida y solidaria, sus 10 socios D. las cuales 3 son hombres, son personas trabajadoras y muy sobresaliente en el campo D. los negocios. El presidente, el Sr William López A., ahora tiene un negocio próspero, lo consiguió a base D. mucho esfuerzo y optimismo desD. su juventud. 
   A sus cortos  13 años empieza la travesía por este viaje observando y aprendiendo a pintar carros en el taller D. un conocido, su entusiasmo por seguir adelante lo llevo por el campo D. la soldadura, y poco a poco mejorando sus habilidades e implementando sus herramientas cumplió el sueño del taller propio, en el que su esposa además D. ser la madre D.  sus hijos es su compañera D. trabajo y la cómplice D. este logro familiar.
Nuestro socio se  muestra  contento con el trabajo que realiza porque además D. sustentar los gastos familiares le ha ayudado a solventar la educación D. sus hijos y mejorar la infraestructura D. su  casa. El crédito que se le ha otorgado lo utilizará para la compra D.  materiales y atender la demanda creciente  D. sus clientes.
Asimismo el Sr. William aconseja a los socios a seguir adelante  con una frase que es cotidiana en su vida “perseverancia”.
texts.en:
ALCOM CIUDAD REAL Ciudad Real es una Alcom muy unida y solidaria, sus 10 socios D. las cuales 3 son hombres, son personas trabajadoras y muy sobresaliente en el campo D. los negocios. El presidente, el Sr William López A., ahora tiene un negocio próspero, lo consiguió a base D. mucho esfuerzo y optimismo desD. su juventud. A sus cortos 13 años empieza la travesía por este viaje observando y aprendiendo a pintar carros en el taller D. un conocido, su entusiasmo por seguir adelante lo llevo por el campo D. la soldadura, y poco a poco mejorando sus habilidades e implementando sus herramientas cumplió el sueño del taller propio, en el que su esposa además D. ser la madre D. sus hijos es su compañera D. trabajo y la cómplice D. este logro familiar. Nuestro socio se muestra contento con el trabajo que realiza porque además D. sustentar los gastos familiares le ha ayudado a solventar la educación D. sus hijos y mejorar la infraestructura D. su casa. El crédito que se le ha otorgado lo utilizará para la compra D. materiales y atender la demanda creciente D. sus clientes. Asimismo el Sr. William aconseja a los socios a seguir adelante con una frase que es cotidiana en su vida “perseverancia”.

Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRAR INSUMOS

loans.name: Ben

texts.fr: Ben A. est un homme de 47 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. il tient un magasin de matériaux de construction à Womé. Ben exerce cette activité depuis 10 ans. Il souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la capacité de son entreprise afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Ben A. is 47-years-old, married and the father of 4 children. He owns a building supply store in Womé. Ben has been in this business for 10 years. He hopes to expand his business with this loan so that he can better satisfy customer demand.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his store

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert S. is a married man with no child yet. He has received schooling through junior high.

Gilbert is a cobbler and also sells hardware in Hohoe. He uses all his income to pay housekeeping expenses. He will use the loan to purchase leather to manufacture shoes. With the new profits from his expanded business, Gilbert plans to save.

loans.use: To purchase leather to manufacture shoes

loans.name: Papa

texts.fr: PAPA N. est un chauffeur il est employé comme chauffeur de taxi. Pour diversifier ses activités  il s’est investi dans le  transport hippomobile activité qui se développe bien à Mbour où la plus part des habitants des quartiers périphériques emprunte ce genre de transport. Il est né en 1982 et habite à Mbour avec ses parents, une ville qui se trouve à quelques 80 km de Mbour. Il est célibataire sans enfant, il cherche à travers le crédit qu’il sollicite, veut acheter  un autre cheval et une autre charrette pour augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Papa N. is a taxi driver. In order to diversify his business activities, he invested in hippomobile (horse-drawn) transport. It is developing well in Mbour where most residents living in the city outskirts use this mode of transportation.
He was born in 1982 and lives with his parents in a town located some 80 km from Mbour. He is unmarried and doesn’t have any children. Through this loan he is looking to purchase another horse and another cart to increase his income.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a horse and cart

loans.name: Razak

texts.en:
Razak A. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high. Razak is solely responsible for the housekeeping expenses.

Razak sells mother-care products like baby creams, baby's wear and others items in Hohoe. She will use the loan to purchase more of the baby’s products to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Razak plans to save.

In her hands is a sample of the baby's dresses that she sells.

loans.use: To purchase more baby’s products to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles O. is married and has two children. He has received schooling through junior high. He uses his income to pay for housekeeping expenses and other utility bills.

Charles manufactures and sells design blocks in Hohoe. With the high demand for Charles’ design blocks, he will use the loan to buy cement, sand and other manufacturing machines to mold the blocks. With the new profits from his expanded business, Charles plans to save.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and other manufacturing machines to mold blocks

loans.name: Benedictor

texts.en:
Benedictor A. is married and has four dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Benedictor uses all her income in supporting her husband in footing all the housekeeping expenses.

Benedictor sells clothes, leather bags and some other African batik bags in Hohoe. She will use the loan to purchase more clothes and bags to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Benedictor plans to save.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and bags to sell

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank P. is married and has three children. He has received schooling through junior high. His wife is a petty trader with little income. Frank single-handedly uses his income in taking care of the children.

Frank sells assorted provisions in Hohoe. He will use the loan to buy more provisions such as milk, Milo (a milk beverage) and coffee to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Frank plans to save.

loans.use: To buy more provisions such as milk, Milo, and coffee to sell

loans.name: Tanutsu Women's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are Fanta S., Aminata K., Fullamusu S. and Hawa K.. They named their group the Tanutsu Women’s Association. These four women are requesting a loan in order to expand their businesses, earn better profits and consequently, improve their standard of living. 

Fanta S. (pictured on the right) is the leader of this group. Fanta is now 35 years old and was born in Bo, in southern Sierra Leone. She is married to a driver and now have three children who are attending primary school. Fanta sells medicine and has been working in this business for four years now.

loans.use: To further invest in her medicine sales business to improve her family's living standard

loans.name: Hope Sisters Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are Fatu J., Saidu B., Alamatu B. and Bilkisu K. of the Hope Sisters group. They are local entrepreneurs based in Makeni city, located in northern Sierra Leone. To date, these entrepreneurs have received several loans from SMT/Kiva. With those loans, they have been able to expand their businesses. As a result of this, they have been able to provide their children with three meals a day, send them to school and solve most of their daily financial challenges. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again requesting a new loan of Le 1,200,000 so that each of them can further improve her businesses. 

Fatu J. (second from left) is the leader of the group. Fatu was born in Makeni and is now 46 years old. She is a widow with seven children. Four are grown-ups and three are attending secondary schools. Fatu sells market food and has been in this business for over 35 years now. With this loan, she will be able to further expand her business.

loans.use: Invest in her business selling food in order to further expand her business

loans.name: Two In One United Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are Fatmata K., Fatmata M. and Memuna K.. They earn a living working as small-scale businesswomen in Makeni city, located in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they hope to be able to expand their businesses, make better profit and improve their current standard of living.

Fatmata K. (on the left) is the leader of the group, named Two in One United. Fatmata was born in Makeni 29 years ago. She is married and is the mother of two children. One of her children is in grade three and the other is in grade one. Fatmata sells shoes, onions and fish. She has been working in this business for 10 years now.

loans.use: To further invest in her business selling shoes, fish and onions so that she can improve her family's standard of living.

loans.name: Mena Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Mena group. They are requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each member so that they can expand their businesses. This is the first loan these women are requesting from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they hope to be able to expand their businesses, make better profit and consequently, improve their current standard of living.
 
Fatmata K. (second from left) is the leader of this group. Fatmata is now 39 years old and married with six children. One is in college, four are in secondary school and the last is not of school going age yet. Fatmata sells market food and has been in this business since 1982.

loans.use: To further invest in her business selling food so that she can improve her family's standard of living.

loans.name: Fatmata Sankoh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are Fatmata S., Ibrahim B., Memunatu K. and Lamrana S.. They named their group Fatmata S. group, after the group’s leader. These women are local entrepreneurs based in Makeni city, located in northern Sierra Leone. With this loan, these entrepreneurs hope to be able to expand their businesses, make better profits and improve their current standard of living. 

Fatmata, the leader of this group, was born in Magburaka, located about 22 miles from Makeni. She is married to a farmer and together have six children. Of her children, several attend primary school and the remaining attend secondary school. Fatmata owns a shop in Makeni where she sells rice, provisions, biscuits, mints, cigarettes, drinks, water, etc. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for seven years now.

loans.use: To further invest in her business selling rice, provisions, biscuits, mints, cigarettes, drinks and water in order to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida A. is forty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to seven children - four daughters and three sons. All are currently in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Vida is a trader and trades in foodstuffs – plantain, cocoyam (taro) and yam. She has been in business for six years. She sells on a table at the market square and also supplies to other retailers and food vendors. Vida buys her goods from nearby communities and wants a loan to buy foodstuffs in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Mano Group

texts.en:
This is Dura S., Isatu S., Hassan K. and Adama T.. They named their group Mano Group. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make better profits and consequently improve on their standards of living. Thus they are able to pay their children’s school fees and other school related charges and to feed and clothe them.

Dura S. (right) is the leader of the group. Dura was born in Port Loko, in northern Sierra Leone. He is fifty years of age and married to a businesswoman. They have four children: two of his children are in primary school and two are in secondary school.

Dura S. sells fowls and has been in this business for more than thirty years now. With this loan, he will be able to get at least five dozen fowls to sell.

loans.use: To buy at least five dozen fowls to sell

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua A. is fifty-six years old. She is divorced and has given birth to six children: three sons and three daughters. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Akosua is a fishmonger and sells smoked fish. She sells the fish on a table at the market square and also supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. Akosua buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in Kumasi and smokes them herself. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk. She desires to expand her business and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Lafisatu

texts.en: Lafisatu A. is 34 years old, married and has five children, a son and four daughters, all of whom are currently in primary school. She and her family live in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a security officer and she is a trader who makes a living selling printed textile goods. She travels around, selling in various towns on their market days. Lafisatu has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Her goal is to expand her business and give each of her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy textiles to sell to her customers

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris A. is widowed and has three children, two sons and one daughter, all of whom are all currently in school. She is 48 years old and lives with her children in a house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. For the last 20 years, she has made a living as a baker, supplying bread to retailers and beverage sellers.  She supplements her income from baking by selling various other items needed by people in her community. Doris buys flour and other ingredients from Kumasi, and wants a loan to buy these supplies in bulk. Her main goals are to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour to use to make bread

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua A. is 48 years old, divorced and has five children, three sons and two daughters. All are currently in school – senior high, junior high and primary. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in Ghana's Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. For the past year, Akua has made a living as a trader, selling cereals and maize to retailers and food vendors. She is applying for this loan to buy bags of maize in bulk from nearby communities. Her main goals are to expand her business and give each of her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk

loans.name: Tamaraneh Iii Group

texts.en:
Isatu T., Aminata T. and Kadiatu C. are local entrepreneurs based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They call their group Tamaraneh III, a Temne phrase meaning Let Us Help Each Other. This is the fourth loan these entrepreneurs have sought from SMT/Kiva. These women used their previous loans to improve their businesses and personal lives. Having repaid all of these loans successfully, they are requesting a fourth loan to further strengthen their businesses and improve their lives.

Isatu T. (right) is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni city, is 31 years of age and married to a businessman. They have three children, two of whom are in school while the third is too young to start school yet. Isatu has been in business since she was a child.

loans.use: To invest in three small businesses

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa Andoh-Mensa is 45 years old, married and has six children, three sons and three daughters. All are in school – senior high, junior high and primary. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in Ghana's Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a farmer while Theresa works as a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice balls, rice and stew, selling them from a table top at her town's market square every morning. Theresa wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk from nearby communities. She has been in business for 12 years, and hopes to expand her business and give each of her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Aliu

texts.en: Aliu A. sells tinned tomatoes, groceries and a variety of spices for cooking in Hohoe. She has received junior high education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a trader who makes little money for a living. Aliu is responsible for paying payment of utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to add to her stock to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to add to her stock to sell

loans.name: Ol-Tite Group

texts.en:
This is Mustapha K., Unisa K. and Mary S.. They called their group Hold Tight. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs have received from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, however, they will be able to expand their businesses, make better profits and consequently improve on their standards of living. 

Mustapha Kamara (right) is the leader of this group. He was born in a village called Yele, about forty miles from Makeni city and is now age twenty-nine. He is married to a businesswoman and they have three children together. His children are still in primary schools. Mustapha sells ready-to-wear clothes and has been in this business for ten years now.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Hands Together Group

texts.en:
Here are Hawa F. and Kadiatu T.. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city.  They named their group Hands Together. This is not the first loan these women are receiving from SMT/Kiva.  With previous loans, these women were able to expand their businesses, make better profits and consequently improve their standard of living. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of Le 1,200,000 for each to further strengthen their businesses.
 
Hawa F. (right) is the leader of this group. She is 27 and was born in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. She is a widow with two children; one in class two and the other in class one. Hawa sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), pepper and rice. She has been in this business for three years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed R. is a young hairdresser and sells Hair Products such as hair creams, wigs and hair pomade in Hohoe. Mohammed has received a junior high education.  She is single and has no dependants. She is responsible for paying her utility bills, and feeding and clothing herself.  With the increase in R.'s customer base, her loan will be used to buy a hair dryer and hair products to attain to the customers. She hopes to save the new profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and hair products

loans.name: Salina

texts.en: Salina G. is 27 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Salina trades in vegetables such as onions on a tabletop at the market square. She buys her goods from nearby farming communities and Kumasi. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Salina has been in business for one year now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena A. is 47 years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children, one son and two daughters. All are currently in school - senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Abena is a trader. She trades in crates of eggs. She sells on a tabletop at the market square. She buys crates of eggs from nearby poultry farming communities and Kumasi. Abena also supplies to other retailers. She has been in business for 12 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy eggs in bulk

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra E. est une femme de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale à Wome. Abra exerce ce commerce depuis 4 ans et souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son magasin.
texts.en:
Abra E. is 33-years-old, married and the mother of 2 children. She owns a general store in Wome. Abra has run this business for 4 years and hopes to increase her stock with this loan.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony A. is 32 years old. He is married and has two children, a boy and a girl. Both are currently in the primary school. He lives with his children in a rented apartment in a commercial town in the Western region called Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. Anthony is a hard-working man. He runs a provision store with his wife. He sells groceries such as Milo, sugar, rice, candies, bread, etc. in a store on the street. He has been in business for two years now and wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand his business. He is hoping to improve his standard of living and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy more provisions

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes P. is fifty years old. She is a married and has given birth to seven children: four sons and three daughters who are all currently in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a police officer.

Agnes trades in footwear for both men and women. She also deals in ladies underwear. She hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell and also treks to other towns to sell on their market days.

Agnes has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy more footwear to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters. All are currently in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a farmer.

Mary is a trader. She trades in food stuffs – yam, cassava, etc., and sells on a table at the market square. She also supplies to other retailers and food vendors. She buys her goods from nearby communities and wants a loan to buy tubers of yam in bulk. She has been in business for over twenty years. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
Abdulai K. is a seamstress who has been sewing with an outmoded sewing machine in Hohoe. She has received senior-high education. She is single and has two children and is responsible for feeding and taking care of the financial needs of her dependents.

Abdulai’s loan will be used to buy sewing machines to speed-up her work. With the new profit from the business, Abdulai plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines to speed-up her work

loans.name: Portia

texts.en:
Portia O. is thirty years old. She is a married and has given birth to one child, a boy, who is currently in the nursery school. She lives with her son and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a mason while she is a seamstress by profession.

Portia designs and sews for clients and also for sale. She has her workshop on the street in her community. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy textile materials and other sewing accessories in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her child a good education.

loans.use: To buy textile materials and other sewing accessories in bulk

loans.name: Razak

texts.en:
Razak T. is single with no dependent and has received schooling through junior high. He is a young barber who uses an old barbering machine in barbering his clients at S.K. Park in Hohoe, which he has done since 2006.

Razak will use the loan to buy modern barbering machines and a sterilizer for his sharp equipment. With the new profits from his expanded business, he plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy modern barbering machines and a sterilizer for his sharp equipment

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: Mbaye S. travaille en dans le secteur des assurances. Ce prêt lui servira d’agrandir ses locaux et d’acquérir de nouveaux équipements pour la visibilité et l’accueil de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mbaye S. works in the insurance sector. He will use this loan to expand his premises and to obtain new furnishings and equipment for visibility and to welcome his clients.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Equipment and Furnishings

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady D. est une commerçante au niveau du marché central de Mbour depuis quelques années .Son activité principale est la vente de petit déjeuner qui lui procure des revenus pouvant satisfaire ses besoins quotidiens un bénéfice journalier consistant. Ce prêt lui servira d’acheter un terrain  pour construire sa maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Khady D. has been a merchant at the central market in Mbour for a few years. Her main business consists in selling breakfast, which provides her with a consistent daily profit enabling her to provide for herself. This loan will be used to buy a portion of land to build a house for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a portion of land to build a house for her family

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris D. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through senior high.

Doris sells fresh eggs at Fodome Station in Hohoe, which she has done since 2000. She uses her income to pay for the financial needs of her children. She will use the loan to purchase clothes and also to increase her sale of eggs by buying more for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and also more eggs for resale.

loans.name: Daba

texts.fr: Daba S. vend de la boisson, des cannettes et des jus de fruits qu’elle fabrique chez elle.  Elle exerce ce métier depuis plusieurs années. Les revenus tirés du commerce lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins quotidiens. Ce prêt a pour but de renforcer son activité avec une forte demande de sa clientèle constituée de chauffeurs de taxi et de voyageurs
texts.en:
Daba S. sells beverages, cans and fruit juice that she makes at home. She's been running this business for several years. Her income enables her to provide for herself. She will use this loan to bolster her business, which experiences a high demand from her clientele comprising taxi drivers and travelers.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Cheikh Mbacké

texts.fr: Cheikh Mbacké M. est un mareyeur qui a ses activités au niveau du port de pêche de Mbour ville de la petite côte. Il vend du poisson et des fruits de mer aux hôtels et les usines de transformation. Ce prêt lui permettra d’augmenter ses achets de marchandises sur les pirogues afin de les revendre. Ce métier lui permet de nourrir sa famille.
texts.en:
Cheikh Mbacké M. is a fish wholesaler at the fishing harbor of Mbour, along the Petite Côte. He sells fish and seafood to hotels and transformation factories. This loan will enable him to buy larger amount of fish on the pirogues, and to sell more. This job enables him to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large amount of fish for reselling

loans.name: Nestor

texts.fr: Nestor D. est un jeune homme de 37 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. il est menuisier à womé depuis 5 ans. Il désire avec ce crédit acheter des outils de travail et des planches pour l’exécution de ses œuvres.
texts.en:
Nestor D. is a young 37 year old man, he is married and the father of 3 children. He has been a carpenter in Womé for 5 years. With this loan he wants to buy work tools and lumber to carry out his work.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools and lumber

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel K. is a young kente weaver at Ahado in Hohoe. Emmanuel has received basic education. He is married and has two children. His wife is also weaver of kente cloth. Kente is a traditional woven cloth with different colors of triads and twines that is mostly worn on special occasions to portray the rich culture of Ghana.

Emmanuel is responsible for paying for the financial needs of his children. His loan will be used to buy different kinds of colors of triads and twine to weave. He hopes to save the new profits.

loans.use: To buy difference kind of colors of triad and twine to weave

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel H. is married and has one child. He has received schooling up to junior high level. Emmanuel is a kentey weaver at Bla in Hohoe, which he has done since 1998. Kentey is a typical Ghanaian cloth that is woven with different colours of silken weaving twines. It is worn on special occasions to portray the rich culture of Ghana. Emmanuel uses his income to support the financial needs of his children. Emmanuel will use the loan to buy twines and threads to weave the kentey cloth to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Emmanuel plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy twines and threads to weave kentey cloth.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose T. is married and has one child. She has studied to a junior high school level. Rose sells polyester, zips and works as a seamstress at the same time at Ahado in Hohoe. Her husband is a teacher with the Ghana Education Service and is a low income earner. Rose uses her income to support her husband in covering the utility bills and other housekeeping expenses. Rose will use the loan to purchase a good sewing machine to increase her productivity. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William S. is a young barber who uses old equipment in his barber shop in Hohoe. William has received education to a junior high level. He is responsible for paying his food, clothing and utility bills. His loan will be used to buy equipment and a sterilizer for his sharp implements. He hopes to reinvest the new profit from his business for expansion.

loans.use: To buy barbers' equipment.

loans.name: Mery Noemi

texts.es: Mery T. es una joven muy emprendedora ya que con su corta edad abrio un snack para vender pollo frito y asi no depender de sus padres y mas bien ayudarles en sus gastos familiares y en el estudio de sus hermanos menores los aun estan en la escuela, tiene tres hermanos menores.
texts.en:
Mery T. is a young, enterprising woman who, at her young age, opened a snack shop to sell fried chicken so she wouldn't have to rely on her parents. She also wanted to help her parents with the bills and help pay for her three younger brothers' education.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invertira en la refaccion del snack

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.es:
EMMANUEL

La Alcom Emanuel fue formando hace ya 5 años, en este tiempo el  grupo nos enseña que la  unión y la perseverancia  deben reflejarse constantemente en nuestras vidas.
Presidenta: Maria P.. Tiene un negocio de Alquiler de habitaciones que comenzó hace 8 años. Con mucho esfuerzo en el 2001 construyó algunas habitaciones en su  casa que luego  decidió alquilarlas, este es su principal fuente de ingresos  pero además todos los veranos elabora yogurt de acuerdo a la gran cantidad  de pedidos.
Secretaria: Marisol M.. Empeñosa madre de familia  que luego de una difícil situación encontró que en el servicio de hospedaje había una oportunidad para cubrir los difíciles gastos escolares de sus  3 hijos y además podía utilizar el pequeño excedente en satisfacer otras necesidades.
Tesorera: Hilaria M. empezó junto con sus compañeras vendiendo comida informalmente hace 3 años, ahora tiene un puesto estable desde donde también  reparte comida a los obreros de las fábricas aledañas.
Las  socias agradecen todo el  beneficio que les ha brindado nuestros créditos en el crecimiento de sus negocios.
texts.en:
EMMANUEL La Alcom Emanuel fue formando hace ya 5 años, en este tiempo el grupo nos enseña que la unión y la perseverancia deben reflejarse constantemente en nuestras vidas. Presidenta: Maria P.. Tiene un negocio de Alquiler de habitaciones que comenzó hace 8 años. Con mucho esfuerzo en el 2001 construyó algunas habitaciones en su casa que luego decidió alquilarlas, este es su principal fuente de ingresos pero además todos los veranos elabora yogurt de acuerdo a la gran cantidad de pedidos. Secretaria: Marisol M.. Empeñosa madre de familia que luego de una difícil situación encontró que en el servicio de hospedaje había una oportunidad para cubrir los difíciles gastos escolares de sus 3 hijos y además podía utilizar el pequeño excedente en satisfacer otras necesidades. Tesorera: Hilaria M. empezó junto con sus compañeras vendiendo comida informalmente hace 3 años, ahora tiene un puesto estable desde donde también reparte comida a los obreros de las fábricas aledañas. Las socias agradecen todo el beneficio que les ha brindado nuestros créditos en el crecimiento de sus negocios.

Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS

loans.name: Noelia

texts.es: Noelia C.  M. es cliente nueva, ella es joven y tiene su pareja con la que convive hace un año, y piensa casarse este fin de año, ella es hija de la Sra. Marina M., quien fue cliente en Emprender, quien además garantiza a su hija. Noelia reparte sus productos en el mercado de Los Pinos y por la zona sur, también en el trabajo de su marido, quien trabaja  en una Empresa de publicidad, ambos se dedican a esta actividad hace dos años aproximadamente, por lo que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de estos productos.
texts.en:
Noelia C. M. is a new client. She is young and has lived with her partner, whom she plans to marry at the end of the year, for a year. She is the daughter of one of Emprender's former clients, Mrs. Marina Mamanie and Mrs Marina can vouch for her. Noelia sells products in Los Pinos market, in the southern part of the city, and at the advertising firm where her partner works. They have been doing this for about two years and need more capital to buy these products.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de mercaderia, televisores, radios, licuadoras etc.

loans.name: Edwin Romberto

texts.es: El señor Edwin R. Q. M. se dedica a la fabricación de ollas y calderas de aluminio la cual es su actividad principal de el y su familia que esta compuesta por su Mamá y sus tres hermanos, constituyéndose el en cabeza familia,  por esta temporada se dedica ahora a la fabricación de quequeras de cinco piezas (moldes de Tortas) que entrega exclusivamente a un solo cliente.
texts.en:
Edwin R. Q. M. makes aluminum pots and caldrons for a living. This is how he, as head of the house, supports himself, his mother, and his three brothers. He is currently making pans for five tiered cakes (molds for cakes) for one client in particular.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crédito, dirigido para aumento de capital de trabajo y compra de materia prima.

loans.name: Rosas Y Su Clavel 2 Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer, “Alto Lima” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Rosas y su Clavel”, con aproximadamente 3 años de vida, cuenta con 12 integrantes que en su mayoría se dedican a la confección/tejidos como: confección de polleras, tejido en alpaca, confección de sombreros y otros, ellas indican que utilizarán el préstamo para la compra de materia prima que les permita elaborar sus productos, como lana, tela y forro.

Su presidenta es  Celia C. quien  tiene el negocio de confección de chamarras, indica estar muy satisfecha con el préstamo ya que le permite tener mas movimiento económico, por otro lado, a todas les gusta hacer uso  del servicio de salud porque las atienden con mucho respeto.
texts.en:
In one of the main focal areas of Pro Mujer, “Alto Lima”, you can find the communal association of “Rosas y su Clavel”. With approximately 3 years in existence, this group has 12 members who for the most part dedicate themselves to creating handmade products such as: skirts, knitwear from alpaca wool, hats, and other items. They indicate they will use the loan to buy raw materials to make their products, such as yarn, fabric and lining. Their president is Celia C., who has a business making jackets. She notes that she is very happy with the loan, as it allows her more room to grow financially. In addition, they all like to use the health services because they are tended to with much respect.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Rudy Ramiro

texts.es: El Sr. Rudy Ramiro A. A., tiene como actividad económica la confección de chamarras y otras prendas las que realiza según temporada,  actividad que desarrolla hace 14 años, constituyéndose en una fuente principal de ingresos para el y su madre. Los madre e hijo son los que trabajan en la confeccion, siendo don Rudy el principal sosten de su sñora madre.
texts.en:
Mr. Rudy Ramiro A. A. has been making jackets and other articles of clothing, according to the season, for 14 years. He and his mother both make the clothes but he is the principal bread winner in the family.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crédito destinado para la compra de materia prima.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A new software system

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
When Jenny first started selling beauty products, she didn’t realize how beneficial having a flexible schedule would be for her. She had her first baby in February 2009 and it quickly became clear that as a single mom, being able to make her own schedule and bring her baby with her would prove invaluable. Jenny has sold beauty products for two years now and has been steadily building up her client base. 

She would like a $750 loan from ACCION USA to make a bulk order of new and popular merchandise that will allow her to build up her business equity. This way she will be able to create steady income and to provide for herself and her baby. Although sales have been good and have gone back up after the birth of her child, she realizes that to be more profitable, she needs to have the products on hand. In the past, without a proper inventory, she has lost out on sales and potential clients. 

Jenny gives her clients the best service possible and helps build awareness of the benefits of her products by giving facial demonstrations. Her customers have responded well to the new costume jewelry she has begun selling and she looks forward to incorporating other products.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products in bulk

loans.name: Alva Rosa

texts.es:
la sra. Alva S. se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de rosquillas, esta actividad la viene desarrollando desde hace mas de 10 años, su producto a venido teniendo muy buena demanda ya que es caracterizado por su sabor, este sabor lo ha logrado a traves de su experiencia y tambien que usa un queso de muy buena calidad, con los ingresos que le genera esta actividad ella apoya a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas harina, queso y huevos para tener una mayor producccion y asi tener mejores ganancias.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que su producto se vende y le gusta mucho a la gente.
texts.en:
Sra. Alva S. has been making and selling rosquillas (a regional cookie speciality) for more than ten years. There is a great demand for her baking which is well known for its fine taste. Alva achieved this through experience and also through the use of quality cheese. With the income from this business, Alva helps her husband with household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy more flour, cheese, and eggs so that she can make more rosquillas and earn more money. She told us that she is very happy because her baking sells well and people really like it.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese, flour, and eggs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jachaptañani Jovenes Group

texts.es: En el Centro Focal  “Panamericana” se encuentra el grupo “Jachaptañani Jóvenes”, con casi dos años de vida, cuenta con cinco integrantes dos se dedican a la artesanía en yeso, dos a la costura de ropa y uno a la venta de videos. Su presidenta es Fabiola F. que tiene el negocio de artesanía en Yeso y se encuentra muy motivada a invertir el préstamo en su negocio, específicamente comprará materia prima como el estuco. Al igual que Fabiola, todos los integrantes del grupo desean hacer crecer su negocio y al mismo tiempo esperan que sea un gran apoyo para culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
The group “Jachaptañani Jóvenes” can be found in the Panamerican Center. The five group members have been together for almost two years; two of the group create crafts from plaster, two make clothing, and one sells videos. Fabiola F. is the president of the group, and she has a business selling plaster crafts. She is very eager to use the loan in her business, specifically to buy basic materials such as stucco. Like Fabiola, all the members of the group want to expand their businesses, and as well they hope to complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic materials

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: La sra. Anita S. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella cuenta con una pulperia, actividad que tiene de ejecutar por mas de 36 años, su familia es bien conocida en el lugar en donde viven ya que son de las primeras familias que vivieron en trojes, ella y su esposo han sacado adelante a su familia, tambien ellos se dedican a la ganaderia y a la agricultura ya que la zona se presta para poder realizar este tipo de actividades. ellos viven en elevadas montañas. la sra Anita a sabido administrar muy bien su negocio, ella necesita el credito para invertir en productos y comprarlos al por mayor ya que asi se tienen mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Anita S. has been selling common foodstuffs from her corner store for more than 36 years. Her family is well known in the area in which they live as they were one of the first families to move to Trojes. Anita and her husband have made a good life for their family. They are farmers and raise both cattle and crops, as the land is ideal for these types of agriculture. They live in Elevadas Montañas. Anita has learnt how to run a good business, and she now needs a loan to buy products at wholesale prices so that she can make a greater profit.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy common food items such as sugar, chicken, soap etc for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aurelia Guadalupe

texts.es:
En la departamento de León, la señora Aurelia H. se dedica a la elaboración de alimentos los cuales son preparados por ella misma para ofrecerlos en su localidad donde es muy visitada por sus clientes.

La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es con el propósito de solicitar un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos ya que le es necesidad adquirirlos prontamente y así continuar en el mejoramiento de su negocio de venta de alimentos y satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
ln the department of León, Mrs. Aurelia H. prepares food to be sold in her area, and she is visited by many clients.

The reason why she has approched Ceprodel is to request a loan to buy raw material to prepare the dishes which is urgent for her to be able to continue improving her business selling food and keep her clients satisfied.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material

loans.name: Ericka Damaris

texts.es:
la sra. Ericka Damaris H. se dedica a la sastreria y tambien vende recargas para llamadas de celulares de dos compañias telefonicas, ella tiene mas de 4 años de realizar este tipo de actividad, es madre de familia, tiene 3 hijos, con los ingresos que le genera este negocio le permite suplir con algunos gastos del hogar y tambien le ayuda a su esposo con varios gastos del hogar.
ella tiene pensado con las ganancias que obtenga poder hacerle mejoras a su casa de habitacion, este es uno de sus mas preciados sueños el poder terminar de construir su casa como ella desea.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ericka Damaris H. is a tailor and she also sells top ups for mobile phones from two telephone companies. She has been doing this for more than 4 years. She is a mother of 3 and with the income from this business she helps out with some family expenses and she also supports her husband with several expenses for the home.

With the earnings she will be able to make improvements to her house as it is her most precious dream to build her house according to her wish.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material, thread, moldings and top ups for mobile phones.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ana Baudilia

texts.es:
la sra, Ana E. tiene una pulperia desde hace 4 años, la cual opera bajo el nombre de pulperia ANA, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion. lo que le permite realizar sus oficios domesticos y cuidar a su nieto y un sobrino que viven con ella.
ella nos conto muy alegre que su negocio le ha sido de gran bendicion ya que con las ganancias que ha obtenido las a invertido mas en su negocio y cada vez es mas grande, la meta de ella es poder tener un gran supermecado en el cual tenga todos los productos para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos de comprar en su negocio y que no tengan que ir a otro lugar a buscar productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana E. has had a general store for 4 years named ANA. The business is located at her home which allows her to do her chores and look after a grandchild and a nephew living with her.

Happily she told us that her business has been a blessing to her as she has invested the earnings in the business and it is constantly growing. It is her goal to have a supermarket with all the products to make her clients satisfied buying at her store and not having to go somewhere else to look for products.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, toilet paper, coffee, pops, "churros", lard, soap, pasta, dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Janett María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León, la señora Janett S. se dedica a su actividad de venta de ropa comercializada por ella misma desde hace cuatro años siendo este el negocio que le ha permitido desarrollarse en conjunto con su familia. Ella vende la ropa en su establecimiento donde los clientes llegan a visitarle a diario.

Ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito con el propósito de adquirir la ropa para ofertarla. Con el crédito se beneficiará grandemente y logrará salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of León, Señora Janett S. works at the business of clothing sales and she herself does the selling. For the last four years she, along with her family, have been developing this business. She sells the clothing in her establishment where her customers come to visit her daily. She has approached CEPRODEL to request a loan with the purpose of acquiring clothing to offer for sale. The loan will benefit her greatly and allow her to move ahead with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Julia Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Julia Mercedes F. se ha dedicado desde hace 22 largos años a su negocio de venta de ropa el cual le ha permitido sustentar su humilde hogar de habitación. 

Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones económicas y salir adelante por medio de la venta de la ropa, la señora Julia ha adquirido un crédito que le permita la compra de dicha ropa para ofertarla y así salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia Mercedes F. has worked for the last 22 long years in her clothing sales business which has allowed her to sustain her humble home. With the goal of improving her economic conditions and get ahead through clothing sales, Julia has acquired a loan that will allow her to purchase this clothing to sell it and advance in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Clothing

loans.name: Delmis Argentina

texts.es:
la joven Delmis H. se dedica al comercio, ella cuenta con un pequeñlo negocio denomidado VARIEDADES DELMIS tiene mas de 4 años de dedicarse a ese tipo de actividad, durante todo este tiempo le ha ido muy bien, ella es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres, a los que apoya todos los meses en los gastos generales de la casa.
uno de sus mayores sueños es tener una tienda grande en la cual pueda emplear varias personas y asi contribuir a crear fuentes de trabajo, ella nos dijo que: hay que buscar formas y alternativas para poder salir adelante, tambien dijo que es una mujer con espiritu de superacion y de buenos principios cristianos.
texts.en:
Delmis H. is a young woman who has a small business called, "Variedades Delmis." She has owned it for four years, during which time it has gone very well for her. She is single, has no children, and lives with her parents. She helps them every month with their home's expenses. One of her biggest dreams is to have a large store where she can employ several people and contribute to creating sources of employment. She told us that it's necessary to search for ways and alternatives to get ahead. She also said that she is a woman with a spirit of overcoming obstacles, and she has good Christian values.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase deodorant, creams, lotions, perfumes, and underwear

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La venta de cosméticos es el negocio al que se dedica la señora Martha A. en la ciudad de León donde a diario vende sus productos tales como cremas, perfumes, desodorantes, colonias, jabones, entre otros.

Ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito debido a que tiene la necesidad de invertir en la compra de los cosméticos y por eso espera muy confiadamente sabiendo que su crédito será otorgado y de esta forma mejorará su condición en el negocio y así saldrá adelante beneficiando a su amada familia.
texts.en:
Señora Martha A. makes a living by selling cosmetics in the city of León. Every day, she sells products like creams, perfumes, deodorant, cologne, soap, and other items. She has turned to Ceprodel to request a credit because she needs to invest in the purchase of cosmetics. She is waiting very confidently knowing that she will receive her credit. In this way, she will improve the condition of her business and will get ahead, which will benefit her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Dominga Leslia

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Dominga S. se dedica con mucho entusiasmo a atender su negocio de pulpería donde oferta todo tipo de productos desde comestibles hasta productos personales y del hogar.

El negocio de la señora Dominga se ha caracterizado por atender muchos clientes todo el día y esto ha permitido que la señora S. haya visitado Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería y de esta manera ofrecerlos a sus clientes en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the department of León, señora Dominga S. attends to her grocery store with a lot of enthusiasm. Here she sells all kinds of products from food to personal products and household items. She is known for attending to many customers all day. This has allowed her to visit Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase products for her grocery store to offer them to customers in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products

loans.name: Oralia Del Carmen

texts.es:
la sra Oralia del Carmen M. se dedica al comercio, ella cuenta con una pulperia y venta de cosmeticos, su negocio le permite generar ingresos pra cubrir con los gastos del hogar, ella es madre de 4 hijos los cuales estan en edad escolar.
ella necesita invertir en su negocio para hacerlo crecer para poder tener mejores ganancias, ella es madre soltera y tiene que esforzarse para sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles educacion, alimento y vivienda, el sueño de ella es ver a sus hijos que sean unos profesionales y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Señora Oralia del Carmen M. has a grocery store and also sells cosmetics. Her business lets her generate income to cover her home's expenses. She is the mother of four school-aged children. She needs to invest in her business to make it grow so she can make better profits. She is a single mother and has to strive to take good care of her children and give them education, food, and a home. Her dream is to see her children become professionals so they will be worthy people.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase churros, juices, salt, coffee, bread, cookies, candy, butter, rice, sugar, beans, and corn.

loans.name: Sofía Doris

texts.es:
La señora Sofía, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor Azangarina II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Azangaro, Provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 22 años de edad, es madre soltera, con 02 hijos y tiene estudios de segundaria incompleta (1er grado),  vive en el Barrio Ezequiel Urbiola.

Esta iniciando su negocio con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, con un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, este dinero lo utilizará para invertir en su negocio de venta de helados,  ella también trabaja dando servicio de llamadas telefónicas, y un día a la semana vende productos de la zona como chuño, papa, quinua, etc. Es decir, tiene varias actividades las cuales le permite solventar los gastos familiares.

Su mayor sueño es poner una tienda de abarrotes  para pder darles una buena educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gusta la facilidad de pagos que Manuela Ramos brinda a las mujeres de la zona.
texts.en:
Señora Sofía belongs to the Flor Azangarina II (Flower of Azángaro, 2nd) Communal Bank which is located in the Azángaro District and Province, Department of Puno. She is 22 years old and a single mother with two children. She has an incomplete secondary education and lives in the Ezequiel Urbiola neighborhood. She is starting her business with the Manuela Ramos movement, with a loan of 500 New Sols. This money will be used to invest in her business selling frozen treats. She also operates a telephone calling service, and one day of the week she sells locally grown products such as chuño (dried tubers), potatoes, quinoa, etc. That is to say, she has several activities with which to meet her family's household expenses. Her greatest dream is to open a grocery store in order to be able to give her children a good education. She likes the easy payments that Manuela Ramos offers to the women in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy locally grown products for sale.

loans.name: Paula Luz

texts.es:
La señora Paula Luz C. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de productos personales atendiendo muy alegremente en el departamento de León donde oferta sus productos a diario.

La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar a lo inmediato un crédito debido a que  requiere de los productos personales para su venta y así satisfacer a sus clientes. Entre los productos personales que ella ofrece se encuentran pinturas de uña, espejos, hilos, aros, colonias, entre otros.
texts.en:
Paula Luz C. has a business selling personal products. She tends to her business very happily in the department of León. She sells her products there every day. The reason she has come to Ceprodel is to ask for an immediate loan. She needs the personal products to sell and satisfy her customers. Some of the personal products she sells are nail polish, mirrors, needles, earrings, and cologne among others.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal products

loans.name: Mujeres En Marcha Group

texts.en:
Olga S., pictured on the right, is the group coordinator of her 5-member group. She resides in Las Minas, a small town in the sector of Guaricanos, in Santo Domingo Norte. She is a single mother with four children, ages 8, 6, 3, and a new 2-month old baby girl. Due to some family issues, she does not have a home for herself, and lives between family members as she works to stabilize herself. Olga currently sells cooked food and groceries from her home thanks to previous loans from Esperanza.

This will be Olga’s third loan, and with it she hopes to expand and target the clothing demand in her town. She plans to increase inventory by purchasing shirts, men’s pants, and accessories such as earrings, and also use the funds to pay to preorder clothing for other people, pick them up from wholesale vendors, and deliver them for a good profit. As a result of her increased income, she hopes to proviD. better living conditions for her children, and hopefully rent her own place at some point. 

Olga’s future business dreams are to open up her own town market selling groceries, clothing, and general products, so that she can enjoy her business, buy her own home and put her children through school.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Henry Daniel

texts.es:
el sr. Henry G. se dedica al comercio desde hace 2 años, el cual ha sabido administrar muy bien, ya que el nos comento que vendia su producto en carro, ahora tiene una tienda.
esta tienda esta ubicada en la calle del comercio del municipio de trojes, Henry se caracteriza porque da muy buenos precios y por la amabilidad con que trata a sus clientes, su afan es querer ser un empresario de exito, el a cuidado muy bien su negocio.
texts.en:
For the past 2 years Mr. Henry G. has worked in sales, which he has known how to administer very well. He told us that he used to sell his product in a cart, but now has a store. This store is located on the commercial street of the municipality of Trojes. Henry is characterized by the good prices he gives and by the kindness with which he treats his clients. His desire is to be a successful businessman. He has cared for his business very well.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Virginia Adilia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia M. con mucho entusiasmo y alegría se dedica a su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en el departamento de León donde a diario oferta sus productos perecederos.

Con la necesidad de mejorar su negocio y de adquirir las verduras, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los perecederos y así ofertarlos en su localidad saliendo adelante y mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Virginia M. very enthusiastically and happily sells fruit and vegetables in the department of León. She sells her perishables every day. Needing to improve her business and get the vegetables, she has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy the perishables. This way she will sell them at her location, get ahead, and improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria M. Vda. D. C. D. 60 años D. edad resiD. en Lourdes Colón, ella vive sola ya que su esposo murió hace un par D. años y su única hija resiD. en Los Estados Unidos. Gloria posee una venta D. ropa para adultos y niños desD. hace 30 años, y es gracias a este negocio que ella ha logrado seguir adelante. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mucha más ropa para su negocio, ya que este es su única forma D. obtener el dinero para sus gastos personales, ella necesita invertir en el y poder mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Gloria M. Vda. D. C. is 60, and she lives in Lourdes Colón. She lives alone since her husband died a couple of years ago. Her only daughter lives in the United States. Gloria has been selling adult and children’s clothing for 30 years. Thanks to this business she has been able to get ahead. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy more clothing for her business. This is her only way of getting the money to cover her personal expenses. She needs to invest in her business and be able to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more clothes for her business

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús de Praga”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chuchito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 70 años de edad, está casada y es madre de 03 hijos, todos ya independientes,  ella  no tiene estudios, y vive en el Barrio San Borja.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace muchos años,  inició su negocio con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de azúcar para la elaboración de mana (cereal).

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para comprar azúcar, maíz, para la elaboración de mana, ella se dedica a la venta de este cereal.

Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan los encuentros de los Bancos Comunales y los ahorros que ha podido generar.
texts.en:
Señora Martha belongs to the communal bank, "Niño de Jesús de Praga," which is located in the district of Yunguyo, in the province of Chuchito, in the department of Puno. She is 70, is married, and is the mother of 3 children who are all independent. She did not go to school and lives in the San Borja neighborhood. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for many years and started her business with an intial loan of 300 PEN. She used this money to purchase sugar to make mana (a type of cereal). Now she needs a loan of 2,000 PEN, with which she will buy sugar and corn to make mana. She makes a living by selling this cereal. Her biggest dream is to keep working. She likes the meetings her communal bank has and the savings that she earns through it.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar and corn

loans.name: Mariela De Concepción

texts.es:
Mariela O. es una dama que a sus 34 años de edad se dedica arduamente a laborar en el departamento de León por medio de la venta de productos plásticos como vasos, platos, cucharas, tenedores, bolsas, entre otros.

Es importante destacar que también ella vende especies como lo son salsas de tomate y mostaza. El motivo por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos plásticos y las especies a sus proveedores y así ofertarlas en su localidad para mejorar sus condiciones y salir adelante en el negocio que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
Mariela O. is a 34-year-old woman who works very hard in the department of León selling plastic items like cups, plates, spoons, forks, bags, etc. It's important to point out that she sells spices like those used for tomato sauces and mustard. The reason she has turned to Ceprodel is to be benefitted with a credit to purchase plastic products and spices from her providers so she can offer these items in her area to improve her living conditions and to get ahead with her business that needs an investment.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase plastic plates and cups as well as spices.

loans.name: Clelia Del Carmen

texts.es: Clelia del Carmen D. C. de 31 años de edad, reside en Barrio Concepción ubicado en el departamento de La libertad junto a su esposo y su única hija de 12 años de edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar. Ella posee una venta de joyería, cosméticos, zapatos para niños y mujeres y otro tipo de accesorios para el cuidado personal de la piel. Clelia solicita un préstamo, ya que su mayor deseo es poder comprar al mayoreo, de manera que pueda ofrecer muchos más artículos a sus clientes y así mismo obtener nuevos clientes y así mejorar su economía familiar y poder brindarle un mejor futuro a su hija.
texts.en:
Clelia del Carmen D. C. is 31 years old and lives in Barrio Concepción, located in the La Libertad department with her husband and only daughter. Her daughter is 12 years old and is enrolled in school. She owns a store where she sells jewelry, cosmetics, children's and women's shoes, and other types of accessories for skin care. Clelia is requesting a loan because her desire is to be able to purchase wholesale, which is a way she could offer many more products to her customers and at the same time get new customers. This way, she can improve the life of her family and be able to provide a better future for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of more products for her business

location.town: Barrio Concepción,  departamento de La libertad

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora María A. es una dama que se dedica a elaborar comida para ser ofertada en su localidad en el departamento de León habiendo adquirido muchos clientes que les ha agradado mucho los alimentos que ella prepara. 

Ella actualmente tiene mucha experiencia en la elaboración de los alimentos y por este motivo es muy visitada por sus clientes. Ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel porque requiere la compra de la materia prima para preparar los alimentos y de esta manera ofertarlos en su localidad.
texts.en:
The señora María A. is a lady that works making food to be offered in her local area in the department of León, having acquired many clients that have thanked her a lot for the food that she prepares. She actually has a lot of experience preparing food and for this reason she is visited a lot by her clients. She has asked for a loan from Ceprodel because she needs to purchase primary materials to prepare the food, and this way offer it in her local area.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy primary materials to prepare food

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Los Milagros”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Imicati, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 45 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 7 hijos, tiene estudios de educación primaria completa y vive en el  Barrio Santa Rosa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años,  recibió un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual lo utilizo para su negocio de compra y productos de la región como chuño, papa, oca, quinua, etc. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio.  Con este dinero comprará chuño, papas y otros productos de la región.
Su mayor sueño es poder comprarse un carro. A ella le gusta los ahorros, y las charlas que recibe del personal de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
The señora Gregoria belongs to the Communal Bank 'Señor de Los Milagros', which is located in the community of Imicati, Yunguyo district, Chucuito Province, Puno Department. She is 45 years old, is married, has 7 children, has completed primary school and lives in the neighbourhood of Santa Rosa. Gregoria has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 7 years. She received an initial loan of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, which she used to purchase products for her business such as potato flour, potatoes, geese, quinoa, etc. In this moment Gregoria needs a loan of S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, to be able to invest in her business. With this money she will buy potato flour, potatoes, and other products of the region. Her biggest dream is to be able to buy a car. She likes the savings and the personal conversations that she has with Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato flour, potato, geese, quinoa etc

loans.name: Zoila Margarita

texts.es: Zoila Margarita P. E. de 33 años de edad reside en San Marcos junto a sus padres y sus tres hijos, ella es madre soltera y es la única que vela por el bienestar de sus hijos. Zoila posee una venta de frutas en la tiendona, uno de los mercados más grandes del país, cada día ella esta ahí esperando a que los camiones con frutas lleguen para poder escoger las mejores frutas. Ella solicita un préstamo ya que desea poder aumentar la variedad de frutas como por ejemplo vender uvas, ciruelas entre otras frutas de estación, lo cual le permitirá obtener mayores ganancias y tener una mejor vida junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Zoila Margarita P. E. of 33 years of age resides in San Marcos together with her parents and her 3 children. She is a single mother and is the only person to watch over the well-being of her children. Zoila has a fruit business in the tiendona, one of the biggest markets in the country. Every day she is there waiting for the fruit trucks to arrive to be able to select the best fruit. She is seeking a loan now as she desires to be able to expand the variety of fruit, for example to sell grapes and plums, among other fruits, which will permit her to obtain better earnings and have a better life together with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits

location.town: San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Lissette Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Lisette trabaja arduamente en el departamento de León por medio de la venta de chicha el cual es un producto derivado del maíz para elaborar refresco cuyo nombre es “Chicha” y es muy típico en Nicaragua.

La señora Lissette por ser madre soltera y con dos pequeños hijos que mantener, ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra del maíz para preparar la chicha y así venderla lista para preparar el refresco.
texts.en:
Ms. Lisette works arduously in the department of León selling chicha—a traditional Nicaraguan beverage derived from corn.

Because she is a single mother with 2 young children to support, Ms. Lisette now turns to Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase corn for preparing chicha.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn to make chicha drink

loans.name: Celina Del Pilar

texts.es: Celina del Pilar V. R. de 45 años de edad reside en Verapaz en el departamento de San Vicente junto a su esposo y tres hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, Celina junto a su esposo trabajan muy duro por brindarles una vida mejor a sus hijos, la cual cumpla con todo lo necesario para ellos. Celina solicita un préstamo a través del cual podrá comprar granos básicos como arroz, frijoles y azúcar, ya que son estos los productos que más se venden.
texts.en:
Celina del Pilar V. R. is a 45-year-old woman who lives in Verapaz, in the department of San Vicente with her husband and three school age children. She owns a store in which she sells basic need items. Celina and her husband work very hard to give their children a better life in which they have everything they need. Celina is requesting a loan with which she can purchase staple grains, such as rice, beans, and sugar since these are the most popular products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple grains

loans.name: Norma Nelida

texts.es:
La señora Nelida pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación 2000”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil casada.  Está embarazada, este sería su primer hijo.  Ella  tiene estudios de educación superior (técnica en computación), vive en el Cercado.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 9 años.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual invirtió en su negocio de molinera (moler granos). 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su negocio de molinera, comprará granos al por mayor.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para así solventar los gastos familiares.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los encuentros de los Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Ms. Norma Nelida M. is a member of the “Nueva Generación 2000” Microfinance Institute, located in the Ilave district of the El Collao province, department of Puno. She is a 32-year-old married woman who is currently expecting her first child. She earned a diploma as a computer technician, and she lives in El Cercado.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 9 years. She invested her first 300.00 PEN loan in a grain mill.

At this time, she needs a 2,000.00 PEN loan to invest in her mill by purchasing wholesale grains.

Her greatest wish is to continue working so that she can cover the family expenses.

She really likes the meetings that take place at the microfinance institutes.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen has been in the media and production business for over 10 years. In 2002 she moved to New York from Florida, where she grew up, to work as an editor and producer. She eventually became a freelancer and about two years ago, with a growing client base, she decided to establish a full-service media consulting and production company. Maureen enjoys her work and is dedicated to helping non-profit organizations use media to effectively disseminate their message. 

She heard the same response from many banks, which was that they couldn’t lend to a business of her size at this time. Given that she needed capital to sustain and to help grow her business, Maureen decided to look into microfinance options and so she came to ACCION USA. With her loan, Maureen is hiring a new employee to help grow the business’ client base. She will also use a portion of the loan to cover the costs associated with developing new partnerships with other media companies to initiate new projects.
