Maureen has established her business and created a loyal clientele that depends on her for their media needs. Her long-term vision for her business is to help expand her outreach to serve more non-profits.

loans.use: Hiring a new employee and outreach

loans.name: Juana Quintina

texts.es:
La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación 2000”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 62 años D. edad, está casada y es madre D. 01 hijo ya independiente, ella no tiene estudios,  vive en la Calle Ramón Castilla.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 9 años,  su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que invirtió en su negocio D. venta confección D. polleras (faldas típicas D. la Región).

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder comprar tela D. diferentes colores y así pueda elaborar más polleras las mismas que pondrá en venta.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para solventar sus gastos.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y las charlas recibidas por el personal D. Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana H. is a member of the “Nueva Generación 2000” Microfinance Institute, located in the Ilave district of the El Collao province, department of Puno. She is a 62-year-old married mother with 1 independent child. She received no schooling and lives on Ramón Castilla Street.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 9 years. She invested her first 300.00 PEN loan in her pollera (regional skirt) business.

At this time, she needs a 2,000.00 PEN loan so that she can purchase different-colored fabric and make more skirts to sell.

Her greatest wish is to continue working so that she can cover her personal expenses.

She likes the meetings and chats that the Manuela Ramos personnel gives.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric to make traditional skirts

loans.name: César Augusto

texts.es: César Augusto L. N. de 22 años de edad reside en San Pedro Perulapán, junto a sus abuelos paternos. El es un joven muy visionario el cual desea sobresalir y tener una mejor vida, ya que durante cinco años trabajó en la gran ja  de su tío en lo relacionado con la avicultura y ya hace dos años creó su propia granja teniendo a la fecha 300 pollos, también trabaja en un taller de costura cerca de su hogar. César solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda aumentar la cantidad de pollos de 300 a 500, el desea crecer mucho más en su negocio por lo cual se esfuerza mucho y a su corta edad ha demostrado ser un joven muy emprendedor con muchas ganas de superarse.
texts.en:
César Augusto L. N. is a 22-year-old who lives with his paternal grandparents in San Pedro Perulapán. He is a young visionary who hopes to get ahead and have a better life. For five years, he worked in his uncle’s poultry farm, and two years ago, he started his own farm. At this time, he has 300 chickens. He also works in a garment factory near his home. César is seeking a loan with which he can increase his number of chickens from 300 to 500. He hopes to expand his business even more, which is why he exerts himself. At his young age, he has demonstrated to be a very enterprising man with the desire for self-improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more chickens

location.town: San Pedro Perulapán, departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Maria Ana

texts.es: María Ana B. López tiene la edad de 60 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de helados. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios se dan por la necesidad de poseer una fuente de ingresos para su familia, por lo que todos los días se levanta muy temprano con la esperanza de sacar adelante a  sus hijos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de paletas de helado entre otras cosas. Su deseo es incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
María Ana B. López is a 60-year-old married woman with 2 children under her care. She has been selling ice cream for a living for more than 30 years. She started the business out of the need to have a source of income for her family, which is why she gets up very early everyday with the hopes of helping her children get ahead. The loan that she is requesting will be used as working capital to purchase frozen bars and other goods. She hopes to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda tiene 45 años, vive junto al padre de sus 6 hijos, de los cuales, sólo 3 de ellos viven con ellos. La gran parte de su casa es de madera, pero pronto planea construir otra parte con material noble (cemento. Cuando era pequeña realizaba los trabajos agrícolas junto a sus padres, pero no le gustaba ser agricultora, proponiéndose para el futuro dedicarse al comercio de frutas y verduras. Una vez que formó su propia familia, le propuso la idea a su pareja, quien no estuvo de acuerdo en un primer momento, pero Hermelinda perseveró y finalmente terminó convertida en una próspera comerciante de frutas de su pueblo. Ahora su esposo la ayuda las veces que tiene que ir de compras a las chacras más lejanas en busca de precios muy bajos para pesar y cargar las arrobas o racimos de plátanos (12 kilos) y en el caso de naranjas compran por cientos. Ella es una vendedora muy dinámica, le gusta progresar a base de su trabajo, por ello que todas sus ganancias las va invirtiendo en la mejora de su casa y la educación de sus hijos. Hermelinda incentiva a todos sus compañeros del banco comunal para que cumplan con sus pagos, dando el ejemplo ella misma, trabajando con mucha responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de plátanos y naranjas para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a 45-year-old woman who lives with the father of her 6 children, 3 of whom live with them. Her house is mostly made of wood, but she is planning on soon building the other part with sturdier material—cement. When she was young, she used to work in agriculture alongside her parents, but she did not like that. Instead, she aimed to work as a fruit and vegetable vendor. As soon as she started her own family, she proposed the idea to her partner, who did not go along with it at first. However, Hermelinda persevered until she finally became a prosperous green grocer in her city. Her husband now helps her anytime time she has to visit the most distant farms in search of low prices to weigh and carry the banana bunches and oranges by the hundreds. She is a dynamic merchant who likes to get ahead by means of her labor. For this reason, she has invested her profits in home improvement and in providing an education for her children. Hermelinda motivates the other group members of the microfinance institute so that they can make their payments on time, setting the example herself and working responsibly. She will invest the money that she is requesting in purchasing bananas and oranges so that she can increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Reina Pricila

texts.es:
la sra, Reina Pricila C. tiene una pulperia y un comedor, ella tiene tres hijas las que le ayudan en los negocios los cuales abre muy temprano la pulperia, en su pulperia vende vende :arroz, maiz, frijoles, café, salsas, carnes, frutas, verduras etc. los productos que vende los compra  a  carros repartidores y otras cosas en bodegas de la ciudad, en el comedor vende todo tipò de comida tambien vende golosinas, tiene muchos clientes ellos la prefieren por su buena atencion. trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia, ella es madre soltera.
doña reina vive en un barrio de la ciudad de choluteca.
texts.en:
Ms. Reina Pricila C. owns a general store and a small restaurant. She has three daughters who help her with the businesses. She opens her general store very early in the morning and sells: rice, corn, beans, coffee, salsa, meats, fruits, vegetables, etc. She purchases some goods from delivery trucks, and others from other markets in the city. She sells all types of meals in her restaurant. She also sells candy. She has many customers who prefer her businesses because of her great service. She works very hard in order to help her family get ahead as she is a single mother. She lives in the city of Choluteca.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soap, coffee, rice, beans, corn, churros (fried dough pastries), pasta, salsa, soup, butter, margarine, dairy products, beverages, and canned juice

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.es:
La señora Oliva, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación 2000”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente.  Es madre de 01 hijo y  tiene estudios de educación superior (educación.  Vive en el Barrio Alasaya.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la implementación de su negocio de venta de jugos.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su nuevo negocio,  atención en cabinas de Internet, parte del dinero lo utilizará para implementar este negocio.  Paralelamente continúa con la venta de jugos.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando y hacer crecer su negocio.

A ella le gusta la forma de trabajo de Manuela Ramos y las reuniones de los Bancos Comunales.
texts.en:
Ms. Oliva C. is a member of the “Nueva Generación 2000” Microfinance Institute, located in the Ilave district of the El Collao province, department of Puno. She is a 28-year-old with a live-in partner and a son. She completed secondary school and lives in the Alasaya neighborhood.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 5 years. She used her first 300.00 PEN loan in starting her own juice business. At this time, she needs a 3,000.00 PEN loan so that she can invest it in a new business—an Internet café. She will use some of the money in this venture, and she will continue with her juice business.

Her biggest wish is to continue working so that she can help her business grow. She likes the way Manuela Ramos works, and the microfinance institutes’ meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Launch internet café and purchase fruit

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto P. G. de 42 años de edad reside en Cojutepeque junto a su esposa y su hija. Él posee un negocio de reparación de maquinas de coser, así también se dedica a comprar maquinaria arruinada la cual la repara y luego la vende. El solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar repuestos para las maquinas, tales como motores, fajas, entre otros más.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto P. G. is a 42-year-old man who lives in Cojutepeque with his wife and daughter. He has his own sewing machine repair shop. He also purchases broken machinery that he repairs and sells. He is seeking a loan with which he will be able to purchase spare parts for sewing machines, such as motors and belts, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for sewing machines

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es: María Guadalupe C. Q. de 54 años de edad reside en el municipio de Ciudad Arce. Ella es una mujer soltera la cual vive junto a sus tres nietos, por los cuales vela día y noche. María Guadalupe posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia la cual esta establecida desde hace 7 años. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio con productos como granos básicos, lácteos, cereales, pan y bebidas, María desea mucho poder mejorar sus negocios y así también sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Guadelupe C. Q. is 54 years old and lives in the municipality of Ciudad Arce. She is a single woman who lives with her three grandchildren, whom she looks after full time. María has a store in her home that she established 7 years ago. She is requesting a loan so that she can supply her business with products such as basic grains, dairy products, cereals, bread, and beverages. María really wants to improve her business as well as her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing more products to supply her store

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La señora Eusebia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación 2000”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 60 años D. edad, es viuda y es madre D. 05 hijos todos ya independientes,  y  no tiene estudios.  Vive en el Barrio Alasaya.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 6 años,  su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual invirtió en su negocio D. compra venta D. abarrotes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, que es la compra y venta D. abarrotes, con los cuales ella comprara, arroz, azúcar, leche, harina, fideos, etc.

Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando y D. alguna manera ayudar a sus nietos.
texts.en:
The señora Eusebia belongs to the communal bank 'Nueva Generación 2000', which is located in the key district, Provincia D. El Collao, Puno Department. She is 60 years old, is a widow and mother to 5 children, who are all independent, and she hasn't studied. She lives in the neighbourhood of Alasaya. She has worked with el Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 6 years. Her first loan was of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, which was invested in her business in the purchase of grocery items. Now she requires a loan of S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, to be able to invest in her business, which is the purchase and sale of groceries, of which she will buy rice, sugar, milk, flour, pasta etc. Her biggest dream is to continue working and in some way help her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk, flour, pasta

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo tiene 47 años, es un hombre sereno de carácter y está casado hace 20 años con la madre de sus 3 hijos. Todos juntos viven en la casa que él construyó con la ayuda de su esposa e hijos. Desde muy niño trabajó cultivando la tierra, de lo cual se siente muy complacido, viendo desarrollar cada una de sus plantas, puesto que sabe que gracias a sus frutos obtiene buenas ganancias. La siembra del café es lo que más le gusta, aunque le genere mayor inversión cuando quiere alcanzar desarrollar un fruto con calidad de exportación (primera cosecha), por el que le pagan muy buen precio. Mientras que la segunda cosecha es para abastecer la procesadora de un amigo a un precio menor por ser frutos más pequeños. Lo bueno es que casi siempre sus ganancias cubren la inversión realizada, ahora está planeando renovar sus plantas de café para asegurar buenas producciones los próximos años. Durante los tiempos de cosecha acude a su chacra a las 5.00am para que a las 9.00am, antes de desayunar, ya estén llenas 3 o 4 cestos de café. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, donde viene cumpliendo puntualmente cada una de sus cuotas. En las reuniones de su banco comunal sus opiniones siempre son acertadas por lo que sus compañeros las respetan cabalmente. El dinero solicitado lo piensa invertir en la compra de nuevas plantas de café, en aras de renovar sus siembras para prevenir alguna circunstancia adversa futura.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 47 years old, is a man with a serene character, and has been married for 20 years to the mother of his 3 children. All of them live in the house that he constructed with the help of his wife and children. Since he was a very little boy, he has worked cultivating the land, something that he takes great pleasure in, seeing each of his plants develop, knowing that thanks to their fruits he obtains good earnings. The sowing of the coffee is what he like the most, although they generate a greater investment when he lets them develop a fruit with export quality (first harvest), for which people pay him a very good price. The second harvest is to supply the processor of a friend at a lower price because the fruit is smaller. The good thing is that his earnings nearly always cover his investment, now he is planning to renew his coffee plants to secure good harvests in the coming years. During the harvest times he goes to his farm at 5am, so that at 9am, before breakfast, 3 or 4 baskets of coffee are filled. This is his fourth loan with MFP, where he punctually meets each of his payments. In his communal bank's meetings his opinions are always correct, for which his companions respect them. The money that he is requesting he thinks of investing in the purchase of new coffee plants, and in ploughs to renew his sowing to prevent any adverse circumstances in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy coffee plants

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis tiene 41 años, está casado hace 17 años, es padre de 5 hijos con los que vive. La agricultura es una de las actividades heredadas por su padre, lo que siembra generalmente son frutos cítricos (naranjas, mandarinas) y son los meses de enero a marzo los más rentables, por ser época de verano en la ciudad de Lima, a donde envía sus productos. Actualmente está preparando nuevas chacras para renovar sus cítricos y asegurarse buenas cosechas posteriores. Pero no todo es bueno, ya que en ciertas temporadas tiene que enfrentarse a los mosquitos que afectan mucho a sus plantas y él trata de contrarrestar con funguicidas y pesticidas. A Luis le gusta labrar la tierra y cuidar de cada una de sus plantaciones, mas aún se siente muy feliz cuando sus frutas obtienen un buen precio. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, donde ha demostrado responsabilidad en cada uno de sus pagos y para este crédito reitera su responsabilidad en sus cuotas. Con el dinero solicitado mandará a limpiar de las malezas de chacras, eso le costará la suma de 500 a 700 soles, el resto de dinero lo invertirá en la compra de plantas para renovar sus cultivos de cítricos.
texts.en:
Luis is 41 years old, has been married for 17 years, and is the father of 5 children, with whom he lives. Agriculture is an activity inherited from his father. He generally plants citrus fruits (oranges, mandarins). The most profitable months are from January to March, because this is the summer season in the city of Lima, where he sends his products. But not everything is good, because in certain periods he has to confront the mosquitoes that greatly affect his plants, and he tries to counteract them with fungicides and pesticides. Luis likes to work the earth and take care of each one of his plantations, and he feels even more happy when the fruit fetch a very good price. This is his fifth loan with MFP, where he has demonstrated responsibility in each of his payments and with this loan reiterates his responsibility with his payments. With the money he is seeking he will remove the weeds from his farms, which will cost him the sum of between 500 and 700 soles, and he will invest the rest of the money in the purchase of plants to renew his citrus cultivations.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clean the weeds from farms

loans.name: Maria Yani

texts.es:
La señora María Yani, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas de Jorge Chávez II”, vive en el Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 29 años y es madre de 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.

Yanita, como le dicen de cariño, se inició con un préstamo de S/. 300.00 y por iniciativa propia fue quien decidió emprender su negocio de venta de chupetes y hielos que son muy solicitados por el clima caluroso que tenemos, empezó poco a poco, luego fue aumentando e implementando mas su negocio, ahora vende mas y ya es conocida por sus clientes, vecinos y amigos.
En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, cuenta con un pequeño local especialmente  acondicionado en su propia casa, donde atiende a sus clientes con amabilidad y el buen carisma que tiene.

Con el prestamo de S/. 1,000.0 lo invertirá pagando la última cuota  que le faltaba pagar de su congeladora 

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es una mujer muy luchadora y constante en sus metas que desea lograr y es muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
 
Yanita, esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer, así mismo ayudar a muchas mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
The señora María Yani belongs to the communal bank “Las Estrellitas de Jorge Chávez II” and lives in the district of Tarapoto, San Martín Department. She lives with her partner, is 29 years old, and is mother to 2 children that still depend on her. Yanita, as she is affectionately called, began with a loan of S/. 300.00 and with her own initiative decided to launch her business of lollipops and ices, which are greatly sought after because of the hot climate. She began little by little, later augmenting and installing more in her business, and now she sells more and is known by her clients, neighbours and friends. She continues with the same business, and has a small area specially air-conditioned in her own house, where she attends her clients amiably and with the great charisma that she has. With this loan of S/. 1,000.00 she will pay the final installment which was lacking to pay off her freezer. She makes the decisions about the earnings of her business. Personally, she is born fighter and constant with her goals that she wants to achieve, and is very responsible with her payments. Yanita is very thankful for the Movimiento Manual Ramos for permitting her to grow as a businesswoman and woman, and help many other women who want to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay the last instalment for a freezer

loans.name: Jireth Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario jireth esta integrado por tres personas,  vecinos de la colonia obrera,  y han trabajado juntas, se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo.
las actividades que ellas realizan son las siguietes
    
la señora dilcia P. A. tiene 45 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor abelardo  ventura, tienen 4 hijos, dos de ellos viven en los estados unidos y dos estan con ella. ya estan graduados y trabajan.
su casa es construccion de ladrillos de adobe repellado con color blanco y rosado ella tiene un negocio en casa de variedades venta de abarroteria y zandalias, ropa. dilcia necesita el credito para surtir mas su negocio.
 
carmelina L. J. vive en union libre con el señor catalino lopèz,  tiene 60 años de edad, no tienen hijos que dependen de ella.
dedica a la venta de cocos y una chiclera que tiene desde hace 10 años en la colonia obrera necesita el prestamo para comprar 500 cocos,confites y galletas por mayor tambien vende naranjas.
 
leonicia C. Z. es madre soltera, depende de ella solo un nieto de 14 años de edad, ella tiene 53 años de edad,  su casa esta construida de ladrillos de adobe repellado color blanco tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa y solicita el credito  para compra manteca,frescos,huevos, agua en bolsa etc.
texts.en:
The supportive group Jireth is made up of 3 people, neighbours of the workers colony. They have worked together and known each other for a long time. The activities that they do are the following: Señora Dilcia P. A. is 45 years old, and lives in a partnership with Señor Abelardo Ventura. They have 3 children, 2 of whom live in the United States and 2 with her. The children are now graduates and work. Her house is made from adobe bricks painted white and pink. Dilcia has a business in her house selling various groceries, sandals and clothes. She needs a loan to supply her business. Carmelina L. J. lives in a partnership with Señor Catalino Lopèz. She is 60 years old, and doesn't have children that depend on her. She sells coconuts and has a street stand which she has had for 10 years in the workers colony. She needs this loan to buy 500 coconuts, biscuits and also to sell oranges. Leonicia C. Z. is a single mother. She is 53 years old, and has a 14 year grandson that depends on her. Her house is made from adobe bricks painted white. She has a small local store in her house and is seeking credit to buy butter, juices, eggs, bottles of water etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, coconut, lollies, biscuits, oranges, butter, juice, eggs, bottled water and boots.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elba Jeannette

texts.es: Elba Jeannette R. D. de 29 años vive junto a su esposo y su único hijo en Lourdes Colón. Ella posee una tienda, de la cual obtiene la mayoría de dinero para solventar todos sus gastos familiares. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual tenga el poder adquisitivo para surtir su negocio con más bebidas, pan, Golosinas, entre otros productos más considerados de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Elba Jeannette R. D. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and son in Lourdes Colón. She owns a store, which provides the majority of income to pay for her family's expenses. She has requested a loan so that she can purchase more drinks, bread, sweets, and other products to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Isabel Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Isabel Virginia S. C. tiene 23 años, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, en la provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 5 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Isabel se dedica a la venta de desayuno, negocio que ya tenia cuando inicio en Manuela Ramos, en sus ratos libres elaboraba collares y aretes los cuales los ofrecía a sus amistades y al ver que sus modelos si gustaban a la gente empezó con la venta en mayor cantidad vendiendo no solo a sus vecinos si no también a ofrecer en tiendas de su distrito.
Los materiales para la bisutería los obtiene en las tiendas comerciales en el  centro de Trujillo.
Los insumos para preparar alimentos los obtiene del mercado de abastos en el Porvenir.
Con el crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Viva con Esperanza, lo invirtió en la compra de insumos para la preparación de desayunos así mismo compró materiales para la confección de aretes. 
Con el crédito de 800 soles lo invertirá en su negocio de bisutería y medicamentos para su tratamiento.
Isabel tiene como sueño poner su restaurante en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Isabel Virginia S. C. is 23 years old and lives in the El Porvenir district in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. She completed her secondary school education and has 5 children who depend on her financially. Isabel dedicates herself to selling breakfasts, a business that she already had when she started with Manuela Ramos. In her spare time, she makes necklaces and earrings that she offers to her friends. At seeing that people liked her designs, she started making them in larger quantities to sell not only to her neighbors but also to stores in her district. She obtains the materials for her jewelry-making from the supply stores at the market in Porvenir. With the loan of 300 soles that she received from her cooperative bank, Live with Hope, she invested in the purchase of materials for making earrings. With the loan of 800 soles, she will invest further into her jewelry business and in medications. Isabel’s dream is to open a restaurant in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for making breakfasts, and also materials for making earrings.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes R. C. tiene 32 años, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, en la provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 5 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Mercedes se dedica a la fabricación de calzado, su taller esta ubicado en su domicilio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para la fabricación de dicho calzado, los cuales son vendidos a tiendas comerciales ubicados en Trujillo y Chiclayo.
Sus materiales son adquiridos en tiendas comerciales ubicados en el distrito donde vive (El Porvenir). 
Recién ha ingresado como socia del Banco Comunal Viva con Esperanza II.
Con este crédito de 300 soles lo invertirá en la compra de tacos, cuero, badana y cajas esenciales para la fabricación y venta de su producto (calzado).  
Mercedes tiene como sueño ampliar su taller, adquirir nuevas maquinas para fabricar calzado, generarse mejores ingresos y brindar comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes R. C. is 32 years old and lives in the El Porvenir district in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. She completed her secondary school education and has 5 children who depend on her financially. Mercedes dedicates herself to making shoes, and her workshop is located right in her own home. She has the support of her husband for making said shoes, which she sells in the stores located in Trujillo and Chiclayo. She acquires her materials in the stores located in the district where she lives (El Porvenir). She has recently joined as a member of the Live with Hope II cooperative bank. With this loan of 300 soles, she will invest in the purchase of heels, leather and boxes for making and selling her product (footwear). Mercedes dreams of expanding her workshop, buying new machinery for making shoes, generating more income, and providing comforts for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase heels, leather, and boxes, essential for making and selling her product.

loans.name: Maria Carolina

texts.es:
La señora María Carolina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 40 años y 06 hijos, 03 de ellos que están bajo su responsabilidad. 

María, se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir trabajando, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas y venta de comida. Manifiesta que con el negocio que ejerce se siente muy tranquila y contenta y es quien administra su negocio. 

Su negocio se ubica en los interiores de una empresa de venta de pollos, llamada “Don Pollo” en un ambiente especialmente acondicionado, por lo que su venta diaria de comida lo tiene asegurada,  ya que brinda pensión a los mismos trabajadores de la empresa. Esta muy contenta, se siente muy capaz y responsable con las cuotas que debe pagar mensualmente al Banco Comunal.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos, para la preparación de sus comidas como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, huevos y pollos en javas y paquetes de aceites, lo necesario para la preparación de sus comidas. Parte del dinero, que lo invertirá comprando bebidas como: gaseosas de diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas. Así como agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
María Carolina, se siente orgullosa por haber logrado implementar su negocio, y asegurarse una vejez tranquila. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla ayudado a superarse y a otras mujeres que quieren salir adelante y a defenderse como mujeres.
texts.en:
María Carolina belongs to the communal bank “La Marginal II”, which is located in the district of Tarapoto, in the province of San Martin, and in the department of San Martín. She lives with her husband and she is 40 years old. She has 6 children and three of them still live at home with her and depend on her. María has a lot of strength to continue working hard. She makes a living by selling soft drinks and food items. She is very happy with her business and she loves that she is the one in charge of the business. Her business is located inside of a company that sells chicken and is called “Don Pollo”. The space that she sells out of was especially set up for her business and her daily sales of food are guaranteed since she sells food to the workers of the company. She is very happy and she feels very capable and responsible for the payments that she must make to the communal bank each month. With the $350 that she is requesting she want to invest the money in buying the necessary ingredients for the preparation of her food items. She plans on buying large quantities of rice, sugar, eggs, chicken and cooking oil. Part of the money will also be invested in the purchase of different types and sizes of soft drinks. She will also buy carbonated and non-carbonated mineral water to sell. María Carolina feels proud that she was able to start a business. She now feels more secure about being financial independent in her old age. She is thankful for the Manuela Ramos Movement because it has helped her to improve her life and it has helped other women like her to get ahead in life and to take care of themselves and their families.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare her foods and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Lider

texts.es:
La señora Líder, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres para el Futuro II”, Distrito Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 55 años, 08 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes y con familia.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas D. salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio D. Venta D. Juanes, ubicada en una esquina D. la principal calle D. la ciudad, donD. hay bastante movimiento y sus principales clientes son motocarristas y chóferes que transitan por ese lugar, poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo D. actividad. 

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donD. venD. diariamente  por las mañanas. Tiene varios años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace su meta e tener un lugar estable para venD. comida variada. 
 
Con el préstamo D. S/ 2,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas, pollo en kilos que los compra a diario, yucas y papas en sacos para prepara las empanadas que también venD. a diario.

Lider, se siente tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Líder belongs to the Mujeres para el Futuro II Community Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 55, and she is in a common law marriage. She has eight children who are independent and have their own families. Her characteristic fighting spirit and the desire to get ahead on her own have served her well in starting her own business of selling “juanes” (a dish traditionally eaten in the Peruvian rainforest. It’s maD. from chicken, rice, olives, and eggs and wrapped in a special leaf.) Her business is located on a corner of the main street in the city where there is lots of movement. Her main customers are people in motorcycle carts and drivers who pass that way. Little by little she has become well know among her customers. It is now going very well for her. She currently continues with the same business where she sells every morning. She has been working in the business for several years. She feels very happy with what she does. Her goal is to have a stable place to sell various foods. With the loan for 2,000 PEN she will buy supplies like kilos of rice and sugar, crates of eggs, kilos of chicken purchased daily, yuccas, and sacks of potatoes to prepare the empanadas that she also sells daily. Líder feels peaceful and happy with what she does. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make her juanes (a typical Peruvian dish)

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es: Ángela D. L. V. D. 58 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Ahuachapán junto a su esposo y una nieta la cual esta totalmente a su cargo. Ángela posee una tienda en la cual se comercializan productos perecederos. Ella solicita un préstamo ya que su mayor deseo es poder aumentar sus ventas y esto lo podrá alcanzar surtiendo más su tienda ya que así obtendría mayor clientela la cual le  permita obtener mayores ganancias. Ella trabaja y se esfuerza a diario ya que desea poder brindarle una vida digna a su pequeña nieta.
texts.en:
Ángela D. L. V. is 58 years old and she lives in the municipality of Ahuachapán with her husband and one of her granddaughters who she has full custody of. Ángela owns a store where she sells groceries. She is requesting a loan since her greatest wish is to increase her sales. The loan will help her to stock her store with a greater variety of items so that she will be able to attract new cliental and increase her earnings. She works hard everyday to give a nice life to her young granddaughter.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell at her store.

loans.name: Celestina Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Celestina del Carmen, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 40 años y es madre de 06 hijos, todos ellos que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Lleva 15 años dedicándose a la Venta de Almidón, producto elaborado a base de yuca se inicio con S/. 100.00 y junto con su esposo, emprendieron su negocio, que se encuentra ubicada, en su misma; donde cuenta con una huerta grande, espacio que le permite rallar, cernir  y secar el producto, antes de ser vendidos.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio de Venta de Almidón que sirve para la preparación de dulces regionales, cuenta con clientes fijos y también trabaja con panaderías  y bodegas, que hacen sus pedidos mensualmente y diariamente.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, lo invertirá comprando 01 tonelada de yuca.
Con parte del dinero también comprara planchas de calamina y plásticos, herramientas principales para secar  al sol el almidón que produce, cuidando siempre la higiene y limpieza.
 
Ella y su esposo, son quienes  toman  las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, se siente más independiente, tranquila, capaz y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Celestina, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Celestina del Carmen belongs to the La Marginal II Community Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín department. She is 40 and in a common law marriage. She has six dependent children who attend school. For 15 years she has been selling starch, a product made from yucca. She started with 100 PEN, and together with her husband they initiated their business. The business is located at her home where they have a large orchard. The space allows them to grate, sift, and dry the product before selling it. She currently continues with the same business of selling starch, which is used to prepare regional sweets. She has a client base. She also works with bakeries and stores who place monthly and daily orders. With this loan for 3,000 PEN she will buy one ton of yucca. She will use part of the money to buy corrugated metal and plastic sheets. These are the primary tools used to dry the starch in the sun, always being careful about hygiene and cleanliness. She and her husband make the decisions about the earnings from the business. Personally, she feels more independent, calm, capable, and responsible about making her payments. Celestina is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tons of yucca

loans.name: Charito Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Charito Elizabeth C. T. tiene 39 años, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, en la provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 5 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Charito se dedica a la venta de cajas para calzado, negocio que ya administraba cuando formo parte de Manuela Ramos, pero elaboraba en menor. Actualmente cuenta con buenos clientes, esto debido al trato amable y productos de calidad a la cual ella siempre hace referencia. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Sus materiales lo obtiene de otros almacenes de Trujillo, recientemente ha comprado una maquina para iniciar con la elaboración de sus propios productos.
Con el crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Viva con Esperanza II, lo invirtió en la compra de cajas.  
Con el crédito de 800 soles, continuará invirtiendo en la compra de cajas y de andamios para exhibir su mercadería.
Charito tiene como sueño contar con una tienda en el cual pueda ofrecer diversos materiales para la confección de calzado.
texts.en:
Charito Elizabeth C. T., 39, lives in the El Porvenir district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She completed high school. She has five dependent children. Charito sells shoe boxes. She managed this business when she became part of Manuela Ramos, but she produced less. She currently has a good customer base due to her kind manner and quality products, which she always makes reference to. The business is in her house. She obtains the materials from other stores in Trujillo. She has recently purchased a machine to start making her own products. With the loan for 300 PEN that she received from her Community Bank, Viva con Esperanza II, she bought boxes. With the loan for 800 PEN she will continue to buy boxes, and she will buy scaffolding to display her merchandise. Charito’s dream is to have a store where she can sell a variety of materials for making footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy boxes and scaffolding for her merchandise

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es: Eloisa M. Vda. D. L. D. 47 años D. edad resiD. en Tonacatepeque junto a su hijo, nuera y un nieto. Ella posee 16 años D. tener una venta D. tortillas y una tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad. Eloisa solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder surtir su tienda con muchos más productos, ya que solo D. la venta D. tortillas no obtiene el dinero necesario para solventar todos sus gastos, es por esto que desea aumentar sus ventas en la tienda y poder mejorar su forma D. vivir.
texts.en:
Eloisa M. Vda. D. L. is 47. She lives in Tonacatepeque with her son, daughter-in-law, and grandson. For 16 years she has sold tortillas and had a store selling basic needs products. Eloisa is asking for a loan to be able to stock her store with many more products. Selling tortillas does not give her enough money to pay all of her expenses. That is why she wants to increase her sales in the store and be able to improve her way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Ramona De La Concepcion

texts.es: Ella es Ramona de la Concepción O. tiene la edad de 42 años. Es una mujer casada. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa usada y nueva. Hace más de 21 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ramona inicia su negocio porque tenía que ayudar en los gastos de su familia, y decide invertir en la compra de ropa para ofrecerlas a sus vecinos y con muy poco dinero se da cuenta que este negocio es rentable, por lo que decide dedicarse a este negocio. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de calzado, vestidos y pantalones. Sus sueños son de diversificar sus productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Romona de la Concepción O. is 42 years old and married. She works selling new and used clothing, which she has been doing for 21 years. Romona started this business because she had to help with her family's household expenses and decided to invest in the purchase of clothing to sell to her neighbors. Having little money, she realized that this business was profitable and thus decided to dedicate herself to this line of work. The money that she is requesting is for work capital to purchase shoes, dresses and pants. Her dream is to diversify the products that she offers to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Susana Alvina

texts.es:
La señora Susana Alvina V. O. tiene 36 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria Completa, tiene 1 hijo que depende económicamente de ella.
Susana se dedica al reciclaje, su negocio consiste en comprar en la calle y venderlo a los depósitos (Trujillo).
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Mujeres al Progreso, lo invirtió en la compra y venta de chatarra.
Este crédito de 500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de motores y carcasas de carros (repuestos y piezas de carros).
Susana  tiene como sueño tener su depósito de chatarra y que pueda almacenar su mercadería y pueda vender a otras ciudades para  crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Susana Alvina V. O. is 36 years old in lives in the Porvenir district, Trujillo province, in the state of La Libertad in Peru. She completed primary school and has one dependent son. Susana works in recycling; her business consists of buying material in the streets and selling it at various warehouses (in Trujillo). With first loan of 300 Nuevos Soles that she received from the "Mujeres al Progreso" bank she invested in purchase and selling scrap metal. With this loan of 500 Nuevos Soles she will purchase motors and car frames (spare parts). Susana dreams of having her own scrap metal deposit to be able to store her merchandise and sell it in other cities to grow as a microentrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase motors and car frames (spare parts)

loans.name: Ernesto Alexander

texts.es: Ernesto Alexander D. C. de 34 años de edad, reside en Tonacatepeque junto a su prima y una sobrina de 10 años de edad. El posee una venta de medicina desde ya hace 3 años atrás. Ernesto solicita un préstamo ya que desea aumentar el numero de medicinas que posee y así mismo comprar tarjetas de recarga de saldo para celulares, con el fin de comercializarlas también. El desea poder mejorar su negocio y mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Ernesto Alexander D. C. is 34 years old and live in Tonacatepeque with his cousin and 10 year old niece. He has owned a small pharmacy for 3 years. Ernesto is requesting this loan because he wants to expand the number of medicines that he has, as well as purchasing reloadable cellphone cards, with the aim of selling them also. He would like to improve his business as well as his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medicine for store

loans.name: Lilia Flor

texts.es:
La señora Lilia Flor, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 20 años y no tiene hijos.

Florcita, es una mujer joven que le gusta trabajar, nos cuenta que anteriormente vendía cosméticos de la línea Avon y luego por iniciativa propia, decidió dedicarse a la venta de hamburguesas, con el fin de generar sus propios ingresos económicos, con su primer prestamo en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 y con el apoyo de su pareja compraron su carrito sanguchero, posteriormente fue comprando sus utensilios y materiales para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.  

Actualmente, sigue con la venta de hamburguesas, fuera de su casa donde hay bastante movimiento y cuenta que le va muy bien  en sus ventas, empieza a vender  a partir de las 6:00 de la tarde, ya que a esa hora ya hay clientes que desean probar un aperitivo, es ella misma quien los atiende con esa amabilidad y carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos: papitas al hilo, a diario compra 25 panes especialmente para las hamburguesas, embutidos como: jodoc, jamonadas quesos, chicharrones, carnes, huevos y  pollos, en cuestión de verduras comprara tomates y lechugas en kilos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando mesas, sillas y paraguas, para dar una mejor imagen a su negocio y así atraer mas a sus clientes.

Lilia Flor, esta muy segura que su negocio prosperara mas de lo que ahora esta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Lilia Flor is a member of the “La Marginal II” communal bank in the district of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, in the state of San Martín. She is married, 20 years old and doesn't have any children. Florcita, is a young woman that likes to work. She says that she previously sold Avon brand cosmetics and then, via her own initiative, decided to work selling hamburgers with the aim of earning her own income. With her first loan from the Manuela Ramos organization of 300 Nuevos Soles and with the support of her husband, they bought a food cart; later they bought utensils and material to provide a better service to their customers. Currently, she is continuing to sell hamburgers, outside of her house where there is quite a bit of traffic and she says that her sales are very good. She starts selling at six o'clock in the afternoon, since at that time there are customers that want a snack, and she attends to them with the friendliness and charisma that characterizes her. With this loan of 2,000 Nuevos Soles, which will be invested purchasing ingredients; potatoes, she buys 25 breads especially for the hamburgers, cold cuts such as jodoc, ham and cheese, pork rinds, meat, eggs, and chicken, as well as vegetables like tomatoes and lettuce. Part of the money will also be used to purchase tables, chairs and umbrellas, to give her business a better appearance to attract more clients. Lilia Flor, is very sure that her business will prosper to be better than it is now and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals. Lilia Flor, esta muy segura que su negocio prosperara mas de lo que ahora esta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare hamburgers

loans.name: María Azucena

texts.es: María Azucena J. de 52 años de edad vive junto a su hijo, nieta, nuera y una hermana en Tonacatepeque. Ella tiene 8 años de poseer un salón de bella en el cual comercializa también cosméticos y ropa. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar más cosméticos, y poder comprar ropa al mayoreo y comprar sombrillas para esta época de lluvia. María desea mucho poder mejorara las ganancias de su negocio, ya que a pesar de la situación económica que ha vivido ha logrado sobrevivir gracias a su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Azucena Jimenez is 52 years old and lives with her son, her granddaughter, daughter-in-law and a sister in Tonacatepeque. She has owned a beauty salon for 8 years, in which she also sells cosmetics and clothing. She is requesting a loan in order to be able to purchase more cosmetics and clothing at wholesale, and also buy umbrellas for this rainy season. Maria wishes very much to improve the income from her business, since in spite of the financial conditions that she lived through she has been able to survive thanks to this business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, cosmetics and umbrellas.

loans.name: Roya Elena

texts.es:
La señora Roya Elena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres para el Futuro II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 39 años y 02 hijos, ambos aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Su carácter emprendedor y el amor a su familia le motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio de venta de huevos, ubicada en su misma casa donde poco a poco fue aumentando y ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  

En la actualidad tiene sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa a comprar donde ella personalmente les atiende  con alegría y entusiasmo.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará 50 javas de  huevos para venderlos al por menor y continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Royita, anhela implementar su bodega y manifiesta que lo va a hacer realidad  porque es una mujer que cuando se propone algo lo logra.   Agradece el apoyo que viene recibiendo  para emprender su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Roya Elena is a member of the community bank "Women for the Future II", district of Tarapoto, San Martin province, department of San Martin. She is married, is 39 years old and has two children, both of which still depend on her and are in school. Her enterprising nature and love for her family have motivated her to start her own business selling eggs, from her own house. Bit by bit she has been growing and gaining experience in this activity, becoming well known and loved by her customers. Currently she has regular customers that come to her home daily and buy, she attends to them personally with joy and enthusiasm. With the loan of 1000 soles she will buy 50 crates of eggs to sell at retail and continue to provide good service to her customers. Royita wishes to open a general store and says that she will make that a reality because she is a woman that achieves what she sets out to do. She is thankful for the help that she is getting to start her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 50 crates of eggs.

loans.name: Saydith

texts.es:
La señora Saydith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres para el Futuro II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, y tiene 02 hijas gemelitas pequeñas que aun dependen de ella y son el motivo y razón de su gran esfuerzo.

Saydith, es una mujer eficiente, que viéndose en la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos, decidió implementar su pequeño negocio de venta de algunos abarrotes, bebidas y hielos, ubicada en su misma casa, empezó poco a poco y ahora ya se encuentra mejorada y con productos surtidos y al alcance de sus clientes que son principalmente sus amigos y vecinos, donde encuentran lo que necesitan. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien.  

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando algunos abarrotes como: Javas de huevos, paquetes de papel higiénico y golosinas como galletas, caramelos y chicles. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes marcas, sabores y tamaños, para así satisfacer y brindar una mejor  atención a sus clientes. 

Saydith, se siente una mujer muy satisfecha con lo que ha  logrado. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y a cumplir sus sueños y metas, como también a otras  mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente y contar con sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Saydith belongs to "Banco Comunal "Mujeres para el Futuro II", District of Tarapoto, Province San Martín, Department of San Martín. She lives with her partner, has 2 small twin daughters who depend on her and are the cause and reason for her great effort.

Saydith is an efficient lady who, when having the necessity to generate her own income, decided to start a small business selling some groceries, beverages, and ice. The business is located in her house. She started little by little and now she has improved and has a variety of products for her clients, who are mainly her friends and neighbors so they find what they need. At the moment she is continuing with the same business and she tells us that she is doing very well.

With the loan of S/1,000.00 she will invest in buying some groceries such as eggs, packets of toilet paper, and sweets such as cookies, candies, and chewing gum. Part of the money will be invested in buying different brands, flavors, and sizes of soft drinks to satisfy and offer better service to her clients. Saydith feels very satisfied with what she has accomplished. She is grateful to Moviemiento Manuela Ramos for having helped her establish her business and reach her goals and dreams as well as other women who wish to grow businesswise and count on their own income.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries and beverages

loans.name: Justa Consuelo

texts.es: La Señora Justa Consuelo A. O. tiene la edad de 59 años, es una madre soltera. Tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 24 años que se dedica  a este negocio. Justa comenzó su negocio con la venta de refrescos naturales, pan y  gaseosas sus clientes acudían a su pulpería, por lo que ellos mismos brindaron la sugerencia de que ampliara su negocio y comprara productos diarios, por lo que decide establecerse en su vivienda para ofrecer todo lo que sus clientes necesitan. Y así que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y no perder su negocio y comprar granos básicos, golosinas, jugos, pan y refrescos naturales. El sueño de Justa es de mantener este negocio ya que es por su negocio que ha logrado mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Justa Consuelo A. O., 59, is the single mother of three children who go to school. She has had a mini market for over 24 years. She started her business selling natural beverages, bread, and soft drinks. Her customers came to her mini market, and they suggested that she expand her business and buy daily needs products. She decided to set up in her home to be able to offer her customers all that they need. That is why she is asking for this loan for working capital. She does not want to lose her business. She will buy basic grains, sweets, juice, bread, and natural drinks. Justa’s dream is to keep this business, since it is through the business that she has been able to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tanith

texts.es:
La señora Tanith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres para el Futuro II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 26 años y es madre de 01 hijo, 01 que aun depende de ella y está estudiando.

Emprendió su negocio de Venta de Frutas, con un capital de S/. 50.00. Nos cuenta que no le fue fácil implementar su negocio, esta ubicada en el Mercado Nº 02, un puesto que ocupo con mucho esfuerzo, ya que no le fue fácil obtenerlo, porque ahí es un poco peleado, hoy en día esta muy contenta por lo logrado.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, donde sus principales clientes son moradores de la comunidad y amigos que ya conocen el trabajo que realiza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, lo invertirá comprando bananas, mandarinas, naranjas y racimos de plátanos.

Tanith,  a aprendido a tomar sus propias decisiones,  tanto en lo personal como en su negocio. Nos manifiesta su agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Tanith belongs to the Mujeres para el Futuro II Community Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín department. She is 26, and she has a dependent son who goes to school. She started her fruit selling business with 50 PEN. It was not easy to start her business, which is in the Market Number Two. It took a lot of effort, and it was not easy getting her hard-fought place in the market. Now she is very happy that she did it. She currently has the same business. Her main customers are community members and friends who know the work she does. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy bananas, mandarins, oranges, and bunches of bananas. Tanith has learned to make her own decisions in her personal life and in her business. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more fruit to increase her products

loans.name: Luisa Marina

texts.es: Luisa Marina F. A. de 43 años de edad reside en Atiquizaya junto a  sus dos hijas. Ella posee una venta de tamales, panes con pollo, yuca frita, papas fritas y otros platillos típicos salvadoreños. Luisa posee una reputación muy buena ya que es una mujer muy responsable la cual trabaja muy duro por darles una mejor vida a sus hijas. Ella solicita un préstamo ya que necesita comprar pollo, carne, maíz, y otros ingredientes más para la realización de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Luisa Marina F. A. is 43. She lives in Atiquizaya with her two daughters. She sells tamales, breads with chicken, fried yucca, fried potatoes, and other typical Salvadorian dishes. Luisa has a very good reputation because she is a very responsible woman. She works very hard to give her daughters a better life. She is asking for a loan because she needs to buy chicken, meat, corn, and other ingredients to make her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raw material to make her typical dishes

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La señora Guillermina G. S. tiene 72 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella no estudió, no tiene  hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Guillermina se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y cerveza en su bodega, cuando inicio con Manuela Ramos ya tenía su negocio, los productos los obtiene de un mercado del distrito y las bebidas son abastecidas directamente por la empresa que las elabora, su negocio lo desarrolla en su mismo domicilio.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de S/. 300 soles, el cual invirtió en la compra de productos como galletas, gaseosas y cervezas.
Este crédito de 800 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de cervezas y otros productos como galletas, gaseosas, arroz, azúcar.
Guillermina  tiene como sueño continuar con su bodega e implementar mas y trabajar conjuntamente con su esposo para  crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Guillermina G. S. is 72 years old and lives in the District of Porvenir in Trujillo Province, in the La Libertad region of Peru. She never went to school and doesn’t have any dependent children.
Guillermina sells groceries and beer from her general store. She had already set up her business when she started working with Manuela Ramos. She gets her products from the district market and obtains the drinks directly from the company that makes them. She runs her business in her home.
The first loan she received totalled 300 PEN and she used it to purchase products like biscuits, soft drinks, rice and sugar. She will use this 800 PEN loan to purchase beer and other products like biscuits, soft drinks, rice and sugar.
Guillermina dreams of maintaining her business, increasing her stock and working together with her husband to grow as a microentrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer and other products like biscuits, soft drinks, rice and sugar

loans.name: Milton

texts.es: Milton tiene 23 años, es muy trabajador y responsable, hace 3 años vive con la madre de su hijo de un año en una casa de madera que él mismo construyó. Desde muy joven se dedica a la siembra de cacao, plátano y frutos cítricos, asimismo algunas veces trabaja como peón para sus vecinos, haciéndolo desde las 4 de la mañana hasta el medio día, porque luego de estas horas el calor intenso no le permite trabajar cómodamente, ya que su labor es abrir surcos, quitar las malezas y dejar limpias las chacras. De acuerdo al área trabajada cobra entre 150 y 300 soles, en ciertas oportunidades le pagan 17 soles diarios. Pero cuando sus propios productos están a punto de ser cosechados se dedica a preparar su carga para que cada fin de semana pueda comercializarlos a diversos mercados. En ciertas ocasiones llegan compradores hasta su chacra y aprovecha en vender por arrobas, que consiste en 12 kilos de plátanos y de ese modo acumula mayores ingresos. A Milton lo llena de regocijo ser agricultor, por eso se propone seguir trabajando duro hasta alcanzar una vida muy cómoda. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, en los ciclos concluidos ha demostrado responsabilidad y voluntad de pago, asimismo reitera ese mismo compromiso para este préstamo. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de 10 sacos de fertilizante, considera que le costará un aproximado de 900 a 1000 soles, con el resto de dinero comprará machetes y herramientas agrícolas.
texts.en:
Milton, 23, is very hard working and responsible. For three years he has lived with his one year old son’s mother. They live in a wood house that he built himself. From a very young age he has planted cocoa, bananas, and citrus fruit. Sometimes he works as a field worker for his neighbors. He does this from four in the morning until midday because later than midday the sun is so intense you cannot work comfortably. His job is to plow, weed, and clean the farms. According to the area worked, he charges between 150 and 300 PEN. Sometimes he is paid 17 PEN a day. But when his own products are ready to be harvested, he works preparing them so that every week end he can sell them to various markets. Sometimes buyers come to his farm and he takes advantage of selling by “arrobas”, which consist of 12 kilos of bananas. This way he accumulates greater income. It fills Milton with joy to be a farmer. Therefore, he plans to continue working hard until he reaches a more comfortable life. This is his fifth loan with MFP. In previous loan cycles he has demonstrated responsibility and willingness to pay. He reiterates the same promise with this loan. With the loan he is asking for he plans to buy ten sacks of fertilizer, which will cost approximately 900-1,000 PEN. He will use the rest of the money to buy machetes and farming tools.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and tools

loans.name: Rosa Ines

texts.es: Rosa Ines R. de 56 años de edad vive junto a su esposo, su hija y dos nietos en Ahuachapán. Ella posee un comedor en el cual hace desayunos y almuerzos de lunes a viernes, los fines de semana ella va a las canchas de football para vender agua y jugos. Rosa es una mujer que goza de muy buenas referencias y de clientes leales ya que hace muy buena comida. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar materia prima para la elaboración de su comida.
texts.en:
Rosa Ines R. is 56. She lives with her husband, her daughter, and two grandchildren in Ahuachapán. She has a restaurant where she makes breakfasts and lunches on Mondays through Fridays. On the week ends she goes to the soccer fields to sell water and juice. Rosa is a woman who enjoys very good references and has loyal customers because she makes very good food. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy raw material to make her food.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make her food

loans.name: Virgen Santísima Group

texts.es:
El banco Comunal Virgen Santísima se encuentra ubicado en L. Comunidad D. Ccachuana Millpu, distrito D. Asención, provincia D. Huancavelica. Esta Comunidad,se dedica al comercio, siendo su principal plaza L. ciudad D. Huancavelica, ubicada a 02 Kilómetros D. distancia.

Flora,  es casada y tiene 04 hijos. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. carnes D. alpacas y carneros, negocio que inicio su esposo y ahora elL. dirige y financia con los prestamos que recibe. Se encuentra ahorrando para pagar los estudios D. sus hijos.

Regina, se dedica a L. venta D. abarrotes, ahora cuenta con un local propio, ya que antes alquilaba uno. ElL. quiere invertir su préstamo para surtir mercadería,  así como comprar vitrinas para L. exhibición D. sus productos. ElL. tiene un hijo D. 17 años, que es por quien lucha y ahorra para costear sus estudios.

Elizabeth se inicio en el negocio D. L. venta D. abarrotes, para obtener mas ingresos familiares y D. esa manera ayudar a su esposo, quien se dedica al negocio del calzado. ElL. con cada préstamo abastece su tienda, así como el negocio D. su esposo. Actualmente esta ahorrando para mejorar su tienda y comprar una maquina D. coser para L. zapatería.
texts.en:
The Virgen Santísima Community Bank is located in the Ccachuana Millpu community, Asención district, Huancavelica province. This community works in commerce as the main market in the city of Huancavelica is two kilometers away. Flor is married and has four children. She sells alpaca meat and lamb. Her husband started the business and now she runs it. She finances it with the loans she receives. She is saving to pay for her children’s studies. Regina sells groceries. She now has her own place; before she rented one. She wants to use her loan to stock merchandise. She will buy display cases to show her products. She has a 17 year old son. She struggles for him, and she saves to pay for his studies. Elizabeth started her business of selling groceries to obtain more family income and help her husband who is in the footwear business. With every loan she stocks her store and her husband’s business. She is currently saving to improve her store and buy a sewing machine for the shoe shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock their businesses and buy merchandise

loans.name: Denis Del Socorro

texts.es: Denis C. Rodríguez tiene 44 años de edad, es un hombre casado. Tiene 3 hijos. La actividad económica a la que se dedica a es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Denis inicio este negocio por la necesidad de brindarle a su familia el pan de de cada día,  por lo que Denis empezó a invertir en la compra de ropa y ofrecerlas a sus amistades, al inicio el no poseía mucho la experiencia necesaria para ofrecer sus productos, pero con el tiempo logro instruirse a conocer los que sus clientes necesitaban y así proporcionarles prioridad a sus pedidos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de calzado, perfumes, ropa y bolsos. su deseo es ampliar su negocio para atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Denis C. Rodríguez is 44 years old and is married with three children. He sells general merchandise and has done so for more than 5 years. Denis began his business out of the necessity to feed his family. He began by purchasing clothing, which he offered to his friends. At the outset, he did not have much experience in sales, but with time he learned the needs of his customers and was therefore able to purchase goods efficiently. This loan application is for the purchase of footwear, perfumes, clothing, and purses for his business. He wants to expand his business to give better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business

loans.name: Bernie Joy

texts.en:
Bernie Joy T. is from the town of Misom, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old and married. To make a living, Bernie Joy raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Bernie Joy is just starting this business.

In 2007, Bernie Joy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernie Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Bernie Joy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Bernie Joy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Mario Nelson

texts.es: Mario Nelson L. C. de 45 años reside en Ahuachapán junto a sus dos hijos menores de 12 años y su esposa. Él posee una venta de productos varios como carteras, juguetes, zapatos para niños, ropa, ganchos y colas para el cabello, el tiene ubicada su venta en una de las calles más concurridas de Ahuachapán pero a pesar de esto no siempre es tan favorable la venta debido a que no siempre tiene lo que las personas buscan. Es por esto que Mario solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio y de esta manera aumentar sus ventas lo cual no le sería imposible de alcanzar sin dicho préstamo.
texts.en:
Forty-five year old Mario Nelson L. C. lives in Ahuachapán with his two children under the age of 12 and his wife. He sells various products such as purses, games, children's shoes, clothing, hangers, and barettes. His store is located on one of the busiest streets of Ahuachapán, but, in spite of this, his situation is not very favorable because he doesn't always have what people want. For this reason, Mario is applying for a loan, with which he will purchase goods for his business and increase his sales. Increased sales will not be possible without this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new goods for his business

loans.name: Jacqueline Javiera

texts.es: La Joven Jacqueline Javiera T. Martínez tiene la edad de 32 años, es una joven soltera. Jacqueline se dedica a la actividad económica de venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios se dan por su familia, ya que su Mama estaba muy enferma y tenía que recurrir a una fuente de ingresos para sufragar los gastos, por lo que decide incursionar en el negocio ofreciendo a sus amistades pantalones y camisas, por lo que su ayuda fueron los financiamientos ya que el ayudaron a incrementar su inventario y sabe que son muy importantes para su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de perfumes, cremas, ropa y calzado. El deseo de Jacqueline es ofrecerle a sus clientes el mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Jacqueline Javiera T. Martínez, a young, single woman, is 32 years old. She sells general merchandise and has done so for more than 11 years. She began her business for the sake of her family; her mother was very sick, and Jacqueline had to find a source of income to defray expenses. She decided to begin her business by offering pants and shirts to her friends. Loans helped her to begin and have helped her increase her inventory. She knows that the ability to increase inventory is very important to her business. She requests this loan to purchase perfumes, creams, clothing, and footwear for her business. Her wish is to offer her customers better service.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar Armando B. reside en Atiquizaya Departamento de Ahuachapán el vive junto a su madre de 70 años de edad por la cual debe trabajar día con día. Oscar desempeña su labor como mecánico de moto-taxis, un tipo de transporte el cual consiste en una pequeño cabina o auto el cual es jalado por una moto y el cual puede transportar varias personas, su negocio es muy constante, lo que le permite seguir adelante junto a su madre. El solícita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar repuestos los cuales le faltan muchas veces y por esto no puede hacer las reparaciones que se le piden, perdiendo algunos trabajos, es por ello que el desea mejorar su trabajo a través de dicho préstamo.
texts.en:
Oscar Armando B. lives in the Atiquizaya department of Ahuachapan. He lives with his 70 year old mother whom he supports. Oscar works as a mechanic of motor taxis, a type of vehicle that consists of a small compartment or car that is pulled by a motorcycle and can carry several persons. His business is very steady, which allows him to continue moving ahead with his mother. He is requesting a loan for the purpose of buying replacement parts which he often needs and he is not able to do the requested repairs when he does not have them, sometimes loosing the jobs. He is wanting to improve his work with the help of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase replacement parts.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora G. is from the village of Landing, Baliangao Mis. Occ.. She is 40 years old. Dioscora is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Dioscora raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Dioscora is just starting this business.

In 2004, Dioscora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dioscora is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used as appliance loan. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Dioscora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: appliance loan

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe F. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 25 years old. Ma. Fe is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Ma. Fe runs a family member's business operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of vegetables in the local community. Ma. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Ma. Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ma.
