Fe is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in the shop as well as tuition fees. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Ma. Fe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell, and tuition fees.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita P. is from the village of Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga. She is 58 years old. Teresita is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizer. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Teresita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia G. is from the village of Sulipat, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Letecia is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Letecia raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Letecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Letecia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es: Martha Azucena M. tiene la edad de 40 años, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y todos estudian. La actividad económica es brindar el servicio de costura. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios se dan por que su Mama le enseño este oficio, y a Martha le gusto este medio de supervivencia por lo que decide comenzar a fabricar vestidos y trajes formales, al inicio no poseía muchos clientes por lo que con mucho esfuerzo se gano la confianza de cada uno de sus clientes, y fue así que sus clientes poseían mas confianza para hablar de sus trajes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de telas, tijeras, alfileres entre otras cosas. El sueño de Martha es establecer un taller para proporcionar trabajos a personas que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Martha Azucena M. is 40 years old and has two children in her care who are in school. She makes a living providing seamstress services. She has been in this business for the last 7 years. She started this activity because her mother taught her this trade and Martha likes this way of making a living, She decided to begin making dresses and formal wear. At the beginning she did not have many customers, but through a lot of effort she has gained the confidence of each one of her customers and they are more comfortable talking to her regarding their gowns. The purpose of the loan is to increase her working capital, purchase fabrics, scissors, pins and other such items. Martha dreams of opening her own shop and being able to provide work for persons that need it.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan G. is from the village of Pinig, Dumalinao. She is 32 years old. Susan is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Susan operates a gardening business. Susan has been engaged in her business for years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Susan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Susan is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Susan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “Renacer” es parte del centro focal Panamericana, la población que asiste a este centro se caracteriza por ser mujeres que migraron de comunidades rurales y se asentaron por lugares periurbanos, así las integrantes de la asociación Renacer tiene esta característica, poniendo en práctica negocios que aprendieron en su lugar de origen, como ser el tejido a mano.
La asociación trabaja junto  a Pro-Mujer hace más de cuatro años, su presidenta es Julia G., madre de tres hijos, ella ha formado el grupo en sus inicios con vecinas de su barrio, Julia es una de las que se dedica al tejido de guantes y gorras de invierno, afirma  que con la ayuda de créditos pudo incrementar los ingresos de sus familia, siendo así que ahora puede pagar a dos de sus hijas para aumentar la producción en sus tejidos. Otras  de las integrantes se dedican a la fabricación de  sogas y algunas  tienen negocios de producción de muebles tallados.
La mayoría de las integrantes de este grupo, solicitan créditos para comprar materia prima (lana y madera)
texts.en:
The community association "Renacer" is part of the Panamerican focal center. The women attending the center are women who migrate from rural communities and settle in periurban areas, and the members of the association "Renacer" are no exception, they carry out the kind of business they learned at their place of origen, such as knitting.

The association has been working with Pro-Mujer for more than four years. The president, Julia G., mother of three, started the group with neighbors. Julia is knitting gloves and caps for winter, as well as other members, and she states that with the support of loans she managed to increase her family income and now she is able to pay two of her daughters to increase the production. Other members make ropes and some have businesses making carved furniture. The majority of the members requests loan to buy raw material (wool and wood).

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material

loans.name: Sergio Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Sergio Alberto vive con su esposa y familia; el labora como supervisor en una empresa desde hace 8 años. 
Son una familia estable y unida hacia un mismo objetivo que es “lograr un mejor estilo de vida “. Ellos por el momento están solicitando este crédito para la colocación de protecciones en la puerta delantera y la puerta trasera de su hogar, para mayor protección de la familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Sergio Alberto lives with his wife and family. He has been working as a supervisor at an enterprise for 8 years. They are a stable and united family with the goal "to achieve a better life style". At the moment they are requesting this loan to place protections for the front and back doors of their home, in order to improve the security of the family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Place protections for front and back doors.

loans.name: Juanit

texts.en:
Juanit P. is from the city of Oroquieta City. She is 45 years old. Juanit is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Juanit owns & operates a sari-sari store business in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Juanit has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Juanit joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanit has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Juanit is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Juanit from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Rogelina

texts.es: Rogelina P. S. de 46 años de edad reside en Soyapango junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella posee una panadería en la cual trabaja arduamente junto a su esposo para darles todo lo necesario a sus hijos desde hace más de nueve años. Rogelina solicita un préstamo, ya que es necesario para ellos reparar los automóviles para repartir el pan, es por esto que desean obtener el préstamo ya que sin los carros repartidores obtienen menos ganancias.
texts.en:
Rogelina P. S. is 46 years old, she lives in Soyapango with her husband and her two children. She owns a bakery where she has worked arduously for more than nine years together with her husband in order to provide for their children. Rogelina requests a loan as she needs to repair the vehicles used to distribute the bread. Therefore she wishes to receive the loan as she obtains less earnings without the vehicles.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of vehicles used to distribute bread.

loans.name: Tattehana

texts.es: Tattehana tiene 31 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, está casada y vive en su casa propia. Tiene 3 hijos pequeños que son el motor de su trabajo. Hace 7 años tenía una discoteca, pero este negocio no le fue muy rentable, entonces empezó a vender comida de forma ambulante y al notar el aumento de sus clientes alquiló un local donde permaneció durante un año. Luego, a base de esfuerzo y con el apoyo de su esposo, logró comprar un terreno donde construyó su casa propia y su restaurante denominado “Tati”. Ahora Tattehana ya no se preocupa de pagar un alquiler, solo piensa en cambiar la carta diaria del menú para tener contentos a sus comensales, ya que gracias a ellos y a su trabajo, hoy cuenta  con un techo propio. Hace dos años que tiene su restaurante en su propio local, pero en este negocio lleva 5 años y se siente muy feliz realizándolo; para el futuro espera adquirir una casa en la ciudad, para que sus hijos crezcan y se formen profesionalmente con mayores comodidades. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, en todo este tiempo demostró puntualidad en cada uno de sus pagos, además ella estima mucho a todas las integrantes de su banco comunal y por ello las motiva a trabajar con responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita lo planea invertir en la compra de comestibles para la preparación de sus guisos diarios para su restaurante.
texts.en:
Tattehana is 31 years old, she is a hard-working lady, married and lives in her own house. She has 3 young children who are the engine of her work. 7 years ago she had a disco, but it was not good business so she started selling food as a street vendor.As the number of clients increased she rented a space where she worked for a year. Then, due to her own effort and with the support of her husband, she succeeded in buying land where she built her house and a restaurant called "Tati". Now Tattehana does not worry about paying rent, she only thinks about changing the daily menu to keep clients happy as, thanks to them and her work today she owns her house. She has had the restaurant at her own facility for two years, but has been in this business for 5 years and is very happy. For the future she wants to buy a house in the city for the children to grow and become professionals with more comfort. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she has always been punctual with each of the repayments. She is very fond of the members of her community bank and motivates them to work with responsability. The loan will be invested in buying ingredients to prepare the daily meals for her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for a restaurant

loans.name: Mercy

To make a living, Mercy owns & operates a sari-sari store business in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Mercy has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Mercy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Mercy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La Señora Ana María A. Martínez tiene 57 años de edad. Actualmente es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es brindar los servicios de costura. La ubicación de su negocio es su vivienda, Ana tuvo dificultades ya que su casa de habitación es muy largo por lo que perdió muchos clientes. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio. Y con lo difícil que ha sido mantener este negocio ha hecho muchos sacrificios para que a sus hijos no les falte el pan de cada día. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus vestidos, trajes y pantalones. El sueño de Ana es que sus confecciones sean exportadas al extranjero para que sus prendas sean reconocidas.
texts.en:
Ana María A. Martínez is 57, married, and raising three children. She is a seamstress. Her business is located in her house. Ana had difficulties. Because her house is very far, she lost many customers. She has been in this business for over eight years. It has been difficult to keep her business going, and she has made many sacrifices to feed her children every day. The loan will be used to buy raw materials to make her dresses, suits, and pants. Ana’s dream is that her clothing will be exported to foreign countries so that they will become known.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe L. is a resident of Masabod, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She became a member of Paglaum MPC in May 2009 and obtained a loan to amounting Php 3,000 to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her vegetables and fruit plants.

She's is thankful to Paglaum micro-finance for their programs and services that help the poor people and encourage them to work hard for their future. She wishes to have a better living in the future and to be able to give their children a good future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia vive solamente con su esposo el señor Héctor Alférez, ya que sus todos hijos  están casados.
La señora Antonia y su esposo son propietarios de dos negocios tales como una ferretería  llamada “Ferretería Alférez”  que cuenta con 7 años establecidos y también con la” Tortillería Doña Tota” con 5 años de antigüedad donde elaboran tortillas de harina y venden frijoles recién cocidos de hoya. 
Ellos están solicitando este crédito ya que su proyecto es invertir  en la ferretería para una compra a proveedores y le den mejor precio y obtener una mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Antonia lives with her husband, Héctor Alférez. All of her children are married. Antonia and her husband are the proprietors of two businesses. One is a hardware store called “Ferretería Alférez”, which they have had for seven years. They also have “La Tortillería Doña Tota” where they make flour tortillas and sell beans just cooked from the pot. They have had this business for five years. They are asking for this loan to invest in the hardware store. They will buy from suppliers who give them a better price, and they will get greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their business "Ferreteria Alferez" (Alferez Hardware Store)

loans.name: Fernanrdo Francisco

texts.es: El Señor Fernando Francisco R. García tiene 26 años de edad. Es casado y actualmente tiene 2 hijos y estudian. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de ropa usada. La ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio este negocio con capital propio y con ayuda de su esposa, por lo que juntos han tratado de salir adelante, por lo que Don Fernando traslada la mercadería a los lugares que su esposa ofrece los productos y así es como ha logrado obtener clientes. Y financiamiento será invertido en la  compra de ropa como faldas, pantalones, camisas y ropa para niños. Su deseo es de ampliar su negocio, y además brindar una estabilidad económica para su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
Fernando Francisco R. García is 26, married, and has two children who go to school. He sells used clothes. His business is located in his house. He has had the business for over five years. He started the business with his own money and help from his wife. Together they have tried to get ahead. Fernando takes the merchandise to the places that his wife sells it. That way they have been able to get customers. The loan is to buy clothes like skirts, pants, shirts, and children’s clothes. His wish is to expand the business and provide economic stability to his wife and children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ester

She has been engaged in her business for over eighteen years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Ester joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. Ester is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. This loan will be her third from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business. ------------------------------- About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Elizabeth De La Concepcion

texts.es: Elizabeth de la Concepción M. tiene 34 años de edad. Esta casada con Mario. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y no estudian. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de cosméticos. Con este negocio Elizabeth aporta lo necesario para brindarle a su familia el alimento diario, además su esposo labora como cargador de maletas en el mercado, pero lo que el gana no es suficiente para mantener a sus familia, es por eso que juntos con mucho esfuerzo para sacar adelante a sus hijos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para a compra de cosméticos como lápiz labial, pintura de uñas, Perfumes y cremas. Su deseo es vender todos los productos para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Elizabeth de la Concepción M. is 34 years old. She is married to Mario. She has two children in her care who are not yet in school. She has been in this business for more than 6 years. She makes a living in the buying and selling of cosmetics. With this business Elizabeth makes enough to provide food for her family, her husband also works as a bag carrier at the market, but his income is not enough to support the family. Together they work hard to get their children ahead. The loan that she is requesting is for working capital, to purchase cosmetics such as lipsticks, nail polishes, perfumes and creams. Her wish is to sell all the products to obtain more income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

Rhubie R. is from the village of Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Rhubie is married and has 2 school-aged children. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste etc., in the local community. Rhubie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7750 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Rhubie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rhubie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from GDMPC. Rhubie is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the twelfth loan taken out by Rhubie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem D. is 45 years old and is a villager living in the capital city Phnom Penh She makes a living selling a few fresh fish from her village home for neighbors. Her husband catches the fish from the local public lake. Nhem D. now has five teenage children,  one helps meet the family's expense by working in garment industry, but the others are still unemployed. Nhem D. will be using the loan to purchase tools for her husband's fishing business. She and her husband are pictured.

loans.use: To purchase tools for her husband's fishing business

loans.name: Min's Group

texts.en: This group of borrowers consists of three people. Its leader, Mrs. Min S. E., aged 48, is a mother blessed with five children who are teenagers and still live at home. She currently sells fish that she buys in bulk on credit, and she repays her supplier after she finishes selling. She is married to Mr. Somoeun, aged 56, who is a civil servant officer of the Interior Ministry. Min S. E. is applying for a loan as capital; she will order high quality fish to better meet her customer's demands. The other two borrowers are Norng N., who requests a loan as capital to buy various kind of fruits to sell and Vor M., who will be using this loan to increase capital for her fish-selling business.

loans.use: To order high quality fish to better meet her customer's demands

loans.name: Chinbaatar

texts.en: Chinbaatar D. lives with his wife in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He drives a truck between Arhangai province and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He transports cut wood that he purchases from local woodcutters and sells at a in the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar. When he drives back home, he purchases and transports food products for his wife's business. His wife sells food products in the local food market. Since the start, his business has done very well; his business capital has increased from 350,000 MNT to 1,100,000 MNT. He requests a loan to purchase cut wood and fuel for his transportation business.

loans.use: To purchase planks

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem M. was born in 1962 and is a widowed mother blessed with nine children; almost all are employed in different jobs and provide their income to support the family's living expenses. Hem M. currently works as a bricklayer in the brick-field. Because the family's incomes are not enough to contribute to daily expenses, because foods and merchandise are expensive, Hem M. would like a loan of $800 for capital to begin selling sugar cane juice in the community. This will provide her with additional profits to better meet her family's needs.

loans.use: To begin selling sugar cane juice in the community

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en: Ganzorig D. lives with his wife and 4-year-old daughter in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He has a small repair shop for bicycles. He opened his repair shop in 2008 and since then, his business has stabilized as the locals get acquainted with the service he offers. His business capital has increased from 300,000 MNT to 800,000 MNT. In the future, he hopes to expand his repair shop by selling second-hand accessories for cars and trucks. As the cycling warm season approaches, he expects more customers for his bicycle repair shop. He requests a loan to purchase more bike accessories for his business.

loans.use: To buy bicycle repair supplies

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Erdenechimeg D. is a single mother of five daughters, ages ranging between 11 and 27. She lives with her five daughters and one granddaughter in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her oldest daughter is disabled and stays home. The other daughters are all students. She has a small sewing shop. She started her sewing business in 2003 with one old sewing machine. Her daughters help in her business whenever necessary.  She sews various clothes for women and men and does clothing alterations by request. Since the start in 2003, she has been doing well; her business capital has increased from 100,000 MNT to 500,000 MNT.  Her second daughter is a professional pistol shooter and has recently improved her national ranking to third in the national pistol shooting competition. She says that she hopes to be financially able to support her career in the pistol shooting sport. In addition, she would like to see all her daughters be well educated and pursue their dreams. She requests a loan to purchase raw materials for her sewing business.

loans.use: To buy silk and cotton

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida D. is 51-year old farmer and mother of six children. She grows rice and is currently needing additional capital to run her business. Her farm is mainly the source of their livelihood. With her farm, she is able to buy food and send all her children to school.

The 1-hectare farm that she tills needs  1 unit sprayer, and 2 bags of certified seeds. Now, she is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI to be able to sustain and improve the rate of her harvest.

With God's blessings, she still able to support the growing needs of her family. Now, what she is doing is just maintaining the farm because CEVI is always giving her loan assistance, trainings and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To purchase 1 unit sprayer, and 2 bags of certified seeds

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
To have a piggery business that will support all their needs is Lydia P.'s long term goal. She turns 60 years old this year and has two children. She owns a 1-hectare farm and grows rice for many years already. She said that it is difficult if you have a business but no capital to finance its operations.

Thinking of other way to grow her farm, she apply for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, a KIVA partner in the Philippines. She said that the loan will be used to buy 10 liters of crude oil, 2 sacks of fertilizers and to pay the laborer in the farm.

She was blessed with many opportunities. And she would want maximize everything to make her small business grow. CEVI gives her not just loans. It also gives trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 10 liters of crude oil, 2 sacks of fertilizers and to pay the laborer in the farm.

loans.name: Taras

texts.en:
Taras is married with three kids. His family lives in Stryi. Taras runs a carpentry business. He manufactures and sells doors and flooring. He always offers reasonable prices and friendly customer service, which helped him gain a good reputation in town. Taras has a good discount system for all his wholesale buyers. He has been in this business for six years. He currently has 37,000 Grivnyas in inventory. 

Taras is requesting a 6,500 Grivnya loan to purchase raw materials and increase the assorted merchandise he offers for sale. His business can boast very stable financial standing even in this time of economic volatility. Taras is dreaming about buying a facility for his business to save on rent expenses. We hope financial assistance will help his business grow and develop and make his dream come true one day.

loans.use: To diversify his assorted merchandise for sale

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a mother of four and is married to Esmael, a Muslim. She is 32 years old and lives in a rented apartment house in Pasay City. Three of her children go to school. The youngest one is still a baby. She and her husband jointly manage a footwear sales business in Baclaran, the bargain center of South Manila.

By the grace of God, the business is doing well and is poised to expand. She is requesting a loan of P10,000 to purchase additional shoes and sandals to sell. This is her fourth loan from CCT. She has been faithful in repaying her loans on time.

Ofelia and her husband earn P40,000 each month from their footwear business. They are also able to employ two helpers. From the earnings, they were able to provide for the needs of their family and save for the purchase of their own house and lot.

Ofelia joined CCT in October 2008 and, since then, has looked forward to the CCT fellowship meetings, because she considers the meetings to be bonding time with her fellow CCT members. The CCT weekly fellowship meetings are a venue for CCT community partners/clients to get together to study the word of God, participate in fellowship together, and to encourage one another, as well as to update their loans and savings data.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married with two grown children. He is a small entrepreneur from Stryi selling groceries wholesale and retail. Ivan owns a small storage facility in the outskirts of his hometown and a store in one of the villages in the mountains. He has much experience working in this sphere of trade – Ivan launched his business over 14 years ago. His business is known for a reasonable pricing policy and free delivery service. 

Ivan is currently making about 10,000 Grivnyas of income. One of his plans for the near future is to buy a facility for his business that he could own instead of renting a building. Ivan is always on the go. He is very determined and knows how to achieve his goals. Moreover, he tries to keep an active social position and organizes an annual winter festival for kids in the local school, which is something kids always look forward to. This time Ivan is seeking a 15,000 Grivnya loan to purchase three tons of sugar for his business and expand it more. He is hoping to use the generated profit to finish remodeling his apartment, which he couldn’t complete due to some financial constraints.

loans.use: To purchase three tons of sugar

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with three grown sons. She is from the small town of Novyi Rozdil, Stryi region. Galina started her retail sales business about 15 years ago. She sells bed linens, blankets, towels and other household items, which are always in demand in the local market. Galina is well known for her outstanding planning abilities and clear vision for her small business. These characteristics helped her venture grow up to 15,000 Grivnyas in gross income today.

Galina is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to increase her assorted inventory and income as a result. She is hoping the current loan will help her keep the business running and sustainable despite all the gloomy economic forecasts in Ukraine. As a loving Mom, Galina is hoping to see all her kids settled in life and is doing her best to assist them in this. Galina has impeccable credit history, which is another good proof she is a reliable borrower capable of loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase her assorted merchandise

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Маматкулова Мавлюда-  женщина 1955-го года рождения, замужем, имеет 4-х детей.Занимается откормом и  купля-продажей скота . Её муж  Маматкулов Абдулажон  покупает скот на скотных рынках кишлаков и сёл по низким ценам. Мавлюда  откармливает купленный скот дома в течении недели и продает на скотном рынке Джаббор-Расуловского района. Кроме этого она и её муж работают в колхозе. Там они имеют небольшой земельный участок и выращивают овощи и пшеницу. Мавлюда и её муж рады, что кредитуются у нас и намерены продолжить сотрудничество с нашей организацией.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Mavluda M. is a woman who was born in 1955, married and has four children. She feeds and sells cattle. Her husband Abdulajon Mamatkulov buys the cattle on the markets of other villages at low prices. Mavluda feeds the cattle at home for a period of one week and then sells on the cattle market of the Jabbor-Rasulov region. Besides that her husband works in a collective farm. There they have a small plot of land and grow vegetables and wheat. Mavluda and her husband are glad that they take out loans from us and are determined to continue working with our organization.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Nusrat Saeed Akhtar Group

texts.en:
Nusrat baji is the group leader. She has a good nature, all of the group members respect her and compliment her good behavior. She is a hard working lady. She sews clothes day and night to share the financial burden of her husband. All of her members have embroidery businesses to share somehow the financial expenses of their families. Nusrat baji is married to Mr. S. A. who has a paint selling business. He has 3 years of experience in this business. Nusrat baji is applying for a loan to buy paint boxes to expand her husband’s paint selling business. Shahla baji and Farida begum baji and Naheed A. baji each want a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and clothes) for their decorative embroidery businesses. Najma baji wants a loan to repair her tractor. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy paint boxes to sell

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is divorced and raises two teenage children herself. She owns a kiosk at the central market and sells children's clothing. Her gross monthly income is 5,000 UAH.

Tatyana has been in this business for six years. She started it when her husband left her with two small children. Being a hard-working person, Tatyana was able to develop this business. During last year, she opened the second location. Her business goal is to win repeated customers.

Tatyana would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to purchase seasonal inventories. She hopes to receive additional income and take better care of her son and daughter.

loans.use: To purchase inventories

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Махмудов Журабек-молодой человек 1979-го года рождения, женат, имеет двоих детей. Журабек  имеет торговую точку в центре Джаббор-Расуловского района, где торгует продуктами питания.Здесь же он организавал  пивной бар и продажу шашлыков по вечерам. У него очень много клиентов. На полученный кредит он планирует расширить своё место торговли и увеличить ассортимент товара за счёт  напитков и кондитерских изделий. Так же Журабек хочет накопить денег на продолжение высшего образования.Он благодарен КИВА за подержку его бизнеса.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Jurabek M. is a young man, born in 1979, married and has two children. Julabek has a vendor spot in the center of the Jabbor-Rasulov region where he sells food. In the same place he has organized a beer pub and sales of shashliks (shish kabobs) in the evenings. He has a lot of customers. He plans to use the loan to expand his place of business and increase the assortment of goods with drinks and confectioneries. Jurabek also wants to save money to continue his higher education. He is thankful to Kiva for the support of his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bud food

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with one child. She sells various decoration items at the central market in Ordzhonikidze city. Her profit is 3,500 UAH per month.

Oksana has been in this business for 14 years. It is a small city and people know each other quite well. Being an honest and just nice person, Oksana was able to win many clients who became her repeated customers. Many people buy items from her to give to someone as birthday gifts as well as to decorate their own houses and apartments. 

Oksana would like to borrow 6,000 UAH to increase the assortment. Her business goal is to open a small shop to sell similar items and have better conditions for her customers.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Joahna

texts.en:
Mrs.B. is residing at Poblacion Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old, married and blessed with only 1 child who is still an infant.She owns and operates a business venture by raising pigs for sale. She has been engage in this business for more than 5 years and earns 18,000.00 for every 5 months.
She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mrs. B. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 25,000.00 PHP which will be used to buy additional piglets to raise,and feeds.This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Joahna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.

loans.use: To purchase additional feeds and baby pigs to raise

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Mrs. Josefina T. is residing at Sulipat, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 65 years old, married and has 3 children who are already adults. She owns and operates a business venture in retail sector. She has been engage on her business for more than 20 years and earning 5,000.00 per month from the said business.
Mrs T. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Josefina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.

loans.use: additional capital for her existing business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn L. is from the city of Oroquieta City. She is 52 years old. Marilyn is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a hog raising business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita P. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 60 years old, married, and has one adult child. Anita owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling ice candy in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Anita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita F., a 33-year old mother of seven, has a positive attitute and is hardworking and tenacious. She works double-time as mother and micro-entrepreneur. Her family has been living in a rented house in Malaria, Caloocan City for the past six years. Raising her brood has been a financial challenge, so her husband decided to work as an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW) to provide for the family's needs and to save money for the education of their children.

On her own, Marita tends to the family's electronics repair business. She earns income by providing repair services and selling unredeemed repaired items. Her membership in the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) gave her access to additional capital for the business. She is now applying for her second loan of PHP4,000, which she will use to purchase electronic parts for her growing repair service.

Marita's business earnings are the main source of income for the family. They have been particularly helpful in sending five of her children to school (one high school, four elementary). Marita's business has also blessed other families in their community by employing two service workers and generating income for them.

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response to poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered on the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena P. has been dreaming of buying another hectare of rice farm. Like any other businessperson, she wants to be successful always in all her business endeavors to support her children's education like paying the books, school projects and tuition fees. Nena turns 49 this year. Her husband, Felix P., encourages her and always expresses support for their farm business.

A long time ago, she became an active member of Community Economic Ventures Inc., a KIVA partner in the Philippines. But the reason why she would like to apply for a loan is that she needs additional capital in her business. The loan will go far in buying the necessary urea fertilizer and insecticides. 

The weekly meetings at CEVI encourage her more to stick in the program. In CEVI, clients have an opportunity to meet other entrepreneurs and do some conversation about their businesses. They also learn in biblical reflections aside from the loans that they received in the program. CEVI provides not just credit. It also offers training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase urea and insecticide

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mr. Kong D. and his wife are shown in the picture. Kong D. is 35. He owns a motorbike that he uses to provide a picking-up service to passengers;  he earns approximately $3 per day to meet his family’s daily living expenses. His wife works selling fresh fish in the local busy market. Kong D. will be using the Kiva loan to replace his old motorbike, which is not attractive. The rest of the loan will be used to buy a boat to fish in the Tunle Sap River, to earn additional income.

loans.use: To replace his old motorbike

loans.name: Alyn

texts.en:
Alyn A. is from the village of Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Alyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Alyn owns & operates a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Alyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Alyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Alyn is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Alyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie R. is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Vergie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Vergie owns & operates a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc., in the local community. Vergie has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vergie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vergie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. Vergie is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Vergie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel M. is happy working in the rice field, voluntarily helping his parents earn a family income. He has been supporting his siblings to finish their studies. He dreams of having his own rice farm someday. Though he is still young, Daniel is starting to worry about his future.

The farm that he tills now is owned by his parents. He wants to make it productive to help them. He is looking for additional funds to buy the farm needs. He is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI to purchase complete fertilizer, Urea, Crude oil, herbicides and to pay the other laborer on his farm.

Joining in The CEVI program develops more than business skills. He has an opportunity to meet other businessmen talking about their small enterprises. CEVI provides credit assistance, training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizer, Urea, Crude oil, herbicide and to pay the laborer.
